title: 2020.8 告诉你吧，世界，我不相信
body:
**1.比特币与宗教**

下面一个观点，可能有进化心理学方面的解释，但我不知道具体是怎样。

人总是被未来的，彼岸的，当下得不到的，甚至比自己大得多东西/故事吸引住，可以理解为一种宏大的叙事/意义的来源，宗教在这方面表现出色。天堂，顿悟等彼岸的东西，成了很多人一生的追求。

现在，“一聪一美元，一币一别墅”，似乎正在成为少部分人的彼岸。为了达到这个目标，付出的努力，和进入天堂，得阿耨多罗三藐三菩提，看上去差不多的努力。

我对比特币没有信仰，但囤币越来越像修行，或者处于对上帝的虔诚需要做的：耐心，朴素，诚实，精进，不骄不躁。

或许，我还是低估了比特币的影响，这个故事正在成为新型的宗教，甚至连逻辑本身，都被它吸纳进去。因为有人正儿八经会分析为什么多年后，比特币可以这么高。

出于这种考虑，我觉得自己对比特币是有信仰的，底牌不是拥有更多的比特币，而是成为更好的自己。

**2.广义的比特币**

狭义的比特币，已经讨论的更多了。
我想谈谈广义的“比特币”，过去，现在，未来不断地出现过。
如果我把比特币定义成：那些离经叛道的，不按规矩出牌的，不符合主流价值观的，对社会有冲击作用的，一小撮人在尝试的，并且有潜力的技术创新，那么很多都属于广义比特币的范畴。
这种创新，才是我们了解狭义比特币之后，下一站要去关注的东西。从这个角度讲，过去的比特币叫相对论，叫互联网，叫汽车，叫B站，未来的比特币，叫什么我不知道，但肯定是大多数人一开始就不喜欢的，看不上的东西。如果你能从狭义的比特币里带走什么的话，除了财富之外，还要带走一样很重要的东西，叫：告诉你吧，世界，我不相信。

**3 虚假与真相**

大脑的天字号使命是活下去，哪怕你看见100次草绳中，有99次不是蛇，为了那个1%，大脑也会升起警惕与害怕的感觉。这种感觉是虚幻的，为了这种感觉而害怕，实际上没必要，可惜大脑没有被设计成了解真相。这种场景发生在很多场合：
害怕面对观众，哪怕观众都是临时的过客。
损失的厌恶，哪怕我们很容易就能买到更多；
食物的期待，哪怕一顿不吃也饿不死；
地位的追求，哪怕我们还可以其他追求；
……
所有这些可以更好的活下去，或者可能活不下的感觉，都会让大脑追求或者远离。
但实际上，这些东西都是虚幻的，失去观众还有下一批；损失苹果还有橘子；这顿不吃还有下一顿能吃；没有地位，还可以追求知识……
我们活在一个通过感觉，而不是通过思辩的世界里，而有一种方法可以让我们脱离动物性，接近真相，就是冥想，感受自己的感受，
几年前，我遇到一个老师，45分钟的课，老师上来就把灯关了，说今天不讲课，大家就安静坐在教室里，保持呼吸，感受呼吸，觉察自己在呼吸。于是我们一脸懵逼发呆45分钟，下课散去。
现在我隐约知道老师的用意了，他在用这种方式让我们接近真相。

**4 进化与文化**

繁衍是物种的天性，任何有利于物种繁衍的行为，都会收到奖励，不利于繁衍的行为会收到惩罚。自然选择在这方面是个伟大的设计师。人类也是如此，热爱美食的原因是提供能量，这种热爱的感觉直接替代思考，内化到基因里。 “快感和痛感一定是伴随着生物体有益或有害的过程而进化出来的主观产物，进化而来的目的或根源在于驱使生物体追寻一种，躲避另一种。￼￼” 不光是自然选择在塑造着人类，文化也是一种塑造的过程。一个最直接的例子是关于财富的追求。这种普遍的现象就体现在大量的人在玩合约，讨论行情。 短时间内获得大量的财富，对于地位的提升，能量获取，繁衍生息都是有直接而又快速的好处。￼在自然选择和文化的双重作用下，人对于暴富有一种天生的追求。￼它的本质也是服务于物种的繁衍，更好的繁衍。

 所以当我看到很多人孜孜不倦地在追求财富密码的时候，我都觉得人类不过是一种动物。 很多行为，出生就注定了，像被编了程一样。

**5 波色-爱因斯坦凝聚态**

你一定听过二八定律，或者马太效应。从网络的角度来讲，这种强者恒强的底层逻辑是：
生长机制与偏好选择。
生长机制：在一个网络中，不断有新的节点产生，连接到这个网络中。
偏好选择：那些新的节点，为了能快速连接到整个网络的所有节点，它会优先选择最大的节点进行连接。
两个机制合起来，让那些一开始就在网络中占据有利位置的节点，获得越来越多的连接，而那些连接数少的节点，慢慢成为边缘节点。
知道这个知识点之后，来分析一下以太坊。
以太坊处在一个不断有新的“去中心化事物”出来的网络中。你可以把“去中心化事物”理解成一个个节点，比如各类DeFi应用。这些节点，因为以太坊丰富的开发套件和强大的基础设施、人群基数，会优先和以太坊连接。
事情发展下去，会出现一种独特的状态：波色-爱因斯坦凝聚态。这是一个物理学概念：几乎全部原子都聚集到能量最低的量子态，无法逃离。比如微软的windows操作系统，就处于这种垄断状态，新人一旦与windows建立连接，他就出不去了。
以太坊可能也会出现这种情况，哪怕windows很难用，哪怕以太坊目前很拥堵。刚才和朋友跳大神，说：我有种很朦胧的感觉，以太坊还要涨。道理就在此。

**6 一件悲伤的事情**

我对最近火热的DeFi，一点冲劲都没有。比如要不是同事跟我说波场的justswap，都不知道还有这玩意儿。这是一件悲伤的事情，伤点在于：我居然对更边缘的新事物不感兴趣了。
我一点都不喜欢那些群主无脑的喊单，教你如何从imtoken，输入合约地址之类的东西，我觉得就是割韭菜的垃圾。

但这不就是我们当初玩比特币的时候，那些看不起比特币的人的想法吗？我怎么就从屠龙的少年，变成了恶龙了呢？

95后的朋友，对这些东西的起劲程度，和我对这些东西的漠然态度，似乎已经是两拨人了。
Blockstream首席战略官说，比特币是货币奇点，会吸收一切。我喜欢这句话，但对我的害处在哪里呢？是我拒绝了其他可能性。

更广地看，囤币依然是边缘行为，但小世界里看，囤币是中心行为，已经受到更边缘的人看不起了。一个96年的币圈好友，说他永远不会买比特币，当我觉得他是错误的时候，我已经不再是少年了。真是一件悲伤的事情。

**7 历史的好处**

我现在喜欢读技术史，特别是某种技术，某种创新刚出来的时候，看大佬们的态度和反应。
昨天在图书馆重读《必然》，作者KK回忆起互联网刚开始的时候，某报业公司高管对该技术轻蔑的态度，看得我很过瘾。KK甚至建议该公司去买abc.com这个域名，那会超级便宜。还说要买下mcdonalds.com送给麦当劳，不过这些公司都拒绝了。
现在回想，当然觉得他们大错特错，不过身在当初，大部分人也会觉得互联网也是不起眼的小东西。有很多角度可以解释这种现象，不管怎么样，这种历史让我觉得，太阳底下没有新鲜事，更不会对某些言论一惊一乍的。

就像万老师@GK同人于野 说的：
了解很多历史并不等于能预测未来，你只是对当今的事情不感到惊讶而已。
如同你见过很多次下雨，今天又下雨了，你说，啊，下雨不奇怪，我们这里经常下雨。你甚至能指出为什么这个地方一到了这个季节就爱下雨。但是要问你下一场雨什么时候下、下多大，你不知道。
而如果雨季不是年年来，而是几十年才来一次，那就只有历史学家不惊讶。
所以面对下雨能不惊讶，这其实也不错。

**8 “一个观点，不一定对。”**

“一个观点，不一定对。”
这是我之前发表看法时候，开头就会提到的句式。这是一种对大家提醒，也是不想走极端的方式，虽然很多时候，我觉得自己的观点正确。之前有个粉丝就因为这句话取关了，他觉得我不够自信，我也很无奈。我观察了一个博主，从几百到几千的粉丝增长，微博里充满了“偏见”的内容，这种内容是有市场的，他迎合了一部分人，让这部分人看着舒服，这是一种同质性的体现。有立场的东西，总比没有立场的中立来的受欢迎，但我总觉得这样会让自己偏离“正确”。
在政治领域也是如此，懂王充满了立场，甚至在一些学者眼里满是错误，但这会勾起一些人的共鸣：我TM就是这么想的，他帮我说出来了，特朗普2020！
如果想涨粉，那就走极端，如果想智慧，那就说：我不一定对。和菜头的文章最后总会提一句：我说的都是错的，我觉得道理就在此。

**9 选择性偏差**

我们的观察，往往来自于偏向性的样本，取决于这些样本如何选取。 比如，我们看到的很多的新闻事件都是被一些媒体有选择性地播报。媒体为什么会选择这样的新闻呢？其中很重要的原因是为了利益或者为了政治正确，或者是为了某种偏好选择。往往在这种情况下真相很有可能会被忽略或者隐藏。如果我们看多了这样的新闻事件，看多了这样的样本，我们就会形成自己的一套判断，以为自己就是正确的，实际上在另一群人看来这种正确，可笑至极。 在两种截然不同的环境下长大的人，我们相互觉得对方是错误的，认为自己这一方无比正确。

title: Passive Income Through Staking As An NFT Feature/Benefit
body:
[![](https://cdn.substack.com/image/fetch/w\_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F48690fc1-7eda-4684-9d8e-adbdfa480d86\_320x320.png)](https://cdn.substack.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F48690fc1-7eda-4684-9d8e-adbdfa480d86\_320x320.png)

NFTs enable us to create new financial applications that can issue tokens representing anything from stocks and bonds to cars and real estate, essentially anything you can think of.

The Ethereum blockchain has been often called " programmable money, "meaning that it allows anyone to create and issue their own token on top of the ethereum protocol. 

NFTs can be split into two types: restricted and unrestricted. Unrestricted NFTs allow for the ownership, buying/selling, or trading of an asset. Restricted NFTs are different in that they do not support any sort of transferability.

NFTs do not generate income in their basic form. When they're utilized to create vTokens, on the other hand, they may become part of the decentralized finance landscape.

## NFT Vaults & Staking

Staking is a less resource-intensive alternative to mining. It entails maintaining funds in a bitcoin wallet to keep the security and functionality of a blockchain network. Staking, in a nutshell, is the process of securing assets to earn incentives.

Staking has been adopted by various cryptocurrencies, including VeChain, Tezos, Decred, Navcoin, and many others. In fact, most NFT projects are likely to start staking as a means of generating passive income from their platform. [ZombieToadz](https://opensea.io/collection/zombietoadzofficial), a [CryptoToadz](https://opensea.io/collection/cryptoadz-by-gremplin) derivative, has already embraced this approach, creating $BRAINZ tokens tied to their vault's acquisition of Toadz themselves, staking the value of the pool against the value of the Toadz.

The ability to stake is not unique to NFTs. However, staking has become necessary for gaining the required utility out of NFT vTokens.

Vaults are storage facilities for NFTs. Vaults are utilized by vToken issuers to offer token holders access to their locked assets.

Anyone with an Ethereum address can generate a vault for any NFT asset. Anybody may deposit eligible NFTs into a vault to create a fungible NFT-backed cryptocurrency called a "vToken."

vTokens utilize NFTs as collateral to be held in escrow during a secure, peer-to-peer lending system facilitated by decentralized exchanges. In short, one party leaves an asset locked up as collateral, and the other receives a loan from that asset at a reduced interest rate.

The creator of a vToken can specify the number of underlying assets in a vault and will also have to outline the pricing mechanism, which should be linked directly to the price of the underlying asset or basket of assets. The vToken protocol has been implemented on Ethereum.

A vToken is a financial instrument that generates an income from the underlying asset it represents. This income can occur through interest, dividends, or coupons paid out regularly.

A vToken representing a digital property can pay out an ongoing fractional income to its owner, which increases in value based on the underlying asset's performance. A tokenized fraction of an NFT would result in ongoing fees that can replace traditional income streams.

Users can earn protocol fees, trade fees as a liquidity provider, and farm with vTokens as loan collateral. vTokens will be a crucial part of building decentralized applications that can rival their centralized counterparts in speed, efficiency, and scalability.

## Protocols Designed For Passive Income

Staking protocols allow for broader distribution and increased fairness of delivery since they establish a new standard for the settlement and transfer of tokens. Platforms that utilize these protocols will benefit from the increased reach and new fairness of distribution resulting from adoption.

New content may be quickly used to generate liquid markets for virtual assets, which will maximize their utility.

Different types of staking protocols may offer distinct advantages in the decentralization of finance that is not available in today's tradmarkets.

Lending protocols allow for the creation financial assets that can be used as collateral on a decentralized lending platform.

P2P lending is a massively underserved market but one ripe with potential. The introduction of next-generation credit scoring and asset tokenization will provide the conditions needed to advance lending onto the blockchain.

Asset-backed lending could provide borrowers with high liquidity, low margin rates, fast settlement timeframes, and efficient risk management protocols.

Collateralized stablecoins represent another class of asset tokenization that can be used as a means of payment or store of value for holding fiat currency on the Ethereum mainnet.

NFTs are generally relatively illiquid and difficult to price. Staking protocols make speculating in the NFT market a lot easier. It also enables platforms to price and sell their NFTs faster and provide customers with a better user experience.

This allows for near-instant transaction speeds and dramatically reduces transaction costs.

NFTs are an incredibly flexible class of digital property, with applications in art, gaming, finance, and more. This technology will also enable decentralized organizations to control their own governance protocols that do not sacrifice transparency or decentralization. Passive income is a valuable mechanism for monetizing NFTs and generating value from digital properties.

Collateralized stablecoins are extremely useful for businesses that primarily operate on the Ethereum mainnet. A collateralized stablecoin can protect businesses from price fluctuations while at the same time increasing their ability to transact with customers in a fast, efficient manner.

The next-gen protocols aim to be an industry standard that enables the tokenization of any asset or financial contract to create a new class of next-generation decentralized finance (DeFi) applications.

## Recommended Reading

title: 给未婚者的警示:婚前选错伴侣，遇上人渣毁一生
body: 先说一点，又写这些事情，可能有人会骂我啥事都报怨，但我想说的是，不喜欢可以不看。写这文章的目的的确有一吐为快的想法，毕竟憋在心里久了容易生病。但我更想让未婚的男女能多吸取我的经验，尽量选择好自己的伴侣，人生能少些痛苦。    好久没有逛某风了，毕竟一个人既然孝敬父母，又要养孩子，必须得多挣钱。所以，我不但努力上班挣钱，还通过写些文章什么的多挣外快，努力的把一个家维持好。但今天，已经通过法院判决离婚的我，再次受到前夫的纠缠，哪怕已经离婚，哪怕我一个人辛苦怀孩子，一个人辛苦生孩子，一个人把孩子养到两岁多。而他，做为一个国家公务员，一个警察，仅凭一颗精子和法庭上调解的1000元抚养费，就享有一个月看四次的孩子的权利。而且孩子也跟着他姓。捡着如此大的便宜不但没有半分感恩之心，还在离婚后依然纠缠着算婚姻内开支的帐。说实话，和他相处的几年，我的收入基本上是用完了的，我是一个不乱用钱的人，不打牌，不喝酒，甚至在生活地朋友都没有几个的人。我的生活很简单，上班在单位，下班回家。和他一起的几年，仅有的朋友喊吃饭我都很少去。那几年，因为刚买房的缘故，我也不在外面洗头和在外面洗面。也就是我的所有工资收入开支对我私人来说只有买房还房贷，偶尔的周情送礼，过年时给点儿钱给我父母。其他所有的钱基本上开支在我们小家上了。就这样，我和他从同居到分居，一起过了三年多，分开时他身上至少有十万银行存款，我身上是不到六万。然后我一个人在外租房怀孕，生下儿子并养到两岁多。一直到法院五月调解我们离婚。这三年多我一个人养着儿子，他一分抚养费也没有给。但是离婚时他那么高的收入却没有一分银行存款，唯一能拿到证据的共同财产就是那台车和住房公积金。还有就是这些年我每年交的一千元的保险他也拿来当共同财产分了。最后 的结果是他总共只补偿了一万八千五百元给我，孩子抚养费他只给一千一个月，只拿到十八岁。我们所有经济纠缠就是这样。本来作为夫妻，是分不清哪些钱是哪个拿来用的，也不应该分谁给谁用的。但他从不当成一家人，非要分你的我的，就依他这么分，他短信中提及的那几笔经济往来，有些的确有，有些是没有的。但是他却闭口不提他从我这儿拿走的钱，比如他装修房子买家电拿走的七千元，他妈死亡给他了两万九，他却只承认六千。但我心坦然，我敢对天发挚，既没骗他的钱私存小金库，总体来说，我都没有用到他的钱。我反倒自己一个人这几年养着本应该我们两人养育的孩子。就这样，我也懒得找他要，我把所有的空余时间都拿来拼命挣钱养家了，所以我的孩子过得不比别人家的孩子差，他想吃的想穿的想玩的我都满足，下班后我也一直陪着孩子。我的想法很简单，让孩子快乐的长大，不让他觉得自己因为没有父亲在身边而生活会比别人差。所以我和我妈妈平时省吃俭用，自己不吃不穿，都是为了孩子。    原本以为离婚了，事情算告一段落了，几年来他找我算帐这种事情可以结束了。没想到，离婚了，他还来找我算这些帐，真是一辈子都不得清静。怎么算帐的大家可以看我上传的短信。  有点儿啰嗦，现在说正题。作为未婚的人，你们要明白，婚姻的确是一件大事情，再有本事的人，如果你遇到了人渣，这一生都可能过得不太清静。而如果你再软弱些，有可能会毁你的一生。所以选择伴侣特别重要。无论男女。因为人渣有渣男，也有渣女。那么要注意些什么呢？     一，清醒的认识到婚姻就是一场交换。所谓的爱情只是哄单纯少年的。那个只适合谈恋爱，不适合婚姻。毕竟婚姻要涉及柴米油盐的，要食人间烟火的。所以，千万别只是因为爱情结婚。这是我犯的最大的错。当初 嫁给这个男人时，我什么都没有要，就图他对我好，认为自己有稳定的收入，不要男人拿钱来养养，以为能相互扶持一辈子。结果是我不想用他的钱，也没用他的钱，他却认为我不但没拿钱出来用，还到同学同事到处说我诈骗他的钱。我就想不通了，作为夫妻，我用他的钱本来也是可以的，这没用还被说成诈骗了。所以，我劝你们别象我一样单纯，以为自己不要对方养，就不会有经济矛盾。有些人是你哪怕给他用了，他还不承认，还会觉得你没达到他的要求。    二，无论男女，自己要有能生存的本领，这样哪怕遇到人渣，你还能转身离开，自己还能好好活下去。要是你相信了爱情，把自己的所有钱都拿对方用了，你又不能挣钱，那你的生存都困难了。更没办法争夺孩子的抚养权。   三，在婚前，你虽然 有不用对方钱也能生存的能力，但是要学会去辨别对方是不是自私到钱都不给配偶和孩子用的那种人。也许是因为独生子女，父母当掌上明珠养大的原因，现在自私到钱只愿意自己用的人很多了。有一部分人观念里你的就是我的，我的还是我的，这种人你要能和他过一辈子，不光需要气度，还需要能力。比如我，就算是我愿意把自己挣的全部拿出来用，但是我拿出来的钱也满足不了他那颗不知感恩和贪婪的心。何况我们还得养父母和孩子，是没办法把自己挣的所有钱给对方用的。    四，选择伴侣，人品很重要。不能只看脾气性格钱财这些。有没有责任感是第一要求。有责任感的人，不会永远穷。我一直认为，能同甘共苦的，才是真正的夫妻。那种婚前都要求AA制，把你的我的钱财分得很清楚不愿意给你用的人，不适合成为夫妻。可惜我在婚前没有意识到这点儿。还一直固守着那些所谓的鸡汤上讲的，女人不要用男人的钱的傻原则。正因为我们在婚前我没刻意的去问他要钱用，在外开支我总和他争着值钱，才导致了婚后我们因为经济上的原因而走不下去。不得不承认，“一个男人给你钱用不一定是爱你，但不给你钱用一定不爱你”这句话把男人的本质是完全说出来了的。有时候，钱就是过虑渣男的最好武器，可是我却完全没有用过。    五，这个世界有好人也有坏人。我们既不能因为受过伤害认为这个世界上就没有好男人或者好女人了，也不能单纯的相信每个男人女人都是值得相信的，婚前应该考验时还得考验，应该防备的时候还得防备。    就说这么多吧，愿我今天放弃挣钱的时间为大家写的这些，能让很多人逃过我这种情劫，愿善良的人能遇到良伴。

title: Hope less, act more
body:
I quitted my job 10 days ago, and since then I’ve been busy from 8am to 12pm almost everyday, weekend included.

I’ve learnt a lot in a week… Being able to just build.

No hierarchy, no managers forcing their way for signalling, no bullshit tasks to serve marketing without value to the end user, no attendance to placeholder meeting, working from the comfort of my home, not a crowded noisy open space, with an AC dripping on my head.

By doing so, I’m indirectly investing in projects I believe in and own, in myself through learning valuable skills, and in a better future for humanity through the development of decentralisation (especially finance…).


_____________________________

**The ascension**

I’ve been hoping to reach this situation for a long time.

Since my first disheartening internships in “startups“ flipping a few interns and State’s subsidies.

Where I realised that nobody knew what they were doing, that it wasn’t even even important as long as you were faking it, the grand mascarade.

I refused to bend.

\*\*\*

Since my first contact with Bitcoin 11 years ago, my first mining Raspberry PI, first Butterfly-labs ASIC miners, paid at the price of eating rice and pepper for months to save these 350e of internship minimum wage.

There, I first though about what was money and trust, and that alternative to the current centralised structures were possible. **Hopium**!

\*\*\*

Since my first depression right after joining my first real job. Being overused by a service company, hoping that I would ultimately receive what they promised me if I did this other 10k shell scripting mission.

There, I learned that people were livestock, assets for corporations. And that equally people were cattle, not willing to think or stir shit to improve their condition. That the managers and commercials were the slave masters behind friendly masks, open bars and “team building”.

I refused to comply with the status quo, no bending. The grass must be greener higher up.

\*\*\*

Since my first open source position, joining prestigious W3C people and Adobe guys. What could go wrong, these were the Linux Beard-necks people I wished to work with for a decade since I first discovered Linux. 

There, I realised that I was one of the few actually building, and that all the advisors and board members where doing figuration, lending a name for shilling, reaping an additional effortless revenu stream.

I refused to work for other for a fixed wage, under the excuse of “open source”, that again was heavily subsidised by several States. I could do the same in a more profitable place probably?

\*\*\* 
  
 Since my first quality job, with quality people. Serving million of users. 
 Well this one was quite fun, and enlightening. Especially thanks to a manager that had a philosophical approach to his work. And that had a good ethic. That never got upset, master of his emotions and mind. Very technically able, so were the teammates. 
  
 There I discovered that the smartest people, sometimes live the poorest lives. 
 Some, blind chasing the “passive revenue” and other bs, were living in small places on a mattress, eating daily Uber eat.

I refused to settle comfortably, I always need something new anyway. Maybe there is no problem its just me finding excuses to avoid settling? 

Time and health are finite resources, that no money can buy back. Knowledge should be cultivated, fully managerial positions refused. 

\*\*\*

Since my first experience in a “family office”, what? The name doesn’t sound friendly?  Won’t even mention the 2 years lost there, professionally speaking.

I did invest in my body and mind out of boredom though. I learn to do Lapidary, Silversmithing, I trained Muay Thai 4/5 days a week, practiced meditation daily and studied greek philosophers. (Yes I had that much time. And without these alt skills I would not have made it out sound and sane).

There I learnt to bend the mind, but on my conditions. I also learnt that only I am sovereign over my choices, that I do what tf I want. (I always did anyway, ask my mom, but in a primitive way, without the theory. Now I had Socrates to back me up)  

\*\*\*

Since my latest experience in a Blockchain company, a good one, but that is still a company, mostly focused on pleasing shareholder and receiving fat fundings.

The funniest was that the funding was announced in town hall without any mention of what it would be used for? Nobody asked, and at that point I was too tired to always swim against the tide…

\*\*\*

Reflecting about the **why** now…

Why tf would I endure low pay, high pressure and responsibilities (working in C/C++/swift native iOS).

Why would I keep working for other people that were reaping the benefits without sharing much, and I don’t even ask in financial terms, I would have been happy with a warm head petting at that time.

Mostly cowardice, nobody to blame but myself. To disappoint others, to trust my guts, to risk loosing some comfort.

The same cowardice that made me sell my bitcoins 12$. Too scary to not be able to buy cigs, to have to ask people for money (in that order at that time).

Also mindlessness, because who got time to think when your living pay-check to pay-check, drinking and using drugs to relieve stress and because it’s the social norm of where you come from.

`Along the way I met a nice anon crypto friend, with whom I still talk almost monthly, although sporadically communicating with each other, he is been kind of a lighthouse in all this life whirlwind. After half a decade I still haven’t seen his face nor know much about the physical him.`


_____________________________

**Breaking free**

Last year I built the free app PointCloudKit, in an intense push, doing Metal GPU code, interfacing python/c/c++ and computer vision with iOS/Swift, on my free time. It was great learning, good tech, and totally unprofitable nor impactful (appart from the monthly LiDAR researchers, architects and students that contact me for feature request).

I was hoping this would work! Why didn’t it work, why the reality wasn’t bending to my expectations? I was a good hardworking boi!

Made me upset. I decided to start… doing what’s needed. Accept reality as it is, stop hoping and start acting.

It’s like having to do the dishes, you can wish you don’t have to, but that’s just stupid.

Just do it.

Just do it.

Thanks to the harshness of Muay Thai, this simple sentence I had heard for two decades now made fucking sense.

Sometimes you just have to do it. If I want to work in a blockchain related job, stop hoping on these Linkedin agents. Just start doing.

Start learning Rust, Solana (sure I’m motivated, but not enough to learn Javascript and Solidity. It’s already hard enough to write just the tests in JS, that even the fucking IDE/Compiler don’t understand).

If only I had acted instead of hoping.

Took me a few more months.

And now it’s me creating my opportunities, building nice things for projects I value, projects I am financially and emotionally invested in.

Just because I acted instead of hoping, because I took the matter in my own hands.


_____________________________

As I heard from Andre Compte-Sponville (poorly translated…)

`There is no hope without fear, nor fear without hope. Many people live in hope and so in fear, but the wise prefer to do what depend on him, accept what IS rather than desire what he wish it was, and do what depend of him: building`

`Hope less, and learn, love and act more.`

Reality is rational, everything is explainable. Thanks Epictetus for teaching me this. If the current situation doesn’t fit the grid you’r trying to make it fit through, drop the grid. Embrace the situation, how dire it is. Cause that the first step toward getting where you want.

Not a big fan of these motivational “entrepreneurial spirit” bs, and now I start to feel like this sounds a bit like it?

It’s more about a retard that can barely write a sentence trying to share his experience in case it can help anyone. I don’t know anything, like everybody else. Anyone who seem to have shit figured out is either a fool or probably trying to scam you.

Okay another last quote from our Stoic friend Seneca :

`When you’ll have un-learnt to hope, you’ll learn to want.`

As with fire came disparities in the Souls, with hope came fear in “real life”.

We are full of hope, and consequently of fears.

By learning to hope less, we free ourselves from the associated fears, and we start wanting and acting.

It’s all coming together. Or maybe I have sugar high, or idiot bias…

`I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.` \\n

title: 2020.9 “语言的边界就是世界的边界”
body:
**1 自我净化**

如果可以的话，不要加入行情群，不要和人讨论如何暴富，不要被自己的欲望左右行动，不要关注太多公众号，不要刷朋友圈和微博。

多接触高价值的东西，吃的，用的，听的，看的。提高自己的审美和品味，这样你再来微博和朋友圈，再去看看群里的内容，你会发现，你以前生活在垃圾堆里，又臭又不自知。

**2 一个箴言**

听到一个箴言：如果你想做一件事情，买股票，买币，任何事情吧，你去找自己配佩服的人，自己觉得最聪明的的人，如果他的反对意见依然没有改变你的想法，那么就去做，就去买。你需要反对意见来锤打自己的想法，而不是去找顺着你的想法的人。

**3 把饼做大**

对我来说，看书是比玩比特币坚持地更长的一件事，我已经有7年的阅读习惯了，而接触比特币才4年。我们有很多种方式让自己愉快，获得幸福感，狭义财富的获得只是众多方式的一种，可能占比很高。但我觉得，每个人还应该有其他获得幸福的途径，让生命充实。看过纪录片《徒手攀岩》吗？主角用徒手攀岩绝壁的方式追求意义，可能在他眼里这件事如此重要，甚至超过了赚钱、房子。

固然现在的文化造就了追求财富的价值取向，但每个人也要努力寻找除了这件事以外，其他的获得幸福的路径，对我来说，就是通过阅读理解这个世界。

当我阅读完一本书，深受启发，并把书中内容纳入自己的知识网时，我走在路上都是快乐的。我看着行人，想着他们的悲欢，看着门店，想着背后的逻辑又清晰了一些。这种快乐，我觉得和登上岩壁是同质的。

不要狭义地活着，去体验，去尝试，去见见不同的人，那些离经叛道的人的活法，对你来说可能是新世界的大门。

赚钱固然重要，更重要的是把赚钱的权重降低，我不是让大家承认自己的无能，去放弃追求财富，而是试着把饼做大，绝对值没有变，变化的是价值观，它会因为更多的追求，变得丰富起来。

如果你这么做了，你不会太着迷于赚钱，你会去唱歌，跳舞，演讲，写作，录博客或者其他。

祝你有个丰富的人生，如果找不到的话，去买本书吧。对抗浮躁的心，也是一种值得追求的幸福。

**4 海桑**

昨天读了海桑的诗，看了他的采访。自己如何热爱诗歌，衣冠不整，还在诗歌的世界假象自己是个精神国王。在他的少年时代，拥有对诗歌丰富的梦想，仅仅是靠想象就激动的无法自制，写出一首好诗就能高兴半天，认为这就是杰作，肯定要流传百世的。他在孤独与梦想中度过大学的诗歌创作期。可是在父母看来，这位大学生已经偏离期待，但他依然说诗歌就是自己的人生道路。

我TM都要看哭了，这不就是我想见的神经病，异类，不按常理出牌的人嘛～

**5 一个主要命题**

股票，时间，比特币，权力……都是人类通过共同想象构建的，对于一条鱼来说，世界上不存在这些东西，“人是万物的尺度”。

你认为的世界真实的样子就是你看到的，感觉到的，想象到的样子。对于一个蓝绿色盲来说，他看到的和我看到的，我们知道是不一样的，但这就是他认为真实的样子。

可见光只是众多波长中的一小段，颜色也是视锥细胞处理后的结果，或者说人类的视觉就是把特定波长的光转换成某种颜色的“错觉”。

更多地，颜色、声音、触觉都是人类为了生存下去，发展出来的对世界的感知系统，人类没有必要发展出一套超声波系统，那是蝙蝠的生存之道。蝙蝠和人类对世界的感知是不一样的，这种不一样取决于怎么样才能生存下去。

生存，这是一个主要命题，其他都是其次要，人也是如此。

在这个主要命题下，我们去追求财富，美女，地位，权力……这些东西不过是更好生存下去的方式，这和蝙蝠为了抓住一只小鸟，努力地飞啊飞，没有本质的不同。

知道了这些，你就能从更大，更高的地方看待自己的行为模式，你能跳出来思考这个游戏是怎么被设定成这样子的。

类似的观点，我讲过几次了。当我认识到自己或他人，在执着于开头的那些东西，我觉得人有时候又可爱，又愚蠢，又好玩，又悲哀。

**6 中毒已久**

前女友总觉得我很无聊，她喜欢旅游，喜欢出去玩，而我更愿意去星巴克看书，28元一个下午，把时间耗在书里，才是我获得快乐的方式，我是更多人眼里的傻子。我没有佩服的人，甚至牛逼如中本聪，我都觉得不过是历史进程的必然，而我极少说起的熊逸，才是我心中的偶像。

商业大片，电视剧，综艺节目，都是让你放弃思考的东西，背景音乐替代你思考，而在一张桌子上顺着文字自己勾勒出来的场景，是极少人的享受，门槛太高了。

我觉得人类愚蠢，是从微博上充斥着大量的行情走势，合约策略和反弹目标开始的，极少有人会去关心博弈论、协作与串谋、组织与权力……

就像极少有人会去看原著，选择买张票去电影院里让导演告诉你讲了什么，这种精神食粮就像你喝下了三聚氰胺的奶粉，中毒症状是你看着傻逼博主写的行情将反弹到12000点，然后点了个赞。这就是不沉默的大多数，也是愚蠢的大多数。当然这里是有进化上的原因的，也不能强求什么。

但如果你还想要有品味和追求，那么你要知道，把时间花在真正的奢侈品上，才是值得的。一个人想买爱马仕包包是没错的，更在贵族的眼里，他更应该知道，奢侈品的历史、来源以及为什么会有奢侈品、等级观念是怎么形成的。

当我看着那些有钱人问我流动性挖矿怎么玩的时候，他和别人只是亏多亏少的区别。

当我知道《黑客帝国》的思想早被两千多年前的哲学家讨论到滥的时候，我觉得自己向着高级靠近，虽然我衣品极差，情商极低……

大多数时候，我也愚蠢至极，但那么几个偶尔自己是个人了，尤其我看书思考的时候。希望你也能认识到自己中毒已久。

那些说看书之人是个书呆子的，你要知道他们是不值得深交的，只有上帝会原谅他们的愚蠢。

**7 语言的边界就是世界的边界**

关于以太坊虚拟机。

目前以太坊的虚拟机是EVM，虚拟机下面是共识机制，上面是智能合约。以太坊的智能合约目前只能由solidlity编程语言写成，虚拟机提供了这种语言所编译出来的智能合约执行所需要的环境。

简单来说：以太坊的虚拟机负责执行智能合约，但又屏蔽掉了不同硬件的差异。

跟通俗一点就是：老子给你们撑起一片天（屏蔽硬件差异），但你们得用我规定的语言来交流，不然我听不懂！

一个扩展：如果虚拟机是一个世界的话，那么solidlity编程语言所能表达的东西，就是这个世界的边界。比如该虚拟机听不懂，C，java语言编写的内容，这超出了它的边界。所以有人说会，要在以太坊上开发，还得学习solidlity编程\~道理就在此。

好消息是以太坊2.0，改进了虚拟机，从EVM升级到eWASM。

EVM下的solidlity编程语言，有很多局限性，技术点讲就是内存泄露、执行速度等问题。如果你学过多种语言，你就会知道，在不同语言间的差异，会导致人理解世界的不同，而有些语言天生的缺陷，会让人天生无法理解更高级的东西。比如你从小没学过逻辑，那么你就会觉得中医是好的（黑一下\[doge\]）

eWASM的改进就很多了，其相比 EVM最明显的优势是代码执行的速度和效率上的大幅提升，执行速度提升意味着区块每秒可以处理的交易数量 TPS（吞吐量）提升！

eWASM也支持更多的编程语言种类进行智能合约开发，这些编程语言相比 Solidity具有更广泛的社区开发支持资源，包括编译工具、开发人员。eWASM还有一个 “优化 ”的地方是用 eWASM智能合约替代预编译。总结来讲，新的虚拟机相比原来的EVM支持更多的开发语言，比如C/C++，Rust等。

如果一个人同时学习多种语言，英文，法语，中文，日语，那么他的世界就比只会中文的人更广阔一下，倒不是说见多识广的那种，而是他能从多种语言的差异中，更能理解这个世界。

编程语言到人类的语言，我交叉着讲，其实讲说的是维特根斯坦的话：“语言的边界就是世界的边界。”

这里世界，前者是虚拟机，后者是人类所能认识到的世界。

**8 感性与理性**

关于感性与理性，有一个重要的比喻，象与骑象人，感性是象，理性是骑象人。首先是大象决定怎么走，骑象人才让大象往那边走。

首先你是买了比特币，你才会收集各种信息和逻辑，用理性分析去支持这个想法。理性在感性面前，是十分被动的。

有些感性部分（内侧前额叶皮层）受损的病人，对于记忆，逻辑推理，数学等理性测试依然正常，但他们并不知道什么是好，什么是坏。

如果仅仅凭些感性（热系统/系统一）去做事，那么很容易搞砸。韭菜在想暴富的驱使下，无脑梭哈就没好下场，需要理性的配合。但纯理性因为失去了感性的支撑，完全派不上用场。感性是很烂的操作系统，但再好的软件如果失去操作系统支撑，也无法发挥作用。

我相信囤币党是非常理性的，深沉还是感性在起作用，只不过被压在了比特币里。如果稍微释放一下，比如试着引入混乱，再让理性去分析该混乱，可能会带来意外的结果，有时候还挺好的。

我自己是囤币党，还挺硬核。但自从感性出场后，我会一本正经去分析一只野鸡。

正如《为与无为》提到的：

对正确行为事先作出理性判断，然后强迫身体予以实施，这种顺序是行不通的。

行得通的顺序是：先莫名奇怪的踏出第一步，再理性分析。这似乎也是风险控制的一种。

感性负责乱来，理性负责擦屁股。人就是这样的。

title: 2020.10 “与艺术不同，科学毁灭自己的过去”
body:
**1 人的大脑有两套认知模式**

热认知：自发，天生，高效，快速，毫不费力。究其原因，是进化赋予的天性。
比如吃美食会开心，遇到针刺手会迅速缩回，父母爱孩子等等。凡是符合热认知的，符合天性的，我们都会发自内心的接受，没有任何欺骗性。
冷认知：理性，缓慢，耗时耗力，后天训练。比如学习数学就是需要冷认知。
这也是《思考，快与慢》一书想表达的核心内容。
人是可以把后天学到的东西，与热认知完美结合的，达到“无为”状态。
比如骑自行车，一开始需要冷认知登场，要学习，要把握平衡感，慢慢学会这个技能。该过程有些费力，甚至有些危险，但熟练之后，人就不用在乎如何平衡了，身体自己会去把握自行车，骑起来就会毫不费力。人在骑车上达到了“无为”，一切都是那么和谐，自然。
发自内心的笑与假笑，区别就在于身体会不会骗人，假笑是冷认知在控制，是不和谐的。
有些运动员通过长期的练习，早已把各种动作内化于心。他不用思考，而是让身体去执行动作，思考就是冷认知，身体才是热认知。当身体接受了这套动作，那么运动员就是优美，自然，和谐的。他们用不思考的方式去执行任务，这也是无为。
但要达到无为很难，因为身体会拒绝很多。做某事，要发自内心很难。人在小时候学语言特别快，因为天性告诉孩子，语言是必须的，这就是发自内心，小孩甚至都没意识到“发自内心”这回事。但长大了再学，就难很多，因为这个第二语言已经不是热认知的事情了，而是冷认知的范畴，这里也有进化的原因。
所以要达到“无为”，是把冷认知的东西，100%融合进热认知里，这里没有思考，没有助力，让身体，而不是大脑去执行。
至于如何达到“无为”，想想自己是怎么学自行车的。
《道德经》：为学日益，为道日损。损之又损，以至于无为。提供了无为的路径。先去学习日日进步，但真正的牛逼是不断放下，不断减少，不去思考，放下念头，逐渐接近无为。

**2 救命的东西**

在某个层级分明的环境里工作上三四年，他的立场和职业生涯，他的野心和那份自尊，在很大程度上就只是基于一种视角，一组词汇，一套技术。除此之外，他一无所知。
破局点是引入变量：
去见陌生人，和他们交流；
去看书，了解多元的知识；
去接触新事物，看看有没有启发。
这些变量，是救命的东西。

**3 关于囤币与无为**


没有人一开始就发自内心认可比特币的，囤币更是不可能的事情。认识比特币是需要理性分析的，涉及的领域还挺多的，而真正的囤币者，面对价格波动的时候，心情波动会很小，在买币的时候也显得很自然，他在这件事上接近“无为”，无为而不为，特牛逼的一种状态。
如何达到这种状态，我前面微博讲过了。具体到币圈，就是一开始关注行情，炒币，被利益左右判断，然后去思考比特币本身，再结合其他知识仔细审视它，试着让身体而不是理性介入，最后囤币就像呼吸一样自然，外面再怎么闲言碎语，都不影响不到了。
当然，这种人是很少的，我也不是。越是理性分析，人就越会被野鸡拖走。因为理性背后是利益，而身体背后是自然，或者是“道”。
囤币这事，越用力越囤不了。

**3 从宇宙看自己**

我最近在喜马拉雅听一些学者的观点。把美国对华为的封杀说成是对中国的利好，对美国的损害。
听下来还挺有道理的。
我也希望中国能强大起来，毕竟我是中国人。
可我总觉得哪里不对，是不是因为我是中国人，自带了某些立场，才觉得这样的观点听起来舒服呢？
如果是这样，还挺伤感的，因为不酷。怎么才酷呢？是做一个世界公民。这样的话，我身上不会有家国情怀影响判断，不会有宗教冲突而你死我活，不会因为是不是吹中国喜怒。
我会想，这只是迎合了世界上一部分人的说法，我来自这部分人，但我更属于更大的群体，那里声音更多元。所谓公知，不过说出了一小部分人的观点，但我要听听更大，更多的声音，我要走出这个村子。
如果我听到中国的坏话，也愤怒，那我同样不酷。我可是世界公民，我在各个国家，各个民族之间穿梭，不被任何村民的观点左右，就非常好。
我来自中国，但我属于世界，我从宇宙看自己。

**4 比特币是内心善良的魔鬼**

关于比特币，如果你还在问走势，问行情，问牛熊转换，问为什么瀑布，那你还有很多路要走，还有很多钱要亏，持有它的前提是配得上它。
就像画画，首先要让自己成为更好的人，审美、笔法、心态、表达等等（我随便举的，不一定对），然后随性而为。
我知道这话没有可操作性，也很空，但就是这样。前段时间，我见了一个玩合约的人，除了他身上对于财富的追求，我看不出其他东西，这样不对。
是先成为更好的人，再去买比特币，或者是买比特币的同时，与它一起风风雨雨，成为更好的人。如果自己什么都不是，只想着暴富，那么比特币对你来说是害人的东西。
好好工作，好好生活，好好恋爱，好好做家务，好好学习也是财富的一种，它们会帮助你成为更好的人，如果此时，你恰好拥有比特币，那就更好了，如果没有那就去买，锦上添花。
比特币是内心善良的魔鬼。

**5 关于编程与金融** 

编程是组织语言的过程，这种语言可能是C，C++，java等等。这些语言有很多词汇（接口，函数），一个个程序就是程序员们的文章。有些人只会日常写作，有些人熟练运用比喻，拟人，排比等技巧，让文章生动，让程序高效（时间/空间复杂度低）。这些技巧，一般叫算法。 DeFi是一个概念，落到实处是一个个程序，也是编程的结果。只不过这些程序是在如以太坊这样的公链上实现的，这些程序是某个具体概念的实现，可能是借贷、交易、理财……这些是有金融属性的，但有些程序是没有金融属性的，看怎么编程了。 如何组织语言是一门学问。我现在发这条微博，广义来说，也是编程，首要我要学会使用词汇，语法，构造。 printf 是C语言中的输出函数，它类似于某个词汇，知道了，会用了，继续学习下一个函数。 当然函数可以自己写，自己定义。 数据结构课上，老师讲的各种排序算法，是让学生在了解词汇、语法的基础上，懂得如何构造一句话，要凝练，简洁，高效。 “可编程金融”，说白了，就是在以太坊这些公链上开发一些具备金融属性的程序。因为基于法定货币的金融，是不能狭义地编程的，而搭建在以太坊上的金融，可以实现很复杂，很高级的操作，比如sushiswap把uniswap的流动性资金抢劫过来了，只需要简单的编程即可。这是新旧范式的差别。 现在高级点的金融专业，除了要学习数学，编程，金融理论，感觉还要知道区块链，在区块链上实现“可编程的金融”，“可计算的金融”，“可信金融”等等场景。 有了区块链，金融很多场景要重域定。 注：域定，来自《技术的本质》。大意是： “域"是为了共享现象，共同目标或者为了分享同一个理论的技术集群，可以理解为一种语言，它有语法，规则，思维模式与边界。有时候，同一件事采用不同的域，往往效果千差万别，可能像数学计算我们之前用纸笔，现在用电脑一样大，重新选择域，是颠覆性的改变。在选定域后，如何采用里面的规则与元素就像写诗一样，需要仔细思考，可以说域就是一个世界，它与现实世界有些深刻的联系。重新选定域，去重定义已有的事物，世界会发生巨变。

**6 过什么样的生活**

我早早起床，周末也不睡懒觉，骑着车去小镇上喝咸豆浆，小时候的味道。附近星巴克点了一杯咖啡，我坐下来看书，初秋的太阳刚好，阳光和栏杆的影子在书页上一明一暗。我随着文字思绪到了18世纪的德国，那里的上层社会说法语，他们一板一眼，繁文缛节。
如果你问我有钱之后要过什么样的生活，我觉得这就是答案，我没钱的时候也这么过。

7 文化弧

8\.技术的自我进化

**9 社会学的想象力**

上午看一篇关于Bancor V2.1的介绍，说的是如何减少LP的无常损失。
要想在这些信息里挖掘出金子，我突然想起了之前看的书《社会学的想象力》里提到的一句话（有删减）：
“要把握人与社会、人生与历史、自我与世界之间的相互作用，必须有特定的心智品质，运用信息，发展理性，以求清晰地概括出周边世界正在发生什么，自己又会遭遇到什么。”
如果没有足够的贮备信息，什么是无常损失，为什么会有AMM，它的成长路径，DEX等等，就无法真正理解这些东西。在历史、科技、技术、博弈等等领域，会有很多思想工具，理论模型，这些是储备信息，可以发展理性，帮助思考当下遇到的事情，从而概括出世界现在发生了什么。
一篇文章如果让自己一脸蒙蔽，就要知道自己还有很多东西要学，如果已经具备了足够多的储备知识，那么你能在这里看出点别人看不到的东西，好的坏的。无论你看到了什么，都是自己能看到的东西。
唯一要做的是俯下身去，试着发展出心智，试着开启社会学的想象力。

**10 这样一件事**

任何一件事，都不是凭空产生的，肯定有产生它的土壤，它和很多东西都有联系。
可当我们不知道这些联系，不知道这些联系血管在给它供血，光是狭隘地观察它，就无法获得更多的东西，甚至会迷失其中。我们要做的，就是把视野放大，从更高，更远的角度去看它，从整体出发。
整体是宏观的视角，往往带有某种规律；但如果从局部入手，过分关注细节，过分关注单一的东西，追问它接下来的走向，只见树木不见森林，那么误判的可能性极大，甚至一两次判断成功都是有害的。
比特币/filecoin/无常损失……都是这样一件事，它们最基本的运行原理，往往很容易搞懂，难的是，接下来呢？这件事从整体看是好还是坏，是暂时的解决问题，还是符合整体的规律，它出现从时间尺度上能维持多久。
要回答这些，往往需要知道一些底层的规律，得从很多领域中获得一些启发，进行类比，才能得出一些模糊的结论，想象力，推理力，感受力，对美的把握等等都要具备。
如果你有足够大的野心，敢于装下整个宇宙，这就是你要去做的事情。

**11 仅此而已**

我要看的书太多了，我不知道的也太多了，面对世界发生的事情，我太不知所措了；

欲望驱使着我去行动，但我同时又想不紧不慢；一直有个声音提醒我，但我又不想太赶；

我这辆小破车永远赶不上远方的列车了，我还打算赶一下；

胡适说，怕什么真理无穷，进一步有进一步的欢喜。

这句话，像是安慰剂。

有没有什么方法，可以在休息的时候，躺下的时候，睡觉的时候，我也能获得知识，也能获得能力

我有点累，又有点慌 我甚至不能问怎么办，因为我看多一些书，我知道一些答案，仅此而已。

**12 勇敢承认是猜**

我越来越觉得，币圈几乎所有的文章，哪怕我觉得写的很好的文章，深度的分析，有数据，有思考，都是有意无意的胡说八道。倒不是作者有意为之，而是他也想写好，也想努力分析出哪个项目基于目前的信息，是一种趋势。但我总觉得哪怕他暂时对了，很大程度也是运气成分，越正确只会越模糊，越趋于宏观。
我观察了好多币圈知名的博主，无一例外都是如此。预测本来就是非常愚蠢的事情，但市场要求你如此，就挺难的。勇敢承认是猜，有时候也挺好的。

**13 两手空空**

我来到这里，两手空空。有人下了车去目的地，而我不知道要去哪里。
我两手空空，抓不住任何东西，我在虚妄中度过时间。
明天又要上班，重复，像拉磨的驴。周末也是另一种重复，跳不出的循环。
书籍给我安慰，我看了一百多页，其他我一无所有。
我是宇宙尘埃突然的逆熵，随后归于沉寂，走路也是宇宙的安排，只是不知道要去哪里。
宇宙不告诉我答案，它不会安排的，它也不在乎，我要去看书了，试着向宇宙要答案。
我两手空空，但倔强

**14 可以带我炒币吗**

刚才收到一条私信，问：可以带我炒币吗？
我说，老老实实买比特币就行，你会跑赢大部分炒币的人。显然这不是他要的答案，他也不明白我在说什么。
当我说出这句话的时候，我脑中会有一套逻辑在飞速运转，我想起自己的经历，读过的书，见过的人，吃过的教训……但我此刻只能浓缩成一句话，语言是思想的降维表达。
我不希望别人去炒币，而是通过比特币改变自己的思维模式。我甚至在研究比特币的时候，去研究宗教，还想学习冥想。
知识是一体，如果从比特币出发，去跨学科融合是真正的认知变现。
前几天我发微博说：
我不能在只在物理学中理解物理，不能在只在文学中理解文学，也不能只在金融中理解金融……而是要在物理，文学，金融，历史的混合中，再去理解物理，文学，金融，历史。
尤其带来的启发是：我不能只在逐利中追逐比特币，而是要在历史，心理，逻辑，哲学等等领域中，取来一些食材“烹饪”出比特币。
但是这个东西，一个新人不懂，他追问我这是什么操作的时候，我沉默不语

**15 摸索**

摸索，一项重要的技能。

试着根据已知，去探索未知，从而找出一条路来，成功次数多了，也就自信起来了。
不要害怕，不要慌张，信息像路灯，会点亮前方的路。
我说的没那么高级，如何使用钱包，如何导入，尝试uniswap都是一种摸索，特别简单。
等学会了它们，这些未知的，又变成了你的已知，你就可以往更深入的地方前进。
勇气，就是这么来的。

**16 从宇宙看自己**

我囤/喜欢/宣传比特币，但我不认为囤比特币是唯一正确的
有人囤/喜欢/宣传以太坊，门罗币，也是值得敬佩
我偶尔会买山寨币，是为了投机，参与最新的项目也是如此，翻车也有，没什么不好说的
但心中有一根主线：探索，了解，学习，成长，改变。
囤币不是真理，说这话之前，首先要定义“囤”“币”“真理”，我会遇到麻烦；
社会的标准不是正确/错误，真理/谬误，而是利益，立场，竞争等等，这些标准本身也在变化当中。
你看到的，就是你能看到的，视野越来越大，看到也越来越多，甚至会改变自己的想法。如果我见过大钱，并且知道如何赚这些钱，我不会把这件事的权重看的那么大。
活下去是动物的本能，追求意义才是人的选择。相信什么，认可什么，都是在追求意义，比特币存在于逻辑世界中，也存在于一些人的想象中，代码不是它的本体，一些人通过它实现自己的意志，才是它的存在的意义。
比特币对于有些人来说，是有意义的，对于有些人毫无价值，他们有自己的意义系统。祝彼此好运，就这样，没必要党同伐异。
我从宇宙看自己。

**17 一个比喻**

诺基亚的手机，在2007年的iphone一代出来的时候，就进入了死亡进程。
同样的，某些金融产品，在2009年比特币出来的时候，也进入了死亡进程。
app store是iphone的神助攻，一如以太坊是比特币的神助攻，前者都让后者在社会层面更加开放，哪怕自身是封闭的。

**18 我对中国有耐心**

我是中国人，我爱这个国家，但我不喜欢一些教授老是拿中国取得的成就说事，尤其贬低别的国家以彰显中国的优势。抗击疫情的代价是很多企业活不下去，这在媒体少有报道，这不正确。在国内只允许一种主流声音，我谈不上喜欢和讨厌，但如果出现了其他意见，我才认为这个国家真的强大和自信了。我们相信科学的程度，是有缺陷的，接受的信息是过滤的，因此大部分的立场是被雕刻过的。
我爱中国，我希望这个国家强大起来，如果这些是强大路上的必须，那我支持。我希望有一天，在网络上，博客里，电视里，出现越来越多刺耳的声音，文化自信，民族自信，包罗万象。我希望那会的人，不知道什么是“外网”，也不会因为某个教授无条件吹这个国家而顶礼膜拜。
我希望不光是谣言会至于智者，某个“正确”的观点也会止于质疑。我对中国有耐心，我们已经取得了很多成就，我们需要教育和经济，然后才是自信和勇气。

**19 错误认知**

我们普遍有一个错误的认知：只要XX了，我就能YY了
我们对于XX抱有妄念，对YY也是错误的认识，两者的叠加会让自己以为在正确的路上，一路错下去。
只有比特币涨到100万，我就自由了，我想干嘛就干嘛。实际上不是这样的，你本来就是自由的。执着，追求，痛苦，喜乐都是一些杂念，包裹着本就自由的自己。坐下来感受自己的呼吸，把坐下来呼吸当成是当下最重要的事情来做。
杂念就像涟漪，它们穿过身体，身体要能如如不动，那你就获得了自由。我们通过不要什么达到自由，而不是要什么。

**20 毁灭自己的过去**

我相信有这样一群人，在现有的行业/领域/学科/工作岗位里，学得一套方法论，他们努力，精进，哪怕你不是很懂他在说什么，也从言语中就能知道他的专业性。但有些技术，有些理念出来之后，这套东西就日落西山了。
DeepL神经网络技术为动力的机器翻译，让普通人也能看懂外文了，也有很多实时翻译的软件帮助我们与外国人交流，那么你就要认真思考，自己学外语如果只是当个翻译，就要小心了；我不否认学习外语的好处，多了解一门语言，更能理解这个世界。
比特币，也是这样一种技术。因为互联网是缺少原生货币的，很多公司盈利只能靠广告/流量变现。在这套思维下，我们发展出了一整套方法论：拉新，获客，留存，变现。把海报做得很吸引人，让人有欲望去点击，研究用户的使用路径，抓取他的行为，了解画像。
但有没有这样一种可能：这套范式即将成为过去，我们赖以生存的技能，没有用了。新的范式不再是拉人、留存、变现，而是保护隐私、智能合约、价值传递等等。
当然，上面被我预判死刑的东西，在很长一段时间内依然活得很好。我以前做电商的时候，学习开直通车，但我万万没想到有一个在柜台绘声绘色的李佳琦，他借助4G与直播崛起。我再研究PPC，质量分对于资本来说也非常廉价了，所有的重心都往直播电商转移。我在学习直通车的时候，觉得这个技能可以吃一辈子，我太天真了，那还是2013年。
现在判断一只股票是不是值得买，看行业，政策，财报……这有一整套方法论，但这些方法论对于“比特币”似乎束手无策，多少基于旧范式去套新范式下的事物，尴尬，无力。
当然，谁也不知道是什么东西杀死了我，但如果只有一套方法论，那再强以后也是被逼着自杀的。
“与艺术不同，科学毁灭自己的过去”，我觉得人也应该时不时毁灭自己的过去。

title: 加密货币的投资价值
body:
> “加密货币将是一场颠覆式创新的社会实验，未来的路还很长，其中孕育着巨大的非对称性投资机会”

**本文写于今年8月中，当时发在微博上（链接在此）https://[m.weibo.cn/1849058527/4671579016921271](https://m.weibo.cn/1849058527/4671579016921271)**

**但后来觉得微博可能不是最好的发布加密货币相关文章的平台，就没有再多用了。这次看到去中心化的内容发布平台 Mirror开始给用户开放，觉得这才是最适合的平台，就把这篇文章再复制黏贴过来，希望能抛砖引玉，以文会友。**

**我的推特：CryPto33.eth@cry_pto33**

——————————————————————————————————————

“自己开始写一些长文章，主要是用来记录和分享自己对于投资的一些思考。

为什么现在要开始写这些文章呢？主要是3个原因：

1）像博主硅谷王川反复强调的，**写作是非常有效的思考和学习的工具，能帮助实现个人复利增长**；而在公众平台的写作由于能即时收到反馈，是效率最高的。

2）也想通过这个号，**找到更多志同道合之士，结交新朋友**，独乐乐不如众乐乐

3）最近做了次小手术，在手术台上时不免胡思乱想一番，想到自己虽然不才，但**最近几年也有些投资相关的思考和笔记，还是要趁有机会多分享出来，哪怕对多一个读者有帮助，也是有边际价值的**。

这里强调下，**我的文章并不是要提供投资建议。各位看官请牢记我水平很有限，这些文章仅是输出我个人对投资的粗浅理解，是我个人视角下的提炼和分享**，力求真实。如果不正确请大家一笑而过，当然也欢迎指正帮助我改进。如果相关内容对您有帮助有共鸣，也请点个赞或留个言，希望能结识更多有缘人。

第一篇文章就留给我最看好的投资领域 -- 加密货币（Cryptocurrencies）。**加密货币里我主要介绍市值最高的两个龙头 -- Bitcoin （代币BTC）和以太坊Ethereum（代币ETH）**。其他加密货币的项目在我看来还属于很早期，确定性不高，我目前也没能力分析清楚头绪来，不在此讨论。

看好加密货币主要是因为以下几个吸引人的要素：

**1）提供非对称性收益的机会**：

**A）首先从生物学的角度思考**：Bitcoin和Ethereum的优点在于都属于一种开放和有机增长的网络“生物”，具有自我进化和修正的能力，运营多年账本网络并没有出现过大问题，在各种巨大压力和质疑下其市值依旧趋势性向上，在10年间达到了约2万亿美元。同时他们反脆弱，很难被单方面或几方合力“清零”。相信关注最近1个多月资本市场的参与者对此会有很深的体会。因此从生物学进化的角度上看，加密货币像是没有显著弱点的智慧生物，其强韧性和鲁棒性比大多数投资品种都要好。

**B）加密货币还处于发展的早期，用户渗透率还很低**，正处于创新扩散模型从创新者（Early innovators）到早期采用者（Early adopters）的阶段。随着未来3-5年更多用户的进入，加密货币即将跨越鸿沟：目前加密货币使用人数在1.5亿左右（用地址推断），按全球互联网总用户60亿人算，渗透率接近3%。按每年用户增长50+%计算，加密货币的用户将在5年内接近或超过10亿用户，占全球互联网用户的15%以上。而这将是人类历史上新技术渗透率提高最快的一次，对于现在的参与者意味着难得的指数增长的机会。 
 

![创新扩散模型](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JBHJyRabAopnBipREXaFj.png?height=288&width=804)

![加密货币和互联网用户渗透率对比图](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iR3KtOMBE92fGyu1ht0dK.png?height=464&width=818)

​回顾历史，颠覆式创新的产品在跨越鸿沟后其所孕育的非对称性回报是惊人的。比如微软在 1995年推出支持互联网的 windows 95 后，股价到1999年底涨了接近10倍；还有苹果手机以及去年的特斯拉的案例。尽管这些股票在这期间也出现过30%-50%的回撤，但相对于10倍以上的回报，这些短期的波动都是可以接受的。 

类似的，加密货币在范式转移下也正处于快速发展阶段，其投资回报也有可能复制之前的互联网/智能手机/智能动车的回报，甚至超越他们，在未来3-5年用- 50%的可能下跌风险去换取10倍+的潜在回报。

因此认同这个逻辑并有条件的投资人，都可以去做相应的资产配置。可以根据不同的风险偏好，配置总资产的1-10%不等在加密货币上。这样的非对称性机会可能会在未来给你带来惊喜。而万一失败了，也不会给你带来伤筋动骨的损失。很多投资大师比如Paul Tudor jones 在他的投资组合里就配置了5%的BTC。而今年年初在GME世纪逼空一役里做为散户代言人而大出风头的Chamath 就对BTC曾有犀利的评论，认为买BTC就是Schmuck insurance, 翻译过来就是对“愚蠢行为的保险”，建议投资人都应该至少配置1%的BTC在投资组合里。

**2）加密货币能给用户带来巨大价值：**

**A）一套去中心化，无需信任，无需许可接入, 防篡改的账本体系**

加密货币是人类社会从中心化到去中心化历史进程的必然产物：在人类上千年的历史中，上一次的去中心化进程开端是在中世纪晚期，当时教会+封建贵族通过对财富，信息，文化和教育资源的垄断而形成政教合一体系，导致社会阶层分化极其严重。之后正是随着古登堡印刷术+威尼斯复式记账法+文艺复兴开启了随后的资产阶级革命和祛魅运动，破除了禁锢剥削普通人的政教合一。 

但在19世纪中叶以后，由于工业革命带来的生产力和暴力机器的快速发展，主权国家（nation states）迅速崛起并开始垄断了货币发行的权力，导致了政币合一，使财富集中在最顶层的建制派为代表的既得利益集团手中，贫富差距达到过去几百年年来最严重的地步。

而这一次随着加密货和其底层区块链技术的出现，加上互联网技术带来的社交网络和向虚拟世界的跃迁，很有可能逐渐瓦解建制派对货币发行权力的垄断，逐步实现政币分离，给与普通人更公平的货币环境。

关于加密货币是无需信任，无需许可接入，具有防篡改的特性，这块偏技术性，网上有很多科普文章，大家可以很容易找到相关解释，我在此就不赘述了。

**B) 加密货币底层的区块链（Blockchain）技术将改变人类交互的方式，从而带来对传统金融和互联网服务的变革**

区块链技术是一种互联网数据库技术，其特点是去中心化、公开透明，无需许可让每个人均可参与数据库记录。像硅谷王川所说：“区块链的精髓是，创新不需要批准和计划。在开放的系统上，唯才是举，论功行赏. 长期看，开放兼容廉价的系统，最终将把封闭昂贵不兼容的系统边缘化。世界上八十亿人，上万亿台机器，可以瞬间（迟滞低于一秒）通过区块链网络进行无需中介，无需许可，自动编程，费用极低的，可以信赖的价值交换，价值交换的单位可以低到一分，一厘，甚至更低。”

通过大规模陌生人的共识和协作，从而实现价值交换的网络铺开后，会催生以前不可实现的各种去中心化应用；中心化的大机构/公司作为网络必不可少的核心节点的垄断地位将被大大削弱，从而将强加给用户的“平台税”返还给普通用户。用户就能根据他们在应用中的付出（比如创造内容，提供私有数据和参与互动等）得到相应的价值和报酬反馈，实现最朴素的用户”按劳分配，多劳多得“。 

这就是很多人经常提到的Web 3.0的雏形，会逐渐重塑货币市场、支付系统、金融服务及社会生活的方方面面，给普通个体带来价值。就好像在网上看到的总结 –“Web 1.0 是公司提供内容公司赚钱，Web 2.0 是用户提供内容公司赚钱，Web 3.0 是用户提供内容用户赚钱。” 举个直观的例子，在Web 2.0里，Uber这家公司作为打车网络里的中心节点在逐步实现垄断后，向平台上的用户和专车司机都收取了不菲的“中介费”，使得本应节省的效率和收益都被Uber公司一家攫取了，并依此继续扩张自己的垄断优势，榨取更多价值。而未来如果有基于区块链的新打车平台可以让用户和司机直接交互，绕过Uber这样的中心化节点，就能使用户在继续享用高效的打车网络的同时，也获取本属于他们自己的经济利益。

这样的趋势发展下去，长期更深远的影响是加密货币以及其背后的区块链将改变人类过去几百年来习以为常的组织架构和交互方式。现在的大规模协作要么通过公司制形式，要么通过Linux 那样的开源模式 -- 参与者纯凭兴趣但没有经济方面的激励。而区块链结合加密货币，就能在经济上大幅激励类似Linux这样的陌生人的自组织从各个领域涌现出来，而不仅限于富有开源精神的极客们。这就是加密货币圈所推崇的去中心化自治组织（DAO）。 DAO有高度的流动性，人才进出自由，工作时间自由，因此能汇聚全球而不仅仅是局部地区的优秀的人才，对有顶尖技术和创造力的人才吸引力比公司制要高很多。

这里强调下，我认为区块链网络必须有代币（token），因为token代表经济激励机制，就是钱，而钱是人类信息/能源传递的最高效的介质。没有token，不可能有陌生人自愿发生的大规模的去中心化协作，比如记账。没有记账，价值也就无法在网络上有效的传递，协作的效率便无法得到提升。因此无币区块链大概率成为机构“自娱自乐”的局域网（IBM 区块链项目最后不了了之便是例证）。

**3）加密货币是年轻人喜欢的新事物**

就像85后和90后这些互联网的原生代很容易接受互联网服务，未来的00后，10后，20后年等加密货币原生代也会很自然的接受基于网络的虚拟加密货币，认为用加密货币交易/支付/理财将是一个很自然的事情。他们反倒会觉得银行系统很古董，很多业务还要去柜台亲自办理，银行有上下班时间有周末休息，交易金额稍微过大就需要被银行查问每一笔钱的出入，非工作时间不给转账等，这些都是很难理解的事情。

从数据上窥探这个趋势的初步影响：仅在美国在未来25年，千禧一代和X一代会继承60-80万亿美元的财富。根据2020年Harris Research的一项研究显示，美国的年轻一代正在塑造对数字资产的认知，对Bitcoin的兴趣超过股票。在3000多名受访者中，18岁至34岁阶段人群认为“Bitcoin是金融技术的积极创新” 的比例为59%；“购买Bitcoin的倾向” 的比例为42%。当被问及他们是否更愿意持有1,000美元的Bitcoin时，30%的受访者表示，其更愿意持有Bitcoin，而不是政府债券。

而从2020年开始，美国婴儿潮一代的人开始大量退休，10-15年后他们会大量死亡，留下大量财富转移给80，90甚至00后。这些新生代大多数人将会是左手Robinhood股票账户，右手加密货币钱包。

简单估算未来美国年轻人配置Bitcoin的比例上升到10%，就意味着有6-8万亿美金量级的资金会进来配加密货币，这还没有考虑年轻人在生活的其他方面更多的使用加密货币的影响。

**4) 传统机构配置加速**

在全球货币超发的大环境下，机构在传统金融领域寻找超额投资收益率的机会越来越少，使得更多的传统机构（基金，投行，咨询公司等）开始关注并研究加密货币，其中相当一部分已经开始配置BTC，ETH等加密资产。比如上市公司特斯拉，德鲁肯米勒的基金，高净值人群比如推特创始人Jack Dorsey等都配置了相当规模的加密货币。

而传统金融比加密货币的市场规模高2-3个数量级，因此一部分资金溢出到加密货币领域就会带来“大象进入洗澡盆”那样的井喷行情。

![加密货币 VS 传统金融](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pU_WgO6B3-OcKaF9o2atb.png?height=640&width=360)

**5）最后我认为加密货币在一个更长的历史跨度（按10年计算），顺应了人类社会发展的三个大潮流**：

A）**贫富差距要修正** — Ray Dalio总结美国目前是100年来贫富差距最严重的，要公平重新分配。

**B）年轻人的代际更迭** — 反建制，反既得利益。

**C）新时代的文艺复兴**— 互联网（internet） + 加密货币（crypto）带来财富，信息，教育，politics等领域的去中心化。

下面我具体分析一下我最看好的两个加密货币龙头的投资逻辑 – **1，BTC新时代共识的数字黄；2，ETH 无需许可的分布式的云计算平台**。

**1，BTC – 新时代的数字黄金**

**1）**从宏观上看，上面分析过的各国央行的长期宽松倾向，**去中心化的历史进程和新时代的文艺复兴等历史大潮等都符合配置BTC的大环境**。

**2）BTC是加密货币领域最早和排名第一的IP，是最大共识的谢林点**，进入加密货币领域的参与者最早了解的基本都是BTC。

**3）BTC**上涨的逻辑很简单朴素：**总量稀缺，通缩，供不应求**。

稀缺性是Bitcoin最新颖、最关键的创新之一；Bitcoin的稀缺性在创建时就被写到协议中，其货币政策的独立性是通过工作量证明和去中心化网络所实现。

通胀率也是被写进他的合约里的：BTC供应量每四年减半，目前其通胀率在不到2%，2024年后就会低于1%，而全球央行新印法币所带来的通胀率远超于此；以Fed为例，按货币发行量计算的美元年化通胀率在4%+。FED货币政策增发容易收水难，因此长期看法币的通胀率大概率会继续超过BTC。

以上特性就赋予了BTC跨时间和跨空间两个维度的价值存储功能。由于低通胀，5年后BTC按法币计算，其价值大概率比目前更高，体现了跨时间存储财富的能力；同时只有要网络（如果遇到大灾难断网，BTC还可以通过卫星来传输信号，因为BTC的开发组织 blockstream 发射了一个BTC全节点在卫星上），BTC就可以在全球任何角落结算，同时结算可以在一个小时内完成。而作为一种不记名的可传输价值的记账网络，只要结算完成就相当于相应的BTC被发送到了接收者的“账户”，这个价值传递的过程也同步完成，不存在任何的信用风险。因此BTC具备比传统纸币更强的跨空间存储功能。

![BTC VS 黄金 VS 法币](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z5Q9DVBVxd8xm9XAXT-ow.png?height=426&width=482)

 **4）个人掌握财富的工具 -- 抗审查和没收**

BTC是数字时代的新发明，但它试图解决的问题却与人类社会同样久远：如何提供一种完全由拥有者控制的财富，并且能长时间持有。

BTC在Bitcoin网络上传输时，没有人为干预决定是否应该允许交易。作为一个分布式的点对点网络，其本质上是设计来抗审查的。这与法定银行系统形成鲜明对比，在法定银行系统里，国家监管的银行会报告和防止货币品的非法使用。

同时BTC的账户系统是由公钥/私钥对通过非对称加密而确保安全运营的，这就使攻击网络的成本远远大于防护的成本，从而可以保证个人的BTC账户在现有科技条件下不可能被机构/nationstates 暴力破解。未来即使有了量子计算机，BTC网络也可以通过升级成抗量子计算的算法来保护用户的资金安全。因此由数学加持的加密算法就使个人可以在与暴力机器的抗争中保证自己财富存储的安全。

**5）反脆弱性**

BTC没有复杂的业务逻辑，需求也很单一，而且作为开源系统，全世界业内懂行的专家基本上都会对它进行一遍认真的检查。其中大的bug已不存在了。

此外，在BTC的网络中，整条链平等开放，任何人都可以向网络贡献算力，不需要权威第三方进行授权，即使大玩家被淘汰也不会导致整个系统的崩溃。正是由于这样的特性使得BTC账本网络在10多年的运算过程中没有出现过大问题。

诚然BTC在历史上有过多次80%+以上的大跌，导致很多人拿郁金香泡沫的破灭作对比。但郁金香的价格有没有在多次大跌后又涨回来并屡创新高呢？肯定没有。那还有没有其他类型的资产在经历多次大跌后又浴火重生呢？历史上似乎真的找不出。就从这点看BTC就是个打不死的小强，有极强健的反脆弱性。

![ 历史上著名泡沫走势图](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hwJoQgEXc0l2He3wIajNE.png?height=832&width=674)

**6）粗略估值** 

对于BTC，我们暂不考虑更宏大的叙事，只考虑其在未来3-5年作为数字黄金的价值（稀缺性，供应增加有限，跨时间/空间保值），则对标黄金的金融属性的市值，大致是3万亿美元。考虑BTC全部挖出有2100万枚，推算未来3-5年1 BTC的合理价值可能在15万美元。

**2，ETH – 无需许可的分布式的云计算平台**

**1）**投资ETH的逻辑在某种程度上比BTC更容易被大众理解，因为投资ETH并不用前置相对复杂且悲观的宏观叙事框架；**简单说投资ETH就是投资能带来颠覆式创新的新科技平台—以太坊。**

以太坊的底层架构是基于从BTC网络里抽象出的区块链技术，通过EVM（以太坊虚拟机）形成了一个无需许可的分布式计算平台（具体的技术细节网上有很多内容，大家可以自行查阅）。像历史上其他生机勃勃的新技术一样，以太坊始终在进化着。他从最开始作为区块链底层的技术设施 -- 公链，孕育了当年的1 CO 狂潮，到2020年在以太坊的计算平台上启动了去中心化金融创新（Defi），再到今年促成了非同质化代币存储（NFTs）和区块链游戏大潮。

尽管以太坊在其发展路程上有很多的波折和延期，但他孵化出了区块链行业的每一次重要创新。通过快速迭代，以太坊已经在区块链的应用生态中占据了极其重要的地位，形成了回报递增的网络效应，其生态复杂度和头部的优势越来越明显

而从政经哲学上来说，以太坊最接近埃里克·A·波斯纳和E·格伦·韦尔的“激进市场”理论：以太坊不停改变升级进化，激进地去扩大市场，用市场本身的力量去完善市场 

**2）ETH上的各类应用**：

先说目前最重要的DeFi生态，Defi 就是去中心化的金融。以太坊网络凭借其先发优势和生态复杂度，天生就是Defi的沃土，目前75%的Defi 交易都在以太坊的网络上进行。从数据上看以太坊网络上的Defi全部锁仓金额（TVL）为1100亿美金 vs 全部Defi的 TVL 1500亿美金。 

以太坊在Defi上的压倒性优势来源于以下几点 –

**A）去中心化的社区共识能吸引最优秀的开发者**：以太坊最高时有大约12000个节点，成为节点也不需要特殊的硬件要求。因此以太坊在Defi 可选择的各条公链里是去中心程度最高的。以太坊凭借去中心化带来的安全性和共识吸引了最有创新力的头部DeFi协议开发者和用户，他们中的很多人明确拒绝在以太坊之外的网络开发任何应用。

**B）多样化的各类资产**：稳定币和各类token在以太坊上的数量最多。以太坊在2016年上线后可以通过智能合约快速发布token，到目前其平台上已经累积了20多万种ERC-20 token；

**C）多样化的智能合约**：比如去中心化交易所（Dex），借贷，预言机等

**D）多样化的开放工具**：比如etherscan 等等帮助开发者和用户更好的使用网络。

**E）充足的流行性**：以太坊过去7天的平均交易费达到了200亿美元，是最接近的竞争对手BSC链的近10倍

此外，2021年最火爆的区块链创新应用是非同质化代币存储价值（NFT） 和区块链游戏。以太坊能提供无需许可且安全的分布式计算平台，因此很多主流NFT和链游应用都架构在以太坊上。上层应用的繁荣就给底层的以太坊带来更多的生态复杂度并扩展了用户基础，即我们常说的出圈。

所以以太坊上的无需许可的创新不断超乎我们的想象，区块链行业里最有价值的创新（Defi，NFT，Gaming）都是首先在以太坊上大规模发生。以太坊的垄断地位随着时间流逝越发不可逆。

**3）以太坊拥有其他公链无法大肆宣扬的东西 — 对去中心化意识形态的坚定承诺**

以太坊最高时大约12000个节点不需要特殊的硬件来参与，也并不是由以太坊基金会去控制大多数节点。

从目前的发展速度和连接广度来看，以太坊未来的可能性要比由传统公司制来驱动的中心化系统要高至少一个维度。从某种程度上看，以太坊平台可能就是最近最火的元宇宙概念的一个雏形.

**4）胖协议瘦应用**

如果拿当年互联网的发展历程做对比，现在的区块链行业相当于刚刚进入拨号上网时代，基础设施还有很大的升级空间。而且区块链行业的特点是胖协议瘦应用，以太坊的创始人V神就预测过，区块链的生态系统不是杀手级的应用，是杀手级的网络，不仅仅是关于稳定币、预测市场、扩容，最重要的是互动，和扩容、ENS、DAO等不同组成部分之间的互动和互联。从这个角度，投资以太坊上的代币ETH可以是普通人把握区块链行业发展机会的最便利有效的手段。

**5）以太坊正在升级为可储值的资产:**

8月启动的EIP-1599的燃烧基础手续费模式（类似用平台的盈利进行代币回购）和明年1H的POS 2.0的质押验证模式将使ETH成为可生息资产，并且通胀率将从今年初的4%大大降低，甚至在未来网络使用多时变成通缩资产。

这将赋予ETH一种自带现金流的属性，将吸引追求现金流的传统机构资金，也便于他们更好理解和评估ETH的价值，会形成正循环。 

**6）ETH的估值**

以太坊的长期市值依赖于其平台所培育的生态系统所能捕获的价值。如果以太坊能实现成为全球最高效的分布式的云计算平台的远景，那它可以捕获的价值将至少和亚马逊云计算+微软云计算+谷歌云计算和安卓系统的总和在一个量级，即5-10万亿美元的价值。假设这能在未来5-10年实现，同时以太坊的供应量因POS 2.0和EIP-1599燃烧机制，将稳定在1亿枚出头，则1 ETH未来5-10年左右的目标价格为5-10万美元，相较现在3000美元出头，有10倍+的成长空间。

**后记：**

码字码到最后，我还是要提醒下所有有耐心看到这的朋友，以上关于加密货币的分析仅是我个人的观点，是我对这个快速变化的新兴行业“盲人摸象”所摸出的一部分感受。你如果对此感兴趣，真心希望你自己要花时间去研究并亲身下场去体验区块链和加密货币的应用，毕竟投资本质上是个非常个人的事儿，相信你在亲身使用的过程中能有更真实的感受。

我在自己的视界所及范围，感受到加密货币将是一场范式革命级别的社会实验。以BTC为代表的加密货币已经经历了新生的第一个10年，但整个行业还处于拨号上网的时代，未来的路还很长，我相信其中还孕育着巨大的非对称性收益的机会，等着我们去发掘。

最后想起当年谷歌的CEO施密特“忽悠”桑德伯格加入谷歌时的那句名言：”如果有人在火箭上提供了一个位置，不要考虑位置好坏，先上去再说。“

而加密货币就是我认为的去往浩瀚苍穹的火箭，我选择跳上它。

title: A brief history of travel distribution
body:
*Initially published on [world.hey.com/luca.cosivi](https://world.hey.com/luca.cosivi) on June 28 2021.*

In this newsletter, you'll get to know how travel distribution evolved in two different time periods:

* Thomas Cook and the advent of travel agents (1841-1996)
* Online Travel Agents (1996-2020)

But first, let's make something clear, something that this pandemic might have allowed us to forget.

### Humans and travel.

Humans have been travelling for thousands of years and the Covid pandemic is a speck of dust in our 300,000-year history as Homo Sapiens. Nonetheless, the way we travel, and the reasons why, have changed throughout history. Unfortunately, if you try to understand how humans travelled more than 15,000 years ago, you must rely on limited methods: fossils, genetics, and present-day hunter-gatherer communities, for example.

For most of history, we didn't rely on intermediaries to plan our trips; we just walked, foraged, hunted, and set up camp. Today's world is different, and since modern tourism began, intermediaries big or small have been a game-changer, enabling millions of us to visit places we couldn't have dreamt of before. That brings us to Thomas Cook, the father of tourism.

## Thomas Cook

Thomas Cook from Leicester, England, was the founder of the travel agency that bears his name. In the history books, he is credited as the first person to commercialise travel. In 1841, Thomas created the first organised trip and acted as the first travel agent.

The thrill of travel quickly spread across the English midlands, and improved workers’ conditions enabled more and more people to take part. In 1855, Thomas Cook organised the first continental trip across Europe. The next 150-years were mostly characterised by strong growth and the proliferation of mass tourism across the world.

However, in mid-2019 Thomas Cook (the agency) filed for bankruptcy, marking the end of an era. Although in reality, the end of this era started a few decades earlier, when travel agents started to go online. Traditional travel agents started to lose more and more market share to a new breed of company that took the business model online in the late 1990s.

## Online Travel Agents 

The year 1996 was a significant one for the industry, as Booking.com, Expedia and Travelocity all launched that year. Although they were not the first to bring travel products online, they were the first to allow travellers to access them directly (skipping ‘traditional’ travel agents).

Airlines, however, had already started to develop and connect to the Global Distribution System (eAAsy Sabre) since 1986. This "delay" of 10-years between airlines being connected to the internet compared to hotels seems to be showing up again in the adoption of Blockchain (more on that in the next newsletter).

Dennis Schaal, an Executive Editor at Skift, published an extensive report on the development of online travel \[2\]. He divided this history into three parts:

* Pre-online travel agency 1985-1993
* The key launches 1996-1998
* Consolidation & evolution 1999 onwards

This market has been in "consolidation mode" for a long time and today the two main players dominate two of the most important regions: Booking.com in Europe and Expedia Inc. in North America. This reflects these two companies’ origins, in Europe and the US respectively, anchoring their market share in these geographies, even though they both operate worldwide.

The two major changes in the market in the last decade are the start of Google Travel and the growth of Airbnb. However, from a structural point of view, the industry hasn't changed a lot, data and contracts are still highly concentrated in the hands of a few players.

Is it a problem though? for travellers? after all booking a trip is easier than ever before. Well, it doesn't take a genius to understand that many cities have inflated hotel prices due to their high commission rates and rate parity agreements.You can see the similarities with the current [tensions that Apple is facing](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2021/apr/30/apple-eu-law-app-store-iphone-ipad-music-streaming) on its high commission fees in the app store. However, the difference is that using an iPhone is a rather sleek experience, but browsing for accommodations on booking.com is an often frustrating, lengthy and stressful experience for most travellers.

All due respect should be given to booking.com and Expedia for their contribution to the travel industry, but it is time to innovate and start adding value to travellers and accommodation providers again. I wouldn't be surprised to see them facing the same fate as Thomas Cook did in 2019 in the next decade (more on the "why" in the next newsletter).

### Historical Timeline

Here is a simplified timeline of the recent history of online travel.

title: Relationship
body:
We are poor
We don't have the luxury to spend time together.
We can look at each other's faces
And listen to each other's voices
But cant hold hands
Can't sit and talk for hours over coffee
Like we wish it to be
We are poorer
Coz for the next 2 weeks we barely talk and rely on the texts to try and make it hurt a little less
And basically depend on the fact that the person exists
Coz now we are cut off from our basic tools of communication.
And mostly this time to text does not collide
Coz u have an unavoidable work and i had an assignment
And even though we might have money
We are poor
Coz we fail to make enough savings of our time
We are under the poverty line
The line that limits us
And it has many types to it
Sometimes it is the family
Sometimes it is the restrictions we are put in
Sometimes it is work and in my case exams
But that does not mean that we are not satisfied
Yes we strive for more we always do
But the fact that there will be a time
Maybe for some hours
That keeps us put
And that makes us to keep up with life
But also a pencil too roughly used can break
That is your fear for us
And it is a genuine one
But i do know that there is something called sharper and that we can always freshen it up
When needed
Coz hey sharpners cost just 5rs and we are not that poor.

title: /Emphyria/
body:
/erebus/darkfield/v.O4524.0000.7345001/sloop.io
cosmicgrain.eth

The figure settled upon the mold, a fragrant carpet tucked beneath the roots and stems of the willow copse. The mold crept down a steep bank to the dwindling creek, which gurgling in anticipation, disappeared beneath a stone almost at its feet. The light of Erebus surrounded it, diffuse, soft, an ocher of pale clay. Inexorable sight-lines of living bamboo, smooth and mottled trunks receding in every direction, motionless, filtered the light into an altered Reality. High above an unheard, unseen wind spoke to the figure only from the rumors of whispering leaves rustling and clinking high above as bamboo leaves do, as noisy as working chain.

The figure, in the /darkfield/, called itself Sloop. Sloop appeared as a slender, faceless humanoid youth, the chiaroscuro grey of the default avatar. No badges or tokens adorned it: this in itself was a caution to other careful players, as not only the fresh and inexperienced displayed no devices. Others who had shed the need to display their hard won devices also appeared at default settings. Sloop perhaps, was an Inexorable.

Sloop who was smooth and nude and genderless, neither wore nor carried anything to the moldy glade by the dwindling creek except a tablet of white light. The grey figure leaned back upon the hard remnant of a ragged tree stump. The pixelations of the stump could not be visualized until one was right upon them, a trick of perspective. The stump was hard and black, devoid and glossy as obsidian; still, it was the shattered wood of some ancient towering tree left forgotten, somehow surviving the overwriting of version after version. How far back the stump, and the creek, and the mold went, how many resets and updates of the game antedated them, Sloop did not know. Offering nothing more than a concealed and peaceful glade in the relative darkness of the ever present bamboo, it functioned as Sloop’s eternal kingdom.

The glade did offer one important feature: strong connection to the Node. Sloop rested the tablet on a knee and tapped into the torrent . . . above, the wind sussed the leaves of bamboo in their trillions each against the other like the shicking of an infinity of naked blades.

Nếu bạn muốn là người trong cuộc trong thị trường crypto thì có thể tham khảo 2 khóa học sau nhé:

* Để hiểu bản chất của thị trường, tâm lý của các nhà đầu tư, cách tìm ra dự án có tính ứng dụng thực tế, lâu dài thì nên xem [khóa này](https://ktclick.com/invite/376795833491?utm_source=x8&utm_content=hook) (thích hợp cho người đầu tư lâu dài hơn là lướt sóng)

**Lưu ý:** 2 khóa học này chỉ chia sẻ thông tin đến từ Coin98 team và không nên được xem là lời khuyên đầu tư. Đầu tư tiền điện tử là rủi ro. Bạn nên cân nhắc kỹ!

Mặc dù mang công nghệ mới nhưng Bitcoin vẫn còn nhiều hạn chế như biến động giá quá cao. Sau đây là các quốc gia chấp nhận Bitcoin.

Khi bạn tìm hiểu về tiền điện tử nói chung và [Bitcoin](https://coinx8.net/bitcoin-la-gi/) nói riêng bạn sẽ muốn biết quốc gia nào đang chấp nhận Bitcoin phải không nào?

Vì càng nhiều quốc gia chấp nhận Bitcoin thì bạn càng cảm thấy yên tâm hơn khi đầu tư vào đồng coin này!

Hơn nữa Bitcoin được coi là “anh cả” trong thị trường crypto. Những tin tức của Bitcoin cũng sẽ ảnh hưởng không nhỏ đến các altcoin khác mà bạn muốn đầu tư.

Nhưng trước tiên chúng ta cần làm rõ một khái niệm. Như thế nào là chấp nhập và không chấp nhận?

Chắc hẳn bạn đã nghe qua về việc Trung Quốc đàn áp thị trường tiền điện tử trong thời gian gần đây.

Nếu bạn nhìn qua về bản đồ tính pháp lý của Bitcoin trên toàn thế giới. Bạn sẽ thấy khá nhiều màu xanh (hợp pháp).

Hợp pháp ở đây nghĩa là các quốc gia đó coi Bitcoin như một loại hàng hóa, tài sản ảo. Mà đã là tài sản thì bạn có thể nắm giữ, giao dịch một cách công khai.

Cho bạn nào thắc mắc về VN. Ngân hàng Nhà nước đã tuyên bố việc phát hành, cung ứng và sử dụng Bitcoin và các loại tiền ảo tương tự khác như là phương tiện thanh toán là bất hợp pháp. Có thể bị xử phạt từ 150 triệu đến 200 triệu đồng. Nhưng Chính phủ không cấm giao dịch Bitcoin như là một hàng hóa hoặc tài sản ảo (theo Wikipedia).

Nhưng ở trong bài viết này mình sẽ không đi vào tính pháp lý của Bitcoin bạn nhé! Ở đây mình chỉ nói về Bitcoin như là một loại loại tiền tệ quốc gia.

## El Salvador trở thành quốc gia đầu tiên chấp nhận Bitcoin

Cho bạn chưa biết thì [El Salvador](https://vi.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Salvador) là một quốc gia Trung Mỹ. Quốc gia này có dân số gần 7 triệu người. Bình quân đầu người theo PPP là khoảng 8.600 USD.

Nền kinh tế của họ chủ yếu dựa vào kiều hối từ Mỹ và nông nghiệp. Từ năm 2001, El Salvador sử dụng đồng USD là đơn vị tiền tệ chính thức thay cho đồng colong nội tệ.

Vào ngày 9/6/2021, Tổng thống Nayib Bukele đã chính thức công bố chấp nhận Bitcoin làm đơn vị tiền tệ quốc gia.

![Tổng thống El Salvador | Image: Flickr](https://coinx8.net/storage/2021/10/cac-quoc-gia-chap-nhap-bitcoin.jpeg)

Như vậy El Salvador trở thành quốc gia đầu tiên trên thế giới chấp nhận Bitcoin như là một đơn vị tiền tệ chính thức.

Tất nhiên là từ đó đến nay có khá nhiều chuyện xảy ra. Ví dụ như trục trặc khi dùng ví Chivo hay có người đập phá các máy ATM Bitcoin.

Nhưng nhìn chung thì đến giờ vẫn ổn!

Sau El Salvador thì nhiều quốc gia cũng đang “ngấp nghé” muốn công nhận Bitcoin như Ukraine hay Panama.

Tuy nhiên đến thời điểm mình viết bài này (7/10/21) thì El Salvador vẫn là quốc gia đầu tiên và duy nhất công nhận Bitcoin.

Nếu có quốc gia nào khác chấp nhận Bitcoin mình sẽ cập nhật ngay!

Như vậy là mình vừa đi qua các quốc gia chấp nhập Bitcoin đến thời điểm hiện tại (tháng 9/21).

Mình sẽ tiếp tục cập nhật!

Note: Tất cả thông tin chỉ để tham khảo, là ý kiến chủ quan của mình và không nên được xem là lời khuyên đầu tư!

title: This is a test article - Perfectionism and worry are using you as a puppet
body:
The title is catchy for a reason. I wanted to have your full attention for a moment to tell you: there are many ways to stop feeling overwhelmed or worrying, but not all coping strategies are created equal.
The one I call the ultimate way is when you do the work. Ha. (thanks for your attention). But please stay a bit longer.
It's not the quick fix. 
It's not a productivity hack or occasional motivation injection.
It's not even alcohol or drugs.
Work as in:

* You work on facing up to what's been causing these outcomes (i.e. overwhelm, worry, you name it)
* You take responsibility for your own actions and potential shortcomings
* You learn to manage your emotions: name them, channel them
* You build practices which work for you
* And you practice them… regularly, perhaps daily 
  
 When people talk about self care as having a bubble bath or something that's occasional, it makes me so angry. Partly because I used to be one of those people who think a new bath bomb will sort it all out. With a glass of wine, take photo, upload it to Instagram. Peace. My ass. Self-care is this non negotiable process where you check in with yourself, ask yourself what you need and work on meeting those needs, as best possible in any given day. An example: You've had a demanding morning, lots of emails which require attention, a meeting here and there. Additional call from child's school. You remember you haven't paid for something and you are also running out of toilet paper. There's nothing exceptional about this scenario. But it's easy to loose foothold and it's only the morning. Taking a pause and checking in, in this particular situation might be counterintuitive. You want to get as much sorted as possible. But your attention is scattered, there is too much going on. Caring for yourself in this moment might look like: organise and prioritise, assess how much time you've got and how much time you think you need to tend to all this. Now double the time you think you will need. Take a breather, move your body, stretch. Stand up. Stroke the cat/dog. Look out the window. Now, based on the above, see what you can move off the priority list. And then see where you can simplify later on in the day:
* Can someone else cook or do shopping?
* You might have to cancel something on your schedule and have a proper rest
* Or the opposite, prioritise shopping, get some really yummy lunch to get you through the afternoon
  The key here? Attention. Awareness. Flexibility. With these you can pretty much make anything happen.
  Without them? You are only a puppet, a not very happy one.

title: Understanding the Matomo Tag Manager Data Layer - Ultimate Guide
body:
## The ultimate guide to mastering the Data Layer

The data layer is the solution to enrich the Matomo Tag Manager with data, to provide information to the existing tags and triggers and to use this data for the control of the Tag Manager. Without the data layer, Matomo’s Tag Manager would have no variables or triggers and that is what the tag firing is based on. So the data layer is the linchpin to unfold the full potential of the Matomo Tag Manager. In this article I will go into all important points concerning Matomo and Data Layer, which you should know.

It is at the same time a help to explain:

## Content

* What is the data layer?
* Installing the Data Layer – How to implement it
* How does the Matomo Tag Manager use this information – What do I do with it?
* Summary

### What is the data layer?

For many, the data layer is a great unknown, complicated to understand and full of inconsistencies. He is the key to unfolding the full potential of the Matomo Tag Manager. And also not so difficult to understand.

Technically speaking, the data layer is a JavaScript array that stores the required information. The Tag Manager then uses this information in the tags, triggers and variables. This information may also be transferred to other systems, for example via marketing tags on Facebook and Google.\~\~(Even if this does not necessarily correspond to the basic principle of Matomo)\~\~So this array is like a temporary, invisible, further layer of the website. The visitors of the website do not see the information and content that the data layer layer has. Since it is an invisible part of the website. [Nevertheless, if you know how to do it, you can still access the information.](https://www.trackingninja.de/en/retrieve-matomo-data-layer-via-the-browser-console/?lang=en)

Imagine the data layer is like a bucket. The bucket can contain different balls, on each ball some information is printed as numbers or words. This can be product information, user IDs or the category of the page, for example. What is in the bucket of your website can also be recorded and used by the Matomo Tag Manager. If you add information, i.e. more balls, to the bucket, the Tag Manager can use them from that point on. This can then be used to control triggers for tags or the Matomo Tracking can be enriched with information that it cannot know by default.

The following figure shows the function of the data layer.

![Matomo Tag Manager Data Layer](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Matomo-Tag-Manager-Data-Layer.png)

It happens again and again that developers do not know the data layer. Because not every website owns it, not everyone who has implemented tracking uses it. But to have a clean tracking and to simplify the work between analysts, developers and external consultants, it is recommended to know it and also to know how such a data layer works.

### Installing the Data Layer – How to implement it

It often happens that the question is asked how a data layer is to be built into the website. [The documentation of Matomo](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/tagmanager/settingup) can be somewhat confusing. [Also in the help for embedding the Tag Manager](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/tagmanager/embedding) it is often not immediately clear what to do. If no additional page information needs to be available at the time of loading the Tag Manager, such as user IDs or product data, there is nothing else to do than to include the Matomo Tag Manager code in the source code of the page. Because as soon as the JavaScript snippet of the Matomo Tag Manager is inserted into the source code of the website and it is loaded by a page visit, the data layer is automatically initiated by the JavaScript snippet. Now the data layer is available, but it is still empty.

But as you can imagine it is possible to extend the Matomo Data Layer. For this purpose, data and information is added or overwritten. They are present until a page change takes place or the page is reloaded. Adding user- or page-specific information I will explain in more detail in the further course of this article. But since such information mostly comes from the backend or is collected via a tracking script, it is good if a web developer takes care of it.\\

**Here is an example of the container snippet of Matomo Tag Manager.**

It is available for every Matomo installation and can be easily removed in the settings by copy&paste.

```
<Matomo Tag Manager.>
<script type="text/javascript">
  var _mtm = window._mtm = window._mtm [];
  _mtm.push({'mtm.startTime': (new Date().getTime()), 'event': 'mtm.Start'})
  var d=document, g=d.createElement('script'), s=d.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
  g.type='text/javascript'; g.async=true; g.src='https://{$MATOMO_URL}/js/container_{$CONTAINER}.js'; s.parentNode.insertBefore(g,s);
</script>
<End Matomo Tag Manager.>
```

#### Declare the data layer

How is the data inserted into the data layer? Because once the data layer is created it is (almost) empty from the beginning. To get the full benefit\~\~and fun\~\~to have data to be added. Imagine that you now fill your empty bucket with balls, which of course have all kinds of information printed on them.\\

There are two ways to do this:

1. Deploy the Matomo Data Layer before the Matomo Tag Manager Code
2. by “pushing” of information by means of a **_mtm.push**

##### Declare the data layer – Deploy the Matomo data layer before the Matomo Tag Manager code

In my opinion, the first method belongs on every website. So that you can get them tracked properly. To do this, insert **the data layer before the Tag Manager Code**. Based on values provided by the CMS, the Tag Manager can then be enriched with this information. Via the Tag Manager settings (variables) they can then be captured when the page is called up and forwarded to Matomo Tracking. This way you can provide for example product data, page ID (some of you know it from WordPress) or, if a user is already logged in, the user ID. Standard Tracking cannot collect or know such information. So we help with this and organize what is recorded and tracked. And since these values already exist when the Tag Manager is loaded, it can also use them for custom dimensions or event tags.

It could look like this:

```
<Static data layer.>
<script>var_mtm = _mtm|| [];
_mtm.push({
'pageValue': '0.5',
'pageTitle': document.title
});
</script>
<Static Data Layer End -->


<Matomo Tag Manager.>

var _mtm = _mtm [];
_mtm.push({'mtm.startTime': (new Date().getTime()), 'event': 'mtm.Start'})

g.type='text/javascript'; g.async=true; g.defer=true; g.src='https://your.domain.de/js/container_12345.js'; s.parentNode.insertBefore(g,s);</script>
<Matomo Tag Manager.>
```

##### _mtm.push

The following method is used to fill the data layer with additional information. Push commands are used to enrich the data layer, the array, with additional attributes. The Tag Manager can then record these events and send them to Matomo Tracking.

*Write a variable to the data layer, make it available:*

```
var _mtm = _mtm [];
window._mtm.push({
  "productColor": "black
});
```

*Write a specific event to the data layer:*

```
var _mtm = _mtm [];
window._mtm.push({
  'event': 'purchase'
});
```

*A site visitor has added a product to the shopping cart:*

```
var _mtm = _mtm [];
window._mtm.push({
  'event': 'addToCard',
  'productID': 'A1B2C3',
  productPrice: '123
});
```

**Note:** It is not absolutely necessary to use **window._mtm**. But it has already proven to be helpful with one or the other website.

### How does the Matomo Tag Manager use this information – What do I do with it?

The Matomo Tag Manager can do two things with it.

1. It can read certain values assigned to a variable.\\
2. With the event information, he can listen for these and then fire certain tags via a trigger (also known as impulse).

#### Reading variables

Now let’s assume your website has different categories. A blog, contact, home page and maybe even a product overview and product detail page. Matomo cannot know where the visitor of the site is at the moment. If you want to record all actions and events, by category or page type, you must provide additional information. You can provide it via the data layer of the Matomo Tag Manager. For this purpose, a static data layer must be provided before the container Snipped.

*It could look like this:*

```
<head>
<script> var _mtm = _mtm [];
_mtm.push ({
'pageCategory': 'Blog'
});
</script>
<script>
<Matomo Tag Manager.>
<! -- ....abcs.js... -->
<End Matomo Tag Manager.>
</script>
</head>
```

Now Matomo can read out the stored value from the data layer right at loading and you can add it, for example, to a custom dimension. This would make it possible to group all page categories such as the blog, product overview pages or the detail pages and compare their performance.

\*[Here a nice example from the Matomo Demo.](https://demo.matomo.org/index.php?module=CoreHome&action=index&idSite=62&period=day&date=yesterday#?idSite=62&period=day&date=yesterday&segment=&category=General_Actions&subcategory=customdimension5)\*\*\*

\*\****Another example based on a user who is logged in to the website via his account:***\*\*A user is logged in via the backend of the page and has already received the value ‘Internal’ (by a previous data layer push) when visiting the page. When the page is called up (Pageview Event in the Tag Manager) it already has a defined userType. The userType is a variable from the data layer of the Tag Manager, which the page owner has created there.

##### The Matomo Tag Manager Data Layer

![user-logged-in](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/user-logged-in.png)

![user_internal_matomo - Variables](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/user_internal_matomo-Variables.png)

When logging off, the variable is updated via a data layer push. This happens, for example, via a script that manages the login function.

```
_mtm.push({
  'event': 'mtEvent',
  'userType': 'undefined'
  });
```

![user-undefined](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/user-undefined-tempsnip.png)

What happened here? The *data layer push event* sent an event with the name *mtEvent* to the data layer. In addition, the variable \*userType \*was rewritten with a value of \*undefined \*(as string).Since the user is no longer logged in, he will be marked as “undefined” on each subsequent visit to the site.

##### The comparison with the sticker

You can imagine it as if you can enter a house through two doors. I f you take the left door you get a blue sticker, if you go through the right door you get a red sticker. This attribute is valid until you remove the sticker. But now you can change, remove or update these attributes. This would give you more stickers, remove or exchange them. And through this one could then make certain classifications. No matter which room you enter in the house, those present there could see which attributes you possess via the stickers.

*Attention:* It is always the last set value of the same variable that is considered current. The update overwrites the previous value! A new data layer must be created for each page. A good example for a better understanding is: When switching from the start page to the contact form, the data layer is not transferred. This also makes sense, since the attributes can change.

##### Intercept values from variables

Let’s follow the example with the variable userType. In the Matomo Tag Manager you can catch the value of the variable userType with the help of a variable. This variable must be available first. To do this, a variable must be created in the Tag Manager, under Variables. To do this, simply call up this area in the Tag Manager and select *CREATE NEW VARIBLE.*

![Tag Manager - Variables](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tag-Manager-Variablen.png)

![user_internal_matomo_variable_overview](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/user_internal_matomo_variable_overview.png)

![Matomo - Variable](https://www.trackingninja.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Matomo-Variable.png)

By this you add an additional variable to the Matomo Tag Manager Data Layer. This can then be used.

I hope that this example makes it a little bit more understandable what the Matomo Data Layer is and how to use the Data Layer. A variable was created for this purpose and a new value was assigned to it as an example. Where does that leave us? Based on events, tags and the variables, you can create a tailor-made tracking based on the necessary requirements. This could then enable the following interaction. An event can act as a trigger, then a tag is fired, e.g. a download event, which should be recorded in Matomo. This tag for contains a custom dimension, which gets its value from an existing variable.

### Summary:

This was certainly not so easy now (and the contribution will grow a little bit with time).Since the use of variables and tags has not yet been explained in detail.

Matomo Tag Manager Data Layer is an important part of Matomo Tracking.  Event tracking can thus be made more dynamic, a new tag does not need to be created for all page interactions. So it allows us to capture interactions (using them as triggers) and retrieve additional data about the interaction or the page content (using the variables of the data layer).I am aware that at the beginning it is difficult to internalize and apply this concept. Even more so because this article ~~still~~ does not represent everything that is possible. Try it out!

Feel free to leave a comment on the page or[ contact me if you have any questions.](https://www.trackingninja.de/en/contact/?lang=en)

## The ultimate guide to mastering the Data Layer

So the data layer is the linchpin to unfold the full potential of the Matomo Tag Manager. In this article I will go into all important points concerning Matomo and Data Layer, which you should know.

Technically speaking, the data layer is a JavaScript array that stores the required information. The Tag Manager then uses this information in the tags, triggers and variables. This information may also be transferred to other systems, for example via marketing tags on Facebook and Google.\~\~(Even if this does not necessarily correspond to the basic principle of Matomo)\~\~So this array is like a temporary, invisible, further layer of the website. The visitors of the website do not see the information and content that the data layer layer has. Since it is an invisible part of the website. [Nevertheless, if you know how to do it, you can still access the information.](https://www.trackingninja.de/en/retrieve-matomo-data-layer-via-the-browser-console/?lang=en)

This can be product information, user IDs or the category of the page, for example. What is in the bucket of your website can also be recorded and used by the Matomo Tag Manager. If you add information, i.e. more balls, to the bucket, the Tag Manager can use them from that point on. This can then be used to control triggers for tags or the Matomo Tracking can be enriched with information that it cannot know by default.

title: Getting Started with Mirror
body:
## Where I get to know Mirror…

One day when I was browsing Twitter, I saw someone retweet a post from Mirror, and then I started to follow news regarding Mirror on Twitter. As of yesterday, Mirror announced that they are now open to all!!! This leads me to here.

[https://twitter.com/viamirror/status/1445427299940196354](https://twitter.com/viamirror/status/1445427299940196354)

What I think is fascinating is that we can start to use blockchain technologies to store articles/blogs written by an individual, thus ensuring that no one can simply edit the articles posted by you and prove that the article belongs to you.

Other than that, you can even mint your own article/blog post as NFT in Mirror!!! Which makes me fascinated about it. (As I can observe the usage of NFT is getting wider)

Besides, you can also crowdfund through Mirror as well by adding a Crowdfund block in the editor. People who are interested can back your project; thus, it can also serve as a decentralized crowdfunding platform to some extent. (I can think of use cases for such as project and charity crowdfunding)

These are some features that make me interested in getting to the platform, and I do like platform like Mirror can replace centralized platforms such as Medium, and people from the crypto space and slowly move to Mirror.

body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TSZ1yTtmrx-FkCX_NA55u.png?height=738&width=1400)

我们邀请用户在Polkalokr漏洞赏金中对我们的多链令牌桥进行压力测试。

八月将成为区块链互操作性和可扩展性的重要时刻。它将被铭记为Polkalokr创建多链令牌桥的那一刻——以太坊、币安智能链和Polygon可作为用户可以在Bridgr中使用的链。

桥的代码目前是开源的，任何想要通过我们的平台实现多链令牌桥的人都可以使用。要了解更多信息，您可以在[此处](https://medium.com/polkalokr/testnet-launch-and-user-guide-ff587ba1d92d)阅读我们关于Bridgr的文章。

# 详情

Polkalokr的漏洞赏金计划是我们的道德研究人员测试高科技项目并通过报告检测到的漏洞（取决于其严重程度）获得有吸引力的经济奖励的绝佳机会：

# 网站：

**关键 3,000–5,000 美元**

**高 1,500–3,000 美元**

**中 500–900 美元**

**低 50–100 美元**

# 智能合约：

**关键 3,000–5,000 美元高达 10% 的风险资金**

**高 1,500–3,000 美元**

**中 500–900 美元**

**低 50–100 美元**

多链桥的评估范围将包括智能合约和 dApp：

* [https://bridgr-testnet.polkalokr.com](https://bridgr-testnet.polkalokr.com/) — 负责允许创建桥梁，并支持在Polygon、Binance 智能链和以太坊之间转移代币。
* 以太坊桥接合约——负责在以太坊端发送交易、锁定和解锁代币。
* 币安桥合约——负责在币安智能链端发送交易以及铸造和销毁代币。
* Polygon 桥接合约——负责在Polygon智能链端发送交易以及铸造和销毁代币。
* Relayer——负责跨链通信。
* MongoDB — 负责存储有关已创建的桥的信息。
* 代币合约——代表应用程序的用户部署，这些合约允许项目在另一条链上拥有自己的代币。

*为确保您遵守我们的赏金准则，请查看有关如何通过[HackenProof](https://hackenproof.com/polkalokr/polkalokr-1)参与和提交任何问题的[说明](https://hackenproof.com/polkalokr/polkalokr-1)。*

# 关于Bridgr

Bridgr使用户能够通过Polkalokr的平台生成自己的完全去中心化的跨链代币桥。通过访问 Bridgr仪表板，用户只需点击几下即可打造一座适合他们需求的桥梁。通常，使用桥接器进行交易涉及一个繁琐的两步过程，其中用户在从桥接器合约存入和索取资产时执行两笔交易。为了节省金钱和时间，Bridgr简化了这个过程，使用户无需任何编码知识即可轻松部署多链桥。

要了解更多信息，请[在此处](https://polkalokr.notion.site/Bridgr-User-Guide-70c5e2164ae94125a65c48e66f38cc9f)查看我们的用户指南或查看[Bridgr](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVisnlUlxdc)与 Polkalokr 首席执行官兼联合创始人Imran Ashfaq的[现场演示](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVisnlUlxdc)。

# 关于Polkaokr
