title: Internet ou la naissance du levier infini
body:
Internet a enfanté un nouveau concept que peu savent nommer, mais qui est visible tous les jours : **la scalabilité, a.k.a effet de levier quasiment infini.**

![Source : @visualizevalue](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qw4aOwyHVscN3fduq2sF5.png?height=383&width=680)

Comprendre les tenants et aboutissants de ce phénomène permet d’expliquer de nombreuses « aberrations » évoquées durant le premier confinement, notamment *la célèbre réflexion « Mais pourquoi une infirmière (\*ou n’importe quel métier manuel\*) est moins payée qu’un influenceur ? ».*

La scalabilité est un principe **né après l’invention des machines** durant la révolution industrielle, même si l’on peut considérer que l’exploitation humaine durant l’antiquité, le moyen-âge et surtout l’ère post Colomb est une dérivée de celle-ci — bien moins éthique — basée sur des êtres humains.

> *Mais elle a encore évolué et a atteint sa forme finale avec l’apparition de concept comme les ordinateurs, les téléphones et surtout : **INTERNET**.*

Pour poser une définition simple :

## “La scalabilité évoque toutes les actions où les retours sont supérieurs aux apports.”


---

Un exemple concret : lorsque vous coupez un arbre, vous effectuez l’action de hacher du bois, qui coûtera de l’énergie ainsi qu’une matière première, du bois — de forme brute, pour donner en retour du bois taillé.

Avec une forme d’équation simple, ça nous donne : **énergie + bois brut = bois taillé.** L’opération ne pourrait avoir lieu sans énergie, sans humain — ainsi que sans bois brut.

En chiffrant cette opération — pour l’explication — on imagine que du bois brut coûte $10 par unité et $15 pour un bois taillé, avec une opération de transformation qui dure 1 heure. Avec une semaine de 35 h, on a un salaire de $5 par heure, donnant $175 au total, sans possibilité de faire augmenter la productivité : il n’y a qu’un seul humain, vous, et **le temps n’est pas extensible.**

Dans un **second niveau de scalabilité**, celui de la révolution industrielle, vous pourriez acheter une machine, taillant un bois brut pour en faire un bois taillé, tout ça en échange d’électricité.

> *Cet achat vous permet d’être ailleurs pendant cette opération — permettant d’augmenter la productivité — mais vous restez dépendant d’une ressource : le bois brut.*

L’installation pourrait être constituée de 10 machines, produisant 2 bois taillés par heure, donnant un profit de 10\*35\*10 = $3500 par semaine (sans compter le coût d’achat des machines — et l’électricité).

**Idéal n’est-ce pas ?** Pourtant, l’opération est toujours plafonnée par le prix d’un bois brut et est soumise à un marché capitaliste rude. Dans un contexte réel, il y a fort à parier que les marges sont plus de l’ordre de $0.05, et que la concurrence agit pour faire baisser les marges.


---

Ce qui nous amène au stade ultime de scalabilité : née avec Internet, elle permet **d’extraire de la valeur de ressources intangibles.** L’exemple le plus connu et parlant est sans doute celui de l’algorithme du moteur de recherche de Google.

![Différentes versions de l'algorithme Google](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QbiQY7ZzAHaqZApxaEDlq.jpg?height=415&width=700)

D’un point de vue opérationnel, il ne coûte rien de plus que le salaire des personnes qui l’ont mis au point (ainsi que les serveurs et d’autres détails). **De l’autre côté, il sert des milliards de personnes chaque jour et supporte des millions de business sur Internet.**

En posant une dernière fois l’équation, on se rend rapidement compte que les retours sont bien supérieurs aux apports, surtout en considérant que le salaire des personnes peut être stoppé à n’importe quel moment, et **l’algorithme continuera toujours à fonctionner et servir les masses.**


---

L’algorithme possède un **levier infini** : il peut toucher le monde entier, n’a pas de coût de fonctionnement et on le verra ensuite, n’est pas soumis aux mêmes lois du marché.

![Source : @visualizevalue
](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6DYDNxhqoZByUSaJ4sfYp.png?height=383&width=680)

Pour répondre à la question initiale : **malheureusement, tous les types de travail ne se valent pas.** Puisqu’elle est physique, l’infirmière pourra servir une dizaine de patients par jour, peut-être une centaine dans les grandes journées. De l’autre côté, une version scalable d’une infirmière serait un médicament — ou bien **Google** et les conseils de blogs comme Doctissimo — qui permettent de toucher des millions de personnes avec une ressource qui est déclinable.

Un autre point que j’aborderai sans doute dans un autre article puisqu’il est assez compliqué est la valeur du travail. Pour l’évoquer rapidement, les choix de travail sont considérés comme un **dilemme : épanouissement dans le travail ou salaire élevé.** Chaque année d’études ouvre un spectre de possibilité, débouchant sur des choix : soit un salaire moins élevé, mais proposant un épanouissement personnel et généralement un bienfait pour la société (dans la définition populaire), ou bien un salaire plus élevé, mais des perspectives, mais faisant une croix sur l’épanouissement personnel. Les métiers à la croisée de ces mondes sont généralement les plus demandés et recherchés : **avocat ou médecin.**

Pour développer sur l’analogie de Google, il est impossible de copier leur algorithme, puisqu’il évolue en permanence grâce aux données propriétaires de Google, qu’il est l’un des codes source les mieux gardés du monde et également qu’ils disposent d’une **image de marque** très puissante.

![Top 10 des marques les plus puissantes du monde](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3c1JpUjRSRVwKbuhNIZQB.jpg?height=600&width=1000)

# En 2021, les hommes les plus puissants du monde sont ceux qui gèrent les algorithmes de Google, Facebook et Twitter.

Il suffit de se rendre compte des polémiques que **[Cambridge Analytica](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cambridge_Analytica)** a engendrées en 2016 : une simple entreprise aurait réussi à **influencer la campagne de la première puissance mondiale avec un seul outil : Facebook.**

Imaginez les possibilités que Facebook possède pour modifier ces algorithmes en fonction de leur bon vouloir : ils peuvent filtrer des contenus qui ne leur plaisent pas où faire disparaitre du feed Facebook des personnes via leur outil d’identification faciale. **Mais le pire, c’est que personne ne serait capable de le détecter, puisque le code est privé et inaccessible.**


---

> *L’humain a passé son existence à tenter d’influencer l’opinion publique.*

![Propagande américaine](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JrM0_HlXKXYcw7sP6auqy.jpg?height=850&width=560)

Des sommes monstrueuses ont été et sont toujours dépensées durant les élections américaines, une **grosse branche de l’économie moderne est axée sur la vente — le marketing**, pourtant le salaire des influenceurs fait débat.

![Budgets marketing par industries
](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KDQpakssb6uTTt6RhG0yp.png?height=641&width=1026)

Certaines influenceuses telles que **[Lena Situations](https://www.instagram.com/lenamahfouf/)** touchent plus de 2 millions de Français à chaque publication, disposent d’une image irréprochable et d’un public fidèle : en effet, son livre sorti en 2020 a été **presque aussi vendu que celui de l’ex-Président Américain Barack Obama.**

Dans une société aussi portée sur le marketing et l’apparence, la valeur d’une personne ayant **la possibilité d’influencer avec un effet de levier infini plus de 2M de français en un seul post Instagram est logiquement bien plus élevé que le métier non-scalable d’infirmière.**

> *Internet crée de nombreuses possibilités de porter des métiers non-scalables en des métiers scalables.*

Pour voir si le concept est familier pour vous, voilà un petit jeu où vous *devrez proposer un métier scalable en partant d’un métier non-scalable listé* :

* Médecin : ?
* Taxi : ?
* Chauffeur de bus : ?
* Enseignant : ?
* Banquier : ?


---

Résultats (qui ne sont pas officiels et bien sûr différents pour chaque perception) :

* Médecins : **Doctissimo**, proposant des systèmes de recherche pour vos potentielles maladies — Google travaille également là-dessus, en rentrant vos symptômes et proposant des kits de mesure maison.
* Taxi : **Uber** ou Blablacar.
* Chauffeur de bus : Services de mobilités urbaines comme **Lime** ou Velib.
* Enseignant : **Udemy**, Coursera ou même Khan Academy en version gratuite.
* Banquier : **Ethereum** et des protocoles de prêts ouverts tels que Aave ou Compound.


---

**Les plus grandes opportunités actuelles sont de transformer ces métiers non-scalables en des métiers scalables** : Uber, AirBNB ou Udemy en sont les exemples parfaits. Permettre à n’importe qui d’accéder à un service et créer un avantage compétitif inarrêtable. AirBNB par exemple ne sert que d’interface entre des locataires et des loueurs, mais possède une image de marque et une base de données qui la rend incontournable.

## La clé du 21ᵉ siècle est de travailler intelligemment, et de réussir à créer du contenu touchant le maximum de personne, avec un minimum d’input.

![Source : @visualizevalue
](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JzDM8fKIRbK-joy08lD9-.jpg?height=383&width=680)

Il n’a jamais été aussi simple de partager vos opinions : **un simple article, tweet ou podcast peut influencer des millions de personnes.**

→ Suivez-moi sur **Twitter** : 

[https://twitter.com/leo5imon](https://twitter.com/leo5imon)

title: #0  Mirror攻略： mirror vs 币乎
body:
关于我：我是一个喜欢写作的程序员，非著名币圈博主，长期混迹币圈，喜欢各种折腾， 2011年逛比特币论坛，2013年尝试挖矿，2017年开始玩币圈投资，从此一发不可收拾，经历了几次大跌大涨，成为一个屹立不动的老韭菜。币圈日新月异，为我打开了新天地，从ICO热潮，到交易挖矿，再到DeFi挖矿，再到NFT， Metaverse，DAO，我每一样都玩了一遍，乐此不疲。 

 来Mirror之前，我的写作主阵地是微信公众号，还有币乎。 我是币乎的早期用户。微信公众号不是一个专注币圈写作的平台，暂且不谈。  今天主要谈谈币乎和Mirror。 

## 写作体验

首先从写作体验上，mirror支持blocks这种形式，还是挺有意思的，方便进行各种链接， 这估计是借鉴了notion这个写作神器，我觉得这个也是mirror最大的亮点之一。此外 mirror支持markdown的语法（markdown是一种流行且灵活的写作格式），还支持从其它平台（比如medium）导入文章，这些都是有别于币乎的地方。 从写作体验上，我觉得mirror是远胜于币乎的。 

## 去中心化程度

其次从去中心程度，币乎最多是web2.0应用，mirror算web3.0. 为什么这样说呢？ 

* 币乎的代币系统虽然是基于区块链的， 但是其内容的的存储是中心化的，受监管严重， 现在的审核删帖其实挺严重的，而mirror的存储底层基于去中心存储。 
* mirror支持用metamask（小狐狸钱包）直接登录，这是web3.0应用的一个典型特点。而目前币乎还需要手机号注册。
* mirror原生支持区块链的元素，如加密货币转账打赏，NFT，DAO，ICO(我理解crowdfunds和ICO是类似的)

## 激励系统

最后从激励系统上， 币乎发行了Key代币，对作者的内容进行奖励，收到的赞越多，相应的奖励也越多，鼓励作者发布优质内容。 目前币乎的奖励相对是比较单一的。 而mirror不但支持转账打赏，还支持众筹，拍卖，NFT分发等方式。 提供给作者的更多的赚钱工具和想象空间。 未来mirror大概率还会发币空投给作者，会成为另外一种激励方式，拭目以待。 

## 结论

结论： Mirror是基于Web3.0的写作平台，给我们带来了全新的体验，未来也会大放异彩。币乎已经过时了，Mirror才是未来。 

PS: 这是我在mirror的第一篇文章，接下来我也会创作更多的文章，介绍币圈的各种概念和新鲜事，以及潜在的赚钱机会。

title: Oasis网络Rose值得拥有‖蛋总持仓火腿巨亏；不要相信币圈雷锋、好心人~
body:
![](https://oss-cdn1.bihu-static.com/image/20211004/136faefb6b074d42863f625dfe34158c_GE2TAMBOGAVDEMBQGAXDA.jpeg)

**周五愉快！欢迎大佬们来“金世界”做客指导，我是你们的老朋友金湖居士。**

**01）蛋总持仓HT巨亏**

国庆长假感觉过得特别快，长假最后一天火币网创始人李林微信群聊被曝光引起了市场投资者的激烈讨论。

有人理解但骂的人显然更多，据很多老韭菜回忆这些年水币干了不少如拔网线等损人利己的事。

现在李林要拍屁股不干了，市场立刻就有了负面的反应，HT更是应声下跌。

title: The Metaverse: Abstracted Reality And The Future Of Tokenized Life
body:
Digital asset trading is changing the way we interact with our surroundings — both online and offline — and is giving rise to a new era of virtualized, decentralized capitalism in which everyone can participate.

What is the Metaverse? The idea of a metaverse has been around for over two decades now, yet it's only recently that we've started to see its features realized in blockchain tech. With the tokenization of assets and economies, everything you interact with online can begin to resemble an extension of your identity in a virtual world, with digital assets and items that can be bought, sold, traded, used for game purposes, etc.

The Metaverse is best thought of as an ecosystem in which all these virtual worlds are connected through the internet; it's a universe of universes that gives rise to an entire economy of virtual assets. Some have interpreted it as the next phase of the internet - as an information network - while others compare it to Facebook - a social media network - but the Metaverse is both of these together, and much more.

## **The Metaverse will become increasingly important in our daily lives.**

Blockchains will inevitably constitute a digital record of our entire lives. Our identities, businesses, everything we own or interact with could one day be stored on a blockchain ledger. With the Metaverse, every asset you use, from your toothbrush to your home, can have its own virtual representation. No, I don’t know why you want a toothbrush on the blockchain. That doesn’t mean it won’t happen.

It’s a future that could see digital assets becoming commonplace, and it also means you can finally own your data. Why does Facebook get to hold all the information you post on their site? Why should Google prevent developers from using the content you put online but then sell them to advertisers? Under blockchain-based technologies, users of these platforms can interact directly and own their own data.

You can even use your digital assets to make or receive payments, and the Metaverse will enable seamless interoperability between different platforms. One day, you might wake up with a new "born" avatar (who you created yourself), and as such, they'll be indistinguishable from an ordinary person... or perhaps even a celebrity.

What if you owned a fraction of Lebron James's avatar, and he allowed you to trade that asset on a particular platform? What if your avatar performed the same role as the models who currently advertise products on Instagram, but instead of being paid in USD or EUR, they're paid in a native token? The avatar's client (who's paying them) can buy in-game items to enhance the avatar's image with, or perhaps the avatar will earn royalties when their likeness is used on other platforms (where they're rendered in an animation). Suddenly, your digital self has real value. This is all possible when you consider that blockchains are programmable and that digital assets can be used for many more purposes than just financial transactions.

## **How will the Metaverse enable non-edge case users to benefit from blockchain technology?**

The Metaverse evolves from tokenization — tokens can represent many different types of assets, and the possibilities of what you can achieve with all this data are endless.

Not only will we be able to use avatars in virtual worlds — given that they're stored on a programmable blockchain, they'll also be able to represent anything that has value, and assign value to previously devalued classes.

That includes all of our online data, too, that presently lies in the hands of large corporations. In the future, as more data is generated and as our devices become increasingly interconnected, there will be a massive demand for processing power.

If you're going to develop a platform that can handle large amounts of data, you'll also need an enormous amount of computing power. This demands an entirely decentralized internet architecture, and blockchain provides this solution.

We live in a world where we're surrounded by virtual objects and services, and in the future, this will be even more prevalent. There's also an enormous amount of data generated — from our browsing history to all the Tweets we've posted — and we're not in control of it.

If you follow someone on Twitter or interact with their avatar in a virtual world, they would likely like to make money from this.

The majority of existing virtual worlds have been built on top of large corporations' infrastructure, so developers must pay a considerable sum to store their avatars and data. With tokens on the blockchain, there's no more need for a centralized server — the Metaverse is free to use and accessible by anyone. 

It brings out all of the promises that decentralization holds: censorship resistance, transparency, immutable ledgers, and so on.

title: Why You Need to Start Paying Attention to Web3 Right Now!
body:
The rise of Web3 has seen some of the most phenomenal achievements we have ever seen in the history of the internet. NFT’s were introduced to us through Crypto-Kitties and took a while for people to become aware of just how much potential they had.

What are NFT’s? NFT’s are defined as non-fungible tokens which provides you with digital ownership of an item through what is called a ‘smart contract’. A smart contract is a digital computer programme that can execute legal events that can be stored on the blockchain for all to see.

Why is this important? Web3 has created new opportunities that we have never seen before, while simultaneously disrupting traditional methods and practices. Be it in Finance, Art, Gaming, Music and many more industries. Web3 has made it possible for creators to interact directly with their community. Community in society has been the driving force of every major movement in history across Religion, Politics and Artistry. It has been at the hub of change since the dawn of time.

Web3 has now given more power to communities than ever before. So why should Celebrity Creators be more in touch with Web3 and their communities you ask? We are experiencing a change in how people think. The barrier between society and celebrities has become thinner through the accessibility of social media. It is no longer about worshipping someone who you thought was at an unattainable level. Social media has enabled individuals and provides opportunities for anyone with a creative eye or vision to feel like they can do anything and be successful at it. Today, this is achievable as long as they are able to amass an audience, which essentially becomes their community.

The traditional methods over the last few decades have been; a celebrity achieves a certain amount of fame while amassing an army of fans who show loyalty to their favourite celebrities. They then show their loyalty by buying merch, memorabilia, attending concerts and more. But what if Web3 allowed you to create an ecosystem where you could allow your fans to benefit and earn royalties from your career as you are on the rise?

Web3 not only rewards creators who have grown a genuine dedicated community, it also rewards members in the community. Web3 is not about isolating yourself. It’s about sharing and being rewarded for communicating with your audience on a regular basis.

We have seen the rise of the Bored Ape Yacht Club Project, which has seen over $600 million in trade volume since it started in late April. If a Web2 start-up had achieved such numbers in that short amount of time it could easily be placed at a high raking, potentially surpassing Amazon.

Bored Ape Yacht Club showed the value in creating a community and making people feel like they are a part of something big that they can invest in. This is the power of Web3 and why creators across all industries should be looking at Web3 as a way to take their careers to the very next level, whilst allowing their loyal community to join them.

An idea of how you can give value to your community in Web3 is for example; let’s say you’ve created a hardcore fanbase. NFT’s gives you the opportunity to sell your content to your fans and provides them digital ownership of whatever it is that you’re selling to them. There are various ways to reward them for being a holder of your NFT. You are able to release exclusive monthly airdrops for holders only, which they can make an income from and also increase the value of the original NFT that you sold to them. NFT’s that are linked to intellectual properties are what can create lucrative value for your community. Can you imagine J.K Rowling being a relatively unknown writer selling 100 versions of each Harry Potter character as an NFT at the launch of her first book? Then making the characters more relevant over time with new books and movies? This is the beauty of Web3, the opportunities are endless.

NFT’s linked to intellectual properties provides value to the community that you have grown. Your community then becomes evangelicals for your project as more awareness is being brought your way. Socialists are excited to see the prospectus of the future. It’s a win for all involving parties. The creator, the holders and followers alike for such a project. Web3 is the future and should be something that is explored by every creative across all industries as the opportunities for everyone as a community to grow are endless.

Do you want to create the next Disney? Harry Potter, or Star Wars? Do it on Web3 and you won’t regret it.

title: NFTs 101: What makes a good JPG?
body:
Quick plug for my previous post, especially for those who are brand new to NFTs - start here:

[https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8](https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8)

[https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8](https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8)

[https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8](https://mirror.xyz/0xa25C3aAc588C85EA3B5B4AA84d7f812f34354F66/KaKFfoXs5Bq2XeIIaAn0DBR5p0OXzN3RS1xKggr-yK8)

This one is longer than the first - buckle in. So now that your brain is on fire and completely overwhelmed by the emerging vastness of the metaverse, should you just ape into the first project that you think looks cool? No. Aping is fun, but missing out on the next project that will inevitably come because of a sudden lack of funds is not. THAT is real FOMO.

The best way to avoid FOMO, but more importantly have conviction about your jpegs is to develop a self-honest framework to evaluate a project across key attributes. This will inevitably look different for everyone - What do you care about? What do you find interesting? What makes you happy? What will you be willing to spend time and energy on?

The factors I look at for every project are:

* Art / Aesthetic
* Memability
* Scarcity
* Leadership
* Community vibes
* Brand energy vs hype
* High-profile members (whales, celebrities, influencers)
* Future direction structure - e.g. roadmap
* Cultivation of community content development
* Tokenomics / Defi
* DAO
* Timing...am I early?

Full disclosure: I have attempted to include a mix of example NFT projects - from those that I do not own, those I own (am I biased? of course), and those I have sold - always from a positive lens because WAGMI

**Art / Aesthetic** - at the end of the day, this is the only thing you truly have and therefore the most important factor about many jpegs. If everything comes crumbling down and our jpegs’ value goes to 0 USD, this is what will be left amongst the rubble. The only rule is to be honest with yourself.

* Tier 1: How visually appealing is the jpeg to your brain? Do you think it’s cool? Does it make you smile?

Don't take it from me. Take it from 6529:

[https://twitter.com/punk6529/status/1444270981795782658?s=20](https://twitter.com/punk6529/status/1444270981795782658?s=20)

* Tier 2: Famous artist? Unique style? Intriguing format? Dank, rare 1/1’s in the collection?

An example of unique art in a pfp NFT is the Galactic Geckos of Solana: 

[https://twitter.com/SolanaLegend/status/1444398858360999945?s=20](https://twitter.com/SolanaLegend/status/1444398858360999945?s=20)

An example of a well-renowned artist in the NFT space is GREMPLIN from the iconic project Nouns DAO 

[https://nouns.wtf/](https://nouns.wtf/)

**Memability**, because memes are the most important thing in the world

* Memes as myths: 

  [https://twitter.com/punk6529/status/1424127573878005763?s=20](https://twitter.com/punk6529/status/1424127573878005763?s=20)

* Big investors take note: 

  [https://twitter.com/iamDCinvestor/status/1445062705942044686?s=20](https://twitter.com/iamDCinvestor/status/1445062705942044686?s=20)


**Scarcity** - this is straightforward. We are status-seeking monkeys. 

If you learn nothing else from me today besides Eugene Wei’s Status as a Service (StaaS) blog post, gonna make it 

[https://www.eugenewei.com/blog/2019/2/19/status-as-a-service](https://www.eugenewei.com/blog/2019/2/19/status-as-a-service)

But scarcity only matters with the assumption of quality 

[https://twitter.com/ShaanVP/status/1435125897774845953?s=20](https://twitter.com/ShaanVP/status/1435125897774845953?s=20)

**Leadership** can come through as an individual or collective in a decentralized community project, but Saint Eclectic explains key core tenants of leadership that I consistently see across the NFT space - Humility, Principles, Transparency 

[https://twitter.com/sainteclectic/status/1439919189154836485?s=20](https://twitter.com/sainteclectic/status/1439919189154836485?s=20)

Some examples of quality leadership:

* GANder_art community understood that many members were disappointed with their original minted works, so they developed a better algorithm with improved resolution and aesthetics and offered it as a free swap to holders: 

  [https://twitter.com/GANder_art/status/1444839603140182016?s=20](https://twitter.com/GANder_art/status/1444839603140182016?s=20)

* Thugbirdz providing airdrop collabs with artists, following up with members who experienced issues and also rewards it’s “OGs” 

  [https://twitter.com/thugbirdz/status/1445370254448893953?s=20](https://twitter.com/thugbirdz/status/1445370254448893953?s=20)


[https://twitter.com/thugDAO/status/1443937417082384398?s=20](https://twitter.com/thugDAO/status/1443937417082384398?s=20)

* Test guys team realized they messed up the mint randomization, so they paused the minting, reduced the mint price from 1 to 0.5 sol, and airdropped 2 free test guys for those who minted at 1 sol 

  [https://twitter.com/Test_Guys/status/1439056979356372996?s=20](https://twitter.com/Test_Guys/status/1439056979356372996?s=20)


What type of characteristics do I want in a leader of an NFT project I love? How and why are those characteristics different from the ways we classify leadership today? …...thoughts for another time.

Insightful example: Founder of one of my favorite projects, The Wanderers 

[https://anchor.fm/notboring/episodes/Not-Boring-Founders-Nick-Greenawalt--Wanderers-e1845ep](https://anchor.fm/notboring/episodes/Not-Boring-Founders-Nick-Greenawalt--Wanderers-e1845ep)

**Community vibes** - what do I mean by vibes? The collective emotional state of the community, represented on Discord and Twitter at any given time. Good vibes beget community growth - it is human nature. If I were to boil down the NFT community to the purest positive community vibes - it's Cryptoadz. They’ve built social norms of the community via memes generated by bot commands that directly combat toxic aspects of NFT culture

* Toxic dynamic #1: FUD
  * Solution: !vibe - first thing comes first when you go to the lily pad (Cryptoadz general chat). Come, stay, vibe. This is your rock, your north star. If you’re feeling yourself, vibe. If you had an awful meeting, vibe. Puppy took a dump in the house? Vibe.
* Toxic dynamic #2: conversations complaining about floor price and anyone who spams “DELIST”

* Memability
* Scarcity
* Leadership
* Community vibes
* Brand energy vs hype

* Future direction structure - e.g. roadmap
* Cultivation of community content development
* Tokenomics / Defi

title: Business Lessons From A Japanese Ghost
body:
Overspecialization breeds weakness. It's a slow death.

The first time I heard that phrase, I was confused but the more I thought about it, the more it made sense.

If you are too predictable, you will be at a disadvantage. This is true in our everyday lives, but more so in business.

With every wrong decision, your competitor can sweep in and take your piece of the pie.

Most established businesses share the same predictable flaw.

Every business wants the ivy league graduate, and few want those without prestige.

Most people think the ivy league graduate will outsmart, outwork and outhustle the person without the same credentials.

But that's a mistake. There are always more ways to view a situation.

More businesses should hire the outsider. The honest, hardworking person without a degree. The person who had to figure out how to live. For that person knows how to survive.

If you have too many of the same viewpoints, you leave yourself open to blindsides.

To have a strong business, you need people from all backgrounds, ages, genders, and sexes. You need viewpoints from every angle, so you're not caught off guard.

It is a mistake to assume people lack the capabilities to achieve greatness because of their educational background.

In Ghost in the Shell, a 1995 Japanese Anime, Motoko Kusanagi, said, "What's true for the group is also true for the individual." You reflect the type of business you are creating, and you have the power to expand beyond overspecialized boundaries.

title: Bitcoin May Have Topped Before 2024
body:
![An Iceland Bitcoin Farm](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*PIb4ML5iMzfEOikjKqjiZA.jpeg)

All people in the crypto circle have felt the enormous impact of recent China regulation on bitcoin and crypto currencies in general. Many are still licking the wound. Among the most adversely affected groups are the bitcoin miners. The general sentiment is that this bear market will last for a while, and then bitcoin will come back to make new all time highs. However, very few have done enough fundamental analysis from a bitcoin mining perspective to quantify the future upside. This article makes an effort to predict the intermediate term upper bound of bitcoin price. Let’s start with the conclusion first.

**Bitcoin price is very unlikely to stay above $60K for a few months before the next halving. In other words, bitcoin may have topped before 2024. Accordingly, bitcoin price volatility drops to a point that makes bitcoin a real great store of value.**

The key culprit is electricity capacity. The world produces roughly 30 trillion KWh of electricity, out of which China counts for a lion’s share of around 30%. Another amazing fact is that almost 100% of electricity growth is from China. Excluding China, the world electricity growth is pretty much flat. For instance, the US electricity production has stayed flat at around 4 trillion KWh annually for the last decade.

![World Production Growth](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*cSJGReAT6donNwVx)

![Production by Country](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*o6jdUYnvTYJ6BIZc)

A May 2021 Harvard Business Review article quoted that [bitcoin consumes 0.55% of the world’s electricity production](https://hbr.org/2021/05/how-much-energy-does-bitcoin-actually-consume). Recent bitcoin hash rate crash confirms that 70% of mining was in China before the crackdown, i.e. only 30% of mining was outside of China. A quick calculation shows only 0.24% ( = 1 \* 0.55% \* 30% / 70%) of total electricity capacity outside of China was used for bitcoin mining. Now that China is offline, to just refill the capacity, we need to boost up bitcoin utilization rate to 0.79% ( = 0.55% / 70%) from 0.24%. That is a net increase of more than 200%. Given that the electricity production growth rate outside of China is close to zero, such an increase is extremely unlikely if not impossible.

Let’s assume that bitcoin is so popular that countries manage to allocate 1% of capacity for bitcoin mining. The current average electricity price for normal residential and industrial usages is roughly $0.10. Thus, total annual electricity cost for bitcoin mining world wide would be $20 billion ( = 30 trillion \* 70% \* $0.10).

In a sufficiently competitive market, mining rigs can be manufactured at much lower cost, compared to electricity. Mining rigs are basically semiconductor chips, with a price curve typically following Moore’s law. Whereas electricity is heavy infrastructure with a price curve that is mostly linear. That is why we believe electricity will be the primary portion of the overall cost in the bitcoin mining industry.

Before the next halving in 2024, bitcoin awards 900 coins daily or 328,500 coins a year. A sustainable bitcoin price can be extrapolated by total electricity cost divided by number of coins. So we come up with a roughly $60K price target ( \~= $20B / 328K).

Even such estimation needs to adjust lower. Remember that miners also get rewarded by transaction fees, which covers part of the electricity cost. So the electricity cost carried to bitcoin price is even lower.

You may wonder what if bitcoin price just goes above $60K and stays for a few months. What would happen? The society will run into chaos, because of lack of electricity for normal daily life. It is that simple.

Such an unsustainable bitcoin price would also amplify environmental concerns. It is hard to imagine bitcoin could still be mined mostly by renewable energy when the whole world excluding China is running out of capacity.

Therefore, we conclude that bitcoin price may have already topped in the current halving cycle, primarily due to electricity capacity constraints. If this is proven to be true, it might be a great moment, as bitcoin has grown up. Bitcoin could be traded in the range between $30K and $60K. The volatility is in line with major major currencies. Bitcoin may indeed become a store of value with much better inflation protection than any fiat currency.

title: Creative Communes Translated Into NFT Based Micro-economies
body:
[![](https://cdn.substack.com/image/fetch/w\_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F61b0693c-4a4d-4dc5-939d-ef429440b98f\_4098x3072.jpeg)](https://cdn.substack.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F61b0693c-4a4d-4dc5-939d-ef429440b98f\_4098x3072.jpeg)

Creative communes originated in the 1960s counterculture to generate self-sufficient, egalitarian, and mutually beneficial arrangements that supplied and supported their members through shared and exchanged resources.

We have the chance to reconsider the financial aspect of creative communes; crypto may be utilized in creative communities to unlock collaborative production, reduce costs, and lay the groundwork for New Financial Technology-based micro-economies.

The sharing economy that we see today is simply another form of giving and receiving between people, facilitated by businesses with substantial capital. Most of them are centralized, taking part in the transactions for profit. Is it possible to replicate this on the blockchain, with artists themselves at the core of the network?

Blockchain tech allows artists to create one-of-a-kind digital assets assigned to a single owner, comparable to the notion of physical integrity, which can help increase the value of virtual artworks and real-world locations connected to them.

The first solution to this issue may be for artists and developers to create/mint NFTs, which they can use as a utility currency to participate in studios, workshops or establish work exchanges.

NFTs in creative communes and blockchain in connection with art can be used to create works in a more democratic way, where the absolute ownership is not mortgaged by the galleries or museums.

Tokenizing physical spaces is possible via artists creating NFTs by minting new tokens representing the rights to use studio space. An NFT can be used as an entry ticket for artists or curators wanting to participate in a studio and become a part of a formalized DAO as a collective.

## Shared ownership of a tokenized physical space

Shared ownership is a system that draws inspiration from the early eras of cooperative housing when it was not unusual for groups of people to acquire property together. The notion of shared ownership of a studio tokenizes artistic, physical space. A variety of ways to tokenize a studio exist, including by square footage or hourly rental. Tokenizing a space provides several benefits; most notably, it creates a community-driven structure where artists own and maintain the spaces that they make in. It also allows members to participate in the decision-making phase, which affects the use and maintenance.

Today, the term "shared ownership" is used to describe a variety of arrangements, ranging from cooperative living to behavior change initiatives.

Most studios operate on a centralized model where owners and artists exchange fees. Tokenization allows for a fairer, more transparent model of exchanging value. Transactions are performed directly between members regardless of their geographical location.

In centralized ownership models, there is always a designated owner of each space within a property - and this can be problematic if one person wants to leave or pass on their space/rent to someone new.

Some of these issues can be mitigated by using a decentralized platform with an open registry, allowing property owners or renters to set their own terms and conditions. Once a contract is in place, the payments work similarly to cryptocurrencies - which require a predetermined amount of digital tokens (NFTs) to be transacted.

By tokenizing creative spaces, participants can directly contribute to the future of a studio or project without having to pay high fees or commission rates.

Exclusive artistic communities could allow users to buy and sell NFTs through a vault belonging to the tokenized space representing a specific artist or their artwork. This provides a way for art lovers to directly invest in artists they admire by purchasing tokens related to them. The value of these tokens will increase over time, and the value of the space itself will rise against the value of the vault.

## Paying for services

Paying for services with tokens linked to a shared creative space opens up new ways of engaging with artists and curators and builds an interconnected micro-economy.

For example, if a participant were to pay X amount of studio tokens for an hour of studio time, they would be directly contributing to the operational costs of the studio. Once these tokens are used/acquired, they are sent directly to the vault, building a circular and self-sustaining economy within the space.

This means that artists, models, studio owners, or curators can set their own rules regarding how funds are distributed between participants; distribution could be modeled after and measured against personal participation in the space.

A studio DAO could decide to pay out fees in the form of an hourly rate to those who contribute most by measuring this against how many hours they have been active. In some cases, where participants pay for access to a workspace, the token distribution could result in rewards per hour-worked.

## Sharing resources for the collective good

Resource sharing is an economic model where people with resources (products or skills) offer them to others for free. This system occurs through online communities where creators can trade with each other by bartering their different products/abilities without paying. Online communities such as this exist for a range of additional items, from clothes to food.

There is a growing trend within the cryptocurrency community where people are exchanging their skills through platforms that offer bounties and enable a swap-meet culture in a virtual space. It's a decentralized approach that allows individuals to complete tasks and receive compensation through a decentralized ledger.

This has created a micro-economy where busy professionals can pay for help with tasks such as logo design or market research. In return, they offer their own time and services to others within the community.

Similarly, tokenizing an artist studio would allow those who have skills in photography, illustration, or digital marketing to contribute directly to a project that benefits from them.

This is a valuable way to create economic opportunities and connect like-minded people. The model also allows individuals to access an array of different skill sets and ideas from various parts of the world instead of working with those who are physically close by.

Technologies like the blockchain also allow artists and curators worldwide to participate in global projects linked to local space, giving it the potential to shape artistic movements from one location. 

The benefits of tokenizing shared creative spaces are a classic example of decentralization, which has always been rooted in the community ownership model.

It is important to note that the tokenization of physical space will only benefit artists and curators who are open to a more democratic system. Those who rely on centralized models for their livelihood may not adapt well to this model, as it cuts out the middlemen that previously enabled them to operate.

Inside artistic communities, crypto can increase output, cut expenses, and lay the groundwork for New Financial Technologies-based micro-economies. Artists and developers may use their creations as money to participate in studios, workshops or establish work exchanges. The idea of material studio tokenization converts creative physical space into a commodity shared by all.

title: Why is the Ethereum Gas fee so high?
body:
```
Imagine a bus stop with thousands of people waiting to board the next bus. A new bus arrives every 15 minutes or so, but each bus has only 50 seats. The seats on the bus are auctioned off to the highest bidder.If at least 50 people are willing to pay $1,000 to get on the bus, then the price of the ticket will be at least $1,000. If people are willing to pay 10 dollars at most, then the price will be 10 dollars or less. But if you only have $10 and there are hundreds of people willing to pay $1,000, you may have to wait a while before you can get on the bus.Unfortunately, waiting in line at the bus station does not necessarily give you an advantage. If someone keeps showing up willing to pay more than you, they will continue to be prioritized, even if you wait longer there.This is a slightly simplified version of the way the Ethereum Gas auction works. Ethereum blocks are mined approximately every 15 seconds. Each Ethereum block has a maximum size, which limits the amount of data that can be contained. The current maximum block size is set to 12.5M Gas, and the last increase was in July 2020. Since the maximum block size is in gas units, and different transactions have different gas usage according to their complexity, there is no consistent maximum value for the number of transactions that can be contained in a block. But on average, each block contains approximately 160-200 transactions.
```

比特币作为第一个区块链产品，也是2017年以前币圈人最常用的资产。那个时候大家投项目，做各种交换，比特币都是一般等价物，比特币的链上交易活跃。

自从以太坊出现，大约始于2017年，币圈的一般等价物开始从比特币慢慢过渡到以太坊。如今，比特币给自己的定位是价值储存，这个名头听起来很高大上，但也是不得已而为之。洗脑总要有个基本逻辑，既然大家不用它了，那么总要有个拿住的理由。

从这一点看，以太坊最为2021年最常用的资产，各个项目普遍接受的一般等价物，还有很大的发展

* 各种以太坊杀手
  * Peter Lynch曾经说过，在他的几十年投资生涯中，曾经遇到过各种xxx杀手，但是这些杀手都无一例外的失败了，虽然它们在某一时刻看起来很有潜力。
  * Lynch的这番话在我看来，基本可以复刻在2021年诸多的以太坊杀手身上。2017年曾经出现过一批以太坊杀手，比如eos，AE，tron，4年后还剩以太坊独尊。现今的2021年，以太坊杀手又换了一批cadidates。我把它们的白皮书都看了一遍，遗憾的是，目前还没有看到它们能够杀死以太坊的底层逻辑。
  * 再说细一点，很多人诟病以太坊gas fee太高，其实这正是以太坊价值体现的标志。为什么大家都往北上广挤？一样的道理。而且现在的以太坊有了2级链，2级链gas低，高并发，安全性由以太坊承担， 它们才是诸多公链的竞争对手。
  * 相对于以太坊，现在若干公链中，其实真正意义上的“公链并不多， 公链最重要的是它的去中心化，一个可以成为各家信任的智能合约撮合平台

    (1) BSC，币安的链，币安在需要的时候可以拔插头。真正重要的交易撮合不会放在上面。BSC能做大，还是币安从自己的交易所给它引流，来维持bnb的价格。典型例子如coinbase，coinbase靠股票来兑现价值，没有发行交易所代币，所以也没有自己建立公链的动力。

    (2) SOL，SBF的链，在我看来SOL从链的合约来看，比BSC要好一些，但是SBF在其中的比重太大，目前还不能称之为真 公链

    (3) FTM， 同理如上。如今的交易所，每个交易所都弄一个自己的链，美其名曰公链，其实还是自留地，目的大约是为了不让交易所的流量被公链分走。

    (4) DOT， dot目前看下来，都是中国的项目方在上面装老外开发割韭菜。。。其做大以后，也会是以太和二级链的那种模式，还看不出核心竞争力在哪里。again，必须要是范式转变，才可能成为下一代的公链。
* NFT

  NFT可以充当价值媒介，而且很有可能会有一波涨幅， 下面列出NFT的优点和缺点

  优点

  （1）中国禁了那么多币圈的东西，唯独没有禁止nft（极有可能是监管没跟上）。中国区的韭菜可以疯狂炒作/传销nft，用nft割韭菜。要知道传销和割韭菜，很多时候是拉盘的第一动力。

  （2）nft头像可以吸引圈外人。再加上twitter表示后面会加上支持头像nft的功能，这一波可以带入很多新鲜韭菜，炒作极有可能会是空前的。

  （3）nft可以作为社交媒介。比如说某大V发行了若干nft，韭菜拍卖之后，可以成为大V的高级会员，高级会员享受若干福利， 比如面基/优先拿到“内部”消息/和大V共进晚餐，等等。它实际上能成为大V将自己价值变现的工具，比那些挂羊头卖狗肉的社交代币好使得多。

  （4）强大的nft社区可以将nft变成公链？这也算是价值变现的一种方式

  缺点

  （1）图片类nft有流动性问题，资金会定点拉盘。那么，如果就是不拉盘你手上的nft怎么办？拉盘了价格跌下来的时候出不了货怎么办？

  （2）nft其实就是一张图片在线上mint出来，图片可以自己复制粘贴，线上mint也可以手动完成。这就挑战了头像类nft的炒作基础，你花了上百个以太，买了一个独一无二的头像，但是最后人人都可以自己定制一个，价值体现在哪里？这个类似于防盗版。。。

  总结，对于nft的炒作，知道会有一波，但是不错过的最好方式，还是（1)选择nft类的基础代币，比如公链代币eth，又或者nft存储类代币AR？，还有其它的candidate吗？（2）只mint热门nft，这个需要抢，很内卷。
* DEFI
  * Defi比nft的逻辑要清晰， defi的蓝筹已经炒作过一波，现在处于漫长的内卷，洗盘抛售，真价值发掘期，漫长到让人觉得它们已经死掉了。客观的说，一定会有一大批项目在这个过程中死掉，被洗出局。而剩下的则会迎来下一次的Defi大爆发。
  * Defi下一次的爆发，恐怕会是由圈外资产的加入而引发的

    \-Uni
    * uni是所有defi中最有潜力的，故事也最多的。它有很多条路可以选，目前我能看到的两条（1）成为币圈基础功能代币，uni本身变成一个公链，或者成为跨链交易所，连接以太坊和其他公链 （2）成为流动性提供商，吸引圈外资金的交易
    * 目前看起来，UNI的创始人正在走第二条路，uni正在接触一系列科技公司，和robinhood的合作传闻等等。其中robinhood的合作传闻从逻辑上看最为可行，RH作为第一大韭菜交易所，上市以后有每季度的业绩要求，需要更多的标的吸引韭菜交易，还有什么可以比uniswap提供更多高含韭量标的的地方吗？RH本身在测试钱包，这也是它要进军币圈交易所的明显信号。RH在股票上也是专心做客户端，流动性是从其他做市商那里买的，公司总是试图在新领域重复成功模式。 对RH来说，还有比uniswap更合适的做市商吗？SEC9月初问询了uniswap，从各方面的新闻看，这不是找uni代币的麻烦而更像是需要了解去中心化做市商的模式。为什么SEC需要知道这些信息，从美国政府部门的行为模式看，更像是有人提交了和uniswap有关的请求

    \- COMP
    * comp的逻辑很简单，comp在做一条自己的链，方便大钱在上面借贷，这个方向是正确的，新链会发行新的代币。 那么，拿着comp会不会有空投？

    \- DPI 
    * DPI作为defi的index，和eth的汇率跌得惨不忍睹。defi虽然是趋势，但是不见得所有的defi代币都能走到最后，这是持仓DPI最大的风险来源。

title: Top 5 mistakes people make when investing in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency (Text + video)
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0hKCiuiwxnqQE26JkK4Fg.png?height=720&width=1280)

Fear of losing money is one of the most prominent fears associated with cryptocurrencies. The biggest nightmare for an investor is witnessing a bear market and seeing their hard-earned money go before their eyes.

I know it’s hard to get rid of fear, but fear is an emotion, and if you can make investing an emotionless activity, you can get rid of your fear of losing money. But to get there you must first learn from mistakes, and that’s why this time, to save you some bad moments, we bring you 5 mistakes people usually make when investing in cryptocurrencies.

**5.Ignoring the security of the assets.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W5-h0Wp_MD8gI1Fi4TR02.jpg?height=800&width=1200)

We are not talking about the security of the project or the tokenomics of the coins but the way we store those coins. We know that this is something that sounds very simple, but to this day it is still one of the things that people take into account the least when opening a new wallet or buying on exchanges.

When buying cryptocurrencies, there are a few reasons why solid security is essential. Remember, if you “lose” your cryptocurrencies, it is unlikely that you will be able to get them back.

> This is because of how cryptocurrencies work, as they use blockchain technology to cut out the middlemen in financial transactions. The complexities are technical, but the technology essentially allows you to buy something without going through a bank or other financial organization.

Wallets use public and private keys to access cryptocurrencies, and losing those keys is a way to lose money. **You can’t just send an email and have them reset your password. If someone else gets your keys, they will have full access to your cryptocurrencies.**

**So always remember to keep your passwords safe,** either by writing them down on paper or storing them on digital media, but always in a way that only you know them and that no matter if one media is damaged, you have a spare.

Another thing to remember is to use legitimate exchanges and at the same time, no matter if an exchange is legitimate, **it is more advisable to store your cryptocurrencies in wallets external to the exchange, either digital or physical.**

(A list of recommended wallets can be found below).

**4.Invest money you can’t afford to lose.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3b_aZZghL8C6x_GQon3S7.png?height=768&width=437)

Another one that sounds simple, but that people tend to forget when investing in Cryptocurrencies. The cryptocurrency market is extremely volatile, with coin prices fluctuating hourly, driven by enthusiasm, news coverage and a variety of other variables. But, at the same time, those risks can bring you a lot of profit. This does not mean that there is no possibility of losing all your money, or being less drastic, imagine, today you invest an amount in a cryptocurrency of your liking and that promises millionaire profits, but the following week the value of that coin falls 50% or more, obviously your investment would become half of what you invested or less, if for some reason you need your money, you should change your coins with losses not only monetary but also of time.

You must understand that **cryptocurrencies, like any other type of investment, is ultimately a gamble.** Only invest money that you can easily get rid of. Never take out a mortgage or use your retirement account savings to invest in cryptocurrencies; you could lose everything.

**3.Not understanding or studying the investment.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NAl23o8hQCdqaj5ksr3Ue.png?height=457&width=1200)

How many times have you bought an electronic device without informing yourself about its performance and quality before buying it?

How many times have you bought something just because a friend or people on the Internet recommended it?

We usually have this kind of attitude towards many things when we spend money, and unfortunately, some people also tend to have this kind of attitude towards investments.

Generally, **there are two types of people** in the crypto world, **those who know that a project will be successful because they studied beforehand**, and **those who find out about the project until they already exploited it** and had several opportunities for profit.

The easiest and best way to invest in cryptocurrencies is to first learn about the product and its tokenomics, what it is and how it works. **Don’t just listen to what others have to say on social media platforms.** Yes of course, if you follow the trends, there is a chance to make good money, but there is also a big chance to lose it.

If you are new to cryptocurrencies, **spend some time learning about how to buy and sell them, as well as studying the market**. A little research will help you avoid scams, formulate an investment strategy and make your own decisions about when to buy and sell.

**2.Selling out of fear.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/F3e4u06l6RdIPKciWE2_m.png?height=536&width=1024)

Cryptocurrencies are criticized around the world for their volatility, which often scares newcomers away from cryptocurrency markets. People are more scared by big red spikes on the charts than similar positive percentage changes, and this is where the negative bias comes into play.

Usually when your cryptocurrencies start to fall, your brain is screaming at you to sell out of fear. But understanding risk tolerance is always the first step for investors and traders before investing. People have different levels of risk tolerance, which influences their investment choices.

Fear comes from evolution and helps protect us from danger. But **fear is mental and emotional**, and while this works very well in life-and-death situations, it generally has the opposite effect when it comes to investing. The brain is unable to distinguish between a life-threatening situation, such as a wild animal attack, and the loss of your investments. You simply feel in danger.

Remember, **you should never invest anything you can’t afford to lose.** Take the amount of money you are willing to lose as if you were going to gamble. Because, like investing, gambling is up and down, and sooner or later you will lose, but you can control when you get in and when you get out.

If you are already up, **don’t be greedy and take profits** when you have them, don’t stay with the idea of “I’m going to go higher”, because the thing can be upside down.

And when you are down, **don’t sell out of desperation,** why sell at a loss if you can wait for your currency to go up again?

**Don’t let your emotions get the better of you.**

**1.Only investing in Bitcoin.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HPzJ7PPp4Ip_q92DgTWue.jpg?height=720&width=1280)

When Bitcoin was first introduced in 2009, it faced little (if any) competition in the emerging world of digital currency. But starting in 2011, competition began to emerge more and more, improving existing technologies or creating new and better ones. And since then the boom in the creation of new digital currencies began.

body:
使用频率VS资产潜力

比特币作为第一个区块链产品，也是2017年以前币圈人最常用的资产。那个时候大家投项目，做各种交换，比特币都是一般等价物，比特币的链上交易活跃。

自从以太坊出现，大约始于2017年，币圈的一般等价物开始从比特币慢慢过渡到以太坊。如今，比特币给自己的定位是价值储存，这个名头听起来很高大上，但也是不得已而为之。洗脑总要有个基本逻辑，既然大家不用它了，那么总要有个拿住的理由。

从这一点看，以太坊最为2021年最常用的资产，各个项目普遍接受的一般等价物，还有很大的发展

* 各种以太坊杀手
  * Peter Lynch曾经说过，在他的几十年投资生涯中，曾经遇到过各种xxx杀手，但是这些杀手都无一例外的失败了，虽然它们在某一时刻看起来很有潜力。
  * Lynch的这番话在我看来，基本可以复刻在2021年诸多的以太坊杀手身上。2017年曾经出现过一批以太坊杀手，比如eos，AE，tron，4年后还剩以太坊独尊。现今的2021年，以太坊杀手又换了一批cadidates。我把它们的白皮书都看了一遍，遗憾的是，目前还没有看到它们能够杀死以太坊的底层逻辑。
  * 再说细一点，很多人诟病以太坊gas fee太高，其实这正是以太坊价值体现的标志。为什么大家都往北上广挤？一样的道理。而且现在的以太坊有了2级链，2级链gas低，高并发，安全性由以太坊承担， 它们才是诸多公链的竞争对手。
  * 相对于以太坊，现在若干公链中，其实真正意义上的“公链并不多， 公链最重要的是它的去中心化，一个可以成为各家信任的智能合约撮合平台

    (1) BSC，币安的链，币安在需要的时候可以拔插头。真正重要的交易撮合不会放在上面。BSC能做大，还是币安从自己的交易所给它引流，来维持bnb的价格。典型例子如coinbase，coinbase靠股票来兑现价值，没有发行交易所代币，所以也没有自己建立公链的动力。

    (2) SOL，SBF的链，在我看来SOL从链的合约来看，比BSC要好一些，但是SBF在其中的比重太大，目前还不能称之为真 公链

    (3) FTM， 同理如上。如今的交易所，每个交易所都弄一个自己的链，美其名曰公链，其实还是自留地，目的大约是为了不让交易所的流量被公链分走。

    (4) DOT， dot目前看下来，都是中国的项目方在上面装老外开发割韭菜。。。其做大以后，也会是以太和二级链的那种模式，还看不出核心竞争力在哪里。again，必须要是范式转变，才可能成为下一代的公链。
* NFT

  NFT可以充当价值媒介，而且很有可能会有一波涨幅， 下面列出NFT的优点和缺点

  优点

  （1）中国禁了那么多币圈的东西，唯独没有禁止nft（极有可能是监管没跟上）。中国区的韭菜可以疯狂炒作/传销nft，用nft割韭菜。要知道传销和割韭菜，很多时候是拉盘的第一动力。

  （2）nft头像可以吸引圈外人。再加上twitter表示后面会加上支持头像nft的功能，这一波可以带入很多新鲜韭菜，炒作极有可能会是空前的。

  （3）nft可以作为社交媒介。比如说某大V发行了若干nft，韭菜拍卖之后，可以成为大V的高级会员，高级会员享受若干福利， 比如面基/优先拿到“内部”消息/和大V共进晚餐，等等。它实际上能成为大V将自己价值变现的工具，比那些挂羊头卖狗肉的社交代币好使得多。

  （4）强大的nft社区可以将nft变成公链？这也算是价值变现的一种方式

  缺点

  （1）图片类nft有流动性问题，资金会定点拉盘。那么，如果就是不拉盘你手上的nft怎么办？拉盘了价格跌下来的时候出不了货怎么办？

  （2）nft其实就是一张图片在线上mint出来，图片可以自己复制粘贴，线上mint也可以手动完成。这就挑战了头像类nft的炒作基础，你花了上百个以太，买了一个独一无二的头像，但是最后人人都可以自己定制一个，价值体现在哪里？这个类似于防盗版。。。

  总结，对于nft的炒作，知道会有一波，但是不错过的最好方式，还是（1)选择nft类的基础代币，比如公链代币eth，又或者nft存储类代币AR？，还有其它的candidate吗？（2）只mint热门nft，这个需要抢，很内卷。
* DEFI
  * Defi比nft的逻辑要清晰， defi的蓝筹已经炒作过一波，现在处于漫长的内卷，洗盘抛售，真价值发掘期，漫长到让人觉得它们已经死掉了。客观的说，一定会有一大批项目在这个过程中死掉，被洗出局。而剩下的则会迎来下一次的Defi大爆发。
  * Defi下一次的爆发，恐怕会是由圈外资产的加入而引发的

    \-Uni
    * uni是所有defi中最有潜力的，故事也最多的。它有很多条路可以选，目前我能看到的两条（1）成为币圈基础功能代币，uni本身变成一个公链，或者成为跨链交易所，连接以太坊和其他公链 （2）成为流动性提供商，吸引圈外资金的交易
    * 目前看起来，UNI的创始人正在走第二条路，uni正在接触一系列科技公司，和robinhood的合作传闻等等。其中robinhood的合作传闻从逻辑上看最为可行，RH作为第一大韭菜交易所，上市以后有每季度的业绩要求，需要更多的标的吸引韭菜交易，还有什么可以比uniswap提供更多高含韭量标的的地方吗？RH本身在测试钱包，这也是它要进军币圈交易所的明显信号。RH在股票上也是专心做客户端，流动性是从其他做市商那里买的，公司总是试图在新领域重复成功模式。 对RH来说，还有比uniswap更合适的做市商吗？SEC9月初问询了uniswap，从各方面的新闻看，这不是找uni代币的麻烦而更像是需要了解去中心化做市商的模式。为什么SEC需要知道这些信息，从美国政府部门的行为模式看，更像是有人提交了和uniswap有关的请求

    \- COMP
    * comp的逻辑很简单，comp在做一条自己的链，方便大钱在上面借贷，这个方向是正确的，新链会发行新的代币。 那么，拿着comp会不会有空投？

    \- DPI
    * DPI作为defi的index，和eth的汇率跌得惨不忍睹。defi虽然是趋势，但是不见得所有的defi代币都能走到最后，这是持仓DPI最大的风险来源。

                                                                                                   - By 昆麟玉

title: Top 5 mistakes people make when investing in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency (Text + video)
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0hKCiuiwxnqQE26JkK4Fg.png?height=720&width=1280)

Fear of losing money is one of the most prominent fears associated with cryptocurrencies. The biggest nightmare for an investor is witnessing a bear market and seeing their hard-earned money go before their eyes.

I know it’s hard to get rid of fear, but fear is an emotion, and if you can make investing an emotionless activity, you can get rid of your fear of losing money. But to get there you must first learn from mistakes, and that’s why this time, to save you some bad moments, we bring you 5 mistakes people usually make when investing in cryptocurrencies.

**5.Ignoring the security of the assets.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W5-h0Wp_MD8gI1Fi4TR02.jpg?height=800&width=1200)

We are not talking about the security of the project or the tokenomics of the coins but the way we store those coins. We know that this is something that sounds very simple, but to this day it is still one of the things that people take into account the least when opening a new wallet or buying on exchanges.

When buying cryptocurrencies, there are a few reasons why solid security is essential. Remember, if you “lose” your cryptocurrencies, it is unlikely that you will be able to get them back.

> This is because of how cryptocurrencies work, as they use blockchain technology to cut out the middlemen in financial transactions. The complexities are technical, but the technology essentially allows you to buy something without going through a bank or other financial organization.

Wallets use public and private keys to access cryptocurrencies, and losing those keys is a way to lose money. **You can’t just send an email and have them reset your password. If someone else gets your keys, they will have full access to your cryptocurrencies.**

**So always remember to keep your passwords safe,** either by writing them down on paper or storing them on digital media, but always in a way that only you know them and that no matter if one media is damaged, you have a spare.

Another thing to remember is to use legitimate exchanges and at the same time, no matter if an exchange is legitimate, **it is more advisable to store your cryptocurrencies in wallets external to the exchange, either digital or physical.**

(A list of recommended wallets can be found below).

**4.Invest money you can’t afford to lose.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3b_aZZghL8C6x_GQon3S7.png?height=768&width=437)

Another one that sounds simple, but that people tend to forget when investing in Cryptocurrencies. The cryptocurrency market is extremely volatile, with coin prices fluctuating hourly, driven by enthusiasm, news coverage and a variety of other variables. But, at the same time, those risks can bring you a lot of profit. This does not mean that there is no possibility of losing all your money, or being less drastic, imagine, today you invest an amount in a cryptocurrency of your liking and that promises millionaire profits, but the following week the value of that coin falls 50% or more, obviously your investment would become half of what you invested or less, if for some reason you need your money, you should change your coins with losses not only monetary but also of time.

You must understand that **cryptocurrencies, like any other type of investment, is ultimately a gamble.** Only invest money that you can easily get rid of. Never take out a mortgage or use your retirement account savings to invest in cryptocurrencies; you could lose everything.

**3.Not understanding or studying the investment.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NAl23o8hQCdqaj5ksr3Ue.png?height=457&width=1200)

How many times have you bought an electronic device without informing yourself about its performance and quality before buying it?

How many times have you bought something just because a friend or people on the Internet recommended it?

We usually have this kind of attitude towards many things when we spend money, and unfortunately, some people also tend to have this kind of attitude towards investments.

Generally, **there are two types of people** in the crypto world, **those who know that a project will be successful because they studied beforehand**, and **those who find out about the project until they already exploited it** and had several opportunities for profit.

The easiest and best way to invest in cryptocurrencies is to first learn about the product and its tokenomics, what it is and how it works. **Don’t just listen to what others have to say on social media platforms.** Yes of course, if you follow the trends, there is a chance to make good money, but there is also a big chance to lose it.

If you are new to cryptocurrencies, **spend some time learning about how to buy and sell them, as well as studying the market**. A little research will help you avoid scams, formulate an investment strategy and make your own decisions about when to buy and sell.

**2.Selling out of fear.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/F3e4u06l6RdIPKciWE2_m.png?height=536&width=1024)

Cryptocurrencies are criticized around the world for their volatility, which often scares newcomers away from cryptocurrency markets. People are more scared by big red spikes on the charts than similar positive percentage changes, and this is where the negative bias comes into play.

Usually when your cryptocurrencies start to fall, your brain is screaming at you to sell out of fear. But understanding risk tolerance is always the first step for investors and traders before investing. People have different levels of risk tolerance, which influences their investment choices.

Fear comes from evolution and helps protect us from danger. But **fear is mental and emotional**, and while this works very well in life-and-death situations, it generally has the opposite effect when it comes to investing. The brain is unable to distinguish between a life-threatening situation, such as a wild animal attack, and the loss of your investments. You simply feel in danger.

Remember, **you should never invest anything you can’t afford to lose.** Take the amount of money you are willing to lose as if you were going to gamble. Because, like investing, gambling is up and down, and sooner or later you will lose, but you can control when you get in and when you get out.

If you are already up, **don’t be greedy and take profits** when you have them, don’t stay with the idea of “I’m going to go higher”, because the thing can be upside down.

And when you are down, **don’t sell out of desperation,** why sell at a loss if you can wait for your currency to go up again?

**Don’t let your emotions get the better of you.**

**1.Only investing in Bitcoin.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HPzJ7PPp4Ip_q92DgTWue.jpg?height=720&width=1280)

When Bitcoin was first introduced in 2009, it faced little (if any) competition in the emerging world of digital currency. But starting in 2011, competition began to emerge more and more, improving existing technologies or creating new and better ones. And since then the boom in the creation of new digital currencies began.

But despite the years that have passed and the evolution of the cryptocurrency market, I can assure you one thing, if right now you go and ask a random person about cryptocurrencies, that person will probably only know Bitcoin and nothing else.

Not only because Bitcoin is the real OG and is on top of all currencies, but because **when the news talks about crypto, usually Bitcoin is the most mentioned.**

**But there are all kinds of cryptocurrencies**, generally divided into two categories:

* **Coins**, which can include Bitcoin and altcoins (cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin).

Generally, **any blockchain-based cryptocurrency other than bitcoin is referred to as an altcoin.**

Although most altcoins are based on the same basic architecture as bitcoin and share some of its qualities, each has its own set of benefits for investors. Some altcoins use a different method to generate and validate blocks of transactions. Some may provide additional functionality, such as smart contracts, or benefits, such as reducing price volatility.

Tokens can be used to represent units of value, such as electricity, money, points, coins, digital assets and more. They can also be sent and received.

Now that you know this information, hopefully you will begin to see that in this world **a portfolio with diverse investments can help protect you from market volatility.**

There are many coins to choose from if you want to diversify your cryptocurrency portfolio. **Look for coins that have been around for a long time and have a good reputation.** **Each coin comes with a white paper** that explains the coin’s performance and who is involved. **Read it carefully because scammers, bad youtubers and influencers use fake coins to defraud investors.**

And we have come to the end.

We hope this information has been useful to you and that you can use it when investing in bitcoins, cryptocurrencies or other types of investments. Study your investments, understand them and be cautious when making your moves, wealth is waiting for you if you know how to get there.

title: Top 5 Errores que se cometen al invertir en bitcoin y criptomonedas. (Texto + Video)
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSgcVKNnls5cw68yUQHP-.png?height=720&width=1280)

El miedo a perder dinero es uno de los miedos más destacados asociados con las criptomonedas. La mayor pesadilla para un inversor es presenciar un mercado bajista y ver que el dinero que tanto le ha costado ganar se va ante sus ojos.

Sé que es difícil deshacerse del miedo, pero el miedo es una emoción, y si puedes hacer de la inversión una actividad sin emociones, puedes deshacerte de tu miedo a perder dinero. Pero para llegar a esto primero debes aprender de los errores, y por eso en esta ocasión, para ahorrarte algunos malos momentos, te traemos 5 errores que la gente suele cometer al invertir en criptomonedas.

**5.Ignorar la seguridad de los activos.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0a3c4pYrPG03rjDNTvOnS.jpg?height=800&width=1200)

No estamos hablando de la seguridad del proyecto o de los tokenomics de las monedas sino de la forma en que almacenamos esas monedas. Sabemos que es algo que suena muy sencillo, pero a día de hoy sigue siendo una de las cosas que la gente menos tiene en cuenta a la hora de abrir una nueva cartera o al comprar en intercambios.

Al comprar criptomonedas, existen algunas razones por las que una seguridad sólida es esencial. Recuerda que, si “pierdes” tus criptomonedas, es poco probable que puedas recuperarlas.

> Esto se debe a cómo funcionan las criptomonedas, ya que usan la tecnología blockchain para eliminar a los intermediarios en las transacciones financieras. Las complejidades son técnicas, pero la tecnología esencialmente te permite comprar algo sin pasar por un banco u otra organización financiera.

Las carteras utilizan claves públicas y privadas para acceder a las criptomonedas, y perder esas claves es una forma de perder dinero. **No puedes simplemente enviar un correo electrónico y hacer que restablezcan tu contraseña. Si otra persona obtiene tus claves, tendrá acceso completo a tus criptomonedas.**

A sí que **recuerda siempre guardar tus claves de acceso de forma segura**, ya sea anotándolas en papel o guardándolas en medios digitales, pero siempre de forma que solo tú las conozcas y que no importa si un medio está dañado, tienes uno de repuesto.

Otra cosa que debes recordar es usar intercambios legítimos y al mismo tiempo, no importa si un intercambio es legítimo, **es más recomendable guardar tus criptomonedas en billeteras externas al intercambio, ya sea digital o físico.**

(En la parte inferior puede encontrar una lista de carteras recomendadas)

**4.Invertir dinero que no pueden permitirse perder.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4sORKhvFfaSStMw3vz6hl.png?height=768&width=437)

Otro que suena simple, pero que la gente tiende a olvidar cuando invierte en Criptomonedas. El mercado de las criptomonedas es extremadamente volátil, con los precios de las monedas fluctuando cada hora, impulsados por el entusiasmo, la cobertura de noticias y una variedad de otras variables. Pero, a su vez, esos riesgos pueden traerte muchas ganancias. Esto no quiere decir que no exista posibilidad de que pierdas todo tu dinero, o siendo menos drásticos, imagina, hoy inviertes una cantidad en una criptomoneda de tu agrado y que promete ganancias millonarias, pero a la semana siguiente el valor de esa moneda cae 50 % o más, obviamente tu inversión se convertiría en la mitad de lo invertido o menos, si por alguna razón necesitas tu dinero, deberías cambiar tus monedas con pérdidas no solo monetarias sino también de tiempo.

Debes comprender que **las criptomonedas, como cualquier otro tipo de inversión, es en última instancia una apuesta.** Solo invierte dinero del que puedas deshacerte fácilmente. Nunca saques una hipoteca ni utilices los ahorros de tu cuenta de jubilación para invertir en criptomonedas; podrías perderlo todo.

**3.No comprender ni estudiar la inversión.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NSBkdeI_9euxto-aHbjVu.png?height=457&width=1200)

¿Cuántas veces has comprado un dispositivo electrónico sin informarte sobre su funcionamiento y calidad antes de comprarlo?

¿Cuántas veces has comprado algo solo porque un amigo o gente de Internet te lo recomendó?

Por lo general, tenemos este tipo de actitud hacia muchas cosas cuando gastamos dinero, y desafortunadamente, algunas personas también tienden a tener este tipo de actitud con respecto a las inversiones.

Suelen haber **dos tipos de personas** en el mundo de las criptos, **las que saben que un proyecto tendrá éxito porque estudiaron de antemano**, y **las que se enteran del proyecto hasta que ya lo explotaron** y tuvieron varias oportunidades de lucro.

La forma más fácil y mejor de invertir en criptomonedas es aprender primero sobre el producto y sus tokenomics, qué es y cómo funciona. **No te limites a escuchar lo que otros tienen que decir en las plataformas de redes sociales.** Sí por supuesto, si sigues las tendencias, existe la posibilidad de ganar un buen dinero, pero también existe la gran posibilidad de perderlo.

Si eres nuevo en las criptomonedas, **dedica algo de tiempo en aprender sobre cómo comprarlas y venderlas, así como a estudiar el mercado.** Un poco de investigación te ayudará a evitar estafas, formular una estrategia de inversión y tomar tus propias decisiones sobre cuándo comprar y vender.

**2.Vender por miedo.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1zh62T7cBSzrX8DXlFQ_7.png?height=536&width=1024)

Las criptomonedas son criticadas en todo el mundo por su volatilidad, que a menudo ahuyenta a los recién llegados de los mercados de criptomonedas. La gente está más asustada por los grandes picos rojos en los gráficos que por cambios porcentuales positivos similares, y aquí es donde entra en juego el sesgo negativo.

Por lo general, cuando tus criptomonedas comienzan a caer, tu cerebro te grita que vendas por miedo. Pero comprender la tolerancia al riesgo es siempre el primer paso para los inversores y comerciantes antes de invertir. Las personas tienen diferentes niveles de tolerancia al riesgo, lo que influye en sus elecciones de inversión.

El miedo proviene de la evolución y nos ayuda a protegernos del peligro. Pero **el miedo es mental y emocional,** y si bien esto funciona muy bien en situaciones de vida o muerte, generalmente tiene el efecto contrario cuando se trata de invertir. El cerebro es incapaz de distinguir entre una situación que pone en peligro la vida, como el ataque de un animal salvaje, y la pérdida de tus inversiones. Simplemente te sientes en peligro.

Recuerda, **nunca debes invertir nada que no puedas permitirte perder.** Toma la cantidad de dinero que estás dispuesto a perder como si fueras a apostar. Porque, al igual que las inversiones, en las apuestas se sube y baja, y tarde o temprano perderás, pero puedes controlar cuándo entras y cuándo te retiras.

Si ya estás arriba, **no seas codicioso y toma ganancias** cuando las tengas, no te quedes con la idea de “voy a subir más”, porque la cosa puede estar patas arriba.

Y cuando estés abajo, **no vendas por desesperación,** ¿por qué vender con pérdidas si puedes esperar a que tu moneda suba de nuevo?

**No dejes que tus emociones se apoderen de ti.**

**1.Solo invertir en Bitcoin.** 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/p1mP3KKPaEyFc8fFWwf4q.jpg?height=720&width=1280)

Cuando Bitcoin se introdujo por primera vez en 2009, se enfrentó a poca (si es que había alguna) competencia en el mundo emergente de la moneda digital. Pero a partir de 2011, la competencia comenzó a surgir cada vez más, mejorando las tecnologías existentes o creando nuevas y mejores. Y desde entonces comenzó el boom de la creación de nuevas monedas digitales.

Pero a pesar de los años que han pasado y la evolución del mercado de las criptomonedas, te puedo asegurar una cosa, si en este momento vas y le preguntas sobre criptomonedas a una persona al azar, esa persona probablemente solo conocerá Bitcoin y nada más.

No solo porque Bitcoin es el verdadero OG y está en la parte superior de todas las monedas, sino porque **cuando las noticias hablan de cripto, generalmente Bitcoin es el más mencionado.**

**Pero existen todo tipo de criptomonedas**, generalmente divididas en dos categorías:

* **Monedas**, que pueden incluir Bitcoin y altcoins (criptomonedas distintas de Bitcoin) 
* **Tokens**, que son activos programables que viven dentro de la cadena de bloques de una plataforma determinada.

   A pesar del hecho de que muchas personas usan los términos criptografía, monedas y tokens indistintamente, es crucial saber en qué se diferencian.

**Las monedas se construyen en su propia cadena de bloques y están pensadas como una forma de divisa.** Ether (ETH) es la criptomoneda basada en la cadena de bloques Ethereum, por ejemplo.

Generalmente, **cualquier criptomoneda basada en blockchain que no sea bitcoin se denomina altcoin.**

A pesar de que la mayoría de las altcoins se basan en la misma arquitectura básica que Bitcoin y comparten algunas de sus cualidades, cada una tiene su propio conjunto de beneficios para los inversores. Algunas altcoins utilizan un método diferente para generar y validar bloques de transacciones. Algunas pueden proporcionar funcionalidades adicionales, como contratos inteligentes, o beneficios, como reducir la volatilidad de los precios.

**Los tokens se basan en una cadena de bloques existente, pero son activos programables que permiten la creación y ejecución de contratos inteligentes únicos.** Fuera de la red blockchain, estos contratos se pueden utilizar para establecer la propiedad de los activos. Los tokens se pueden usar para representar unidades de valor, como electricidad, dinero, puntos, monedas, activos digitales y más. También se pueden enviar y recibir.

Ahora que conoces esta información, esperamos que comiences a ver que en este mundo **una cartera con inversiones diversas puede ayudar a protegerte de la volatilidad del mercado.**

Hay muchas monedas para elegir si deseas diversificar tu cartera de criptomonedas. **Busca monedas que hayan existido durante mucho tiempo y que tengan una buena reputación. Cada moneda viene con un papel blanco** que explica el rendimiento de la moneda y quiénes están involucrados. **Léelo con atención porque los estafadores, los malos youtubers y los influencers usan monedas falsas para defraudar a los inversores.**

* 

Y hemos llegado al final.

Esperamos que esta información te haya sido útil y que puedas utilizarla a la hora de invertir en bitcoins, criptomonedas u otro tipo de inversiones. Estudia tus inversiones, entiéndelas y se precavido al hacer tus movimientos, la riqueza te espera si sabes cómo llegar.

> Te deseamos todo lo bueno del mundo, hasta la próxima.
