title: Mirror ブロックチェーンブログプラットフォーム【初心者】
body:
お疲れ様です、[ソマウタ](twitter.com/somauta79)です。

今回は、@ManabuさんがVoicyで話しに触れていた「Mirror」について調べました。

この話が気になる方は、こちらからどうぞ。

[https://voicy.jp/channel/1623/219047](https://voicy.jp/channel/1623/219047)

こちらもツイートされてました。

[https://twitter.com/manabubannai/status/1445950718771228673?s=20](https://twitter.com/manabubannai/status/1445950718771228673?s=20)

あっ、ちなみにですが、本編は、ダッシュボードのガイドをなるべく分かりやすく（らーめん屋のおっちゃんでも分かるように）解説していますので、翻訳するのが面倒だったり、ざっくりと何となく理解したい方は、読み進めてください。

## ✔目次

* Mirror とは
* Mirror の始め方
* Mirror の使い方
* Mirror のNFTコンテンツ化
* 未来予想

### ■ 1. Mirror とは

* イーサリアムベースの分散方ブログプラットフォーム
* イーサリアムウォレット所持者が投稿できるブログ
* 記事をNFTにできる
* クラウドファンディング、オークションなどができる

仮想通貨投資をしている人なら簡単に使えるブログで、WordPressがブロックチェーン上にあるみたいなものです。後半2つは、ナゾですよね、、それでは、説明にはいります。

### ■ 2. Mirror の始め方

まずは、公式のページにいきます。

[https://mirror.xyz/](https://mirror.xyz/)

画面の右上の \[Connect Wallet\] をクリックします。

自分のウォレットと同期させます。（自分はメタマスクで同期しました）

そして、アカウントを設定しましょう！

こちらは、名前、プロフィール画像設定します。

以上です！！（簡単）

### ■ 3. Mirror の使い方

ではでは、ブログの書き方になります。

ダッシュボードの、\[Entries\] をクリックします。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GHFdrL3lkjRkiueak6Xzl.png?height=619&width=1366)

これで、ブログを書くページになります。

でか目のタイトルが書けるスペースがあり、あとは、すらすらと本文を書くだけです。

冒頭に、ツイッターやVoicyのリンクが貼ってありますが、リンクをコピペするだけで、ブログっぽくイイ感じになりました。

続いて、ページの下には、 \[**Blocks** ⌘+/\] という機能があります。

クリックすると、こんな画面が出てきます。

![Creating blocks](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dnRW2fnfrRrPE9ZIB3l5.png?height=318&width=370)

上から順番に解説していきますね。

* \[Heading 2\] ・・・ 中サイズの見出しです。文中のこれです。

## (例) ✔目次

* \[Heading 3\] ・・・ 小サイズの見出しです。文中のこれです。

### (例) ■ 3. Mirror の使い方

* \[Image\] ・・・ 画像の挿入です。ファイルを選択するか、画像をドラック＆ペーストするか、リンクをペーストするだけです。（超絶かんたん）
* \[Bulleted List\] ・・・ 小見出しの前にある灰色のポッチです。 \[・\] こんなやつです。
* \[Blockquote\] ・・・ 左側にある青色の線です。引用とかに使えそうですね。

> ### Creating blocks
>
> To easily create a media or economic block, first click inside your entry to place the curser where you’d like the block to appear. Next, click the **Blocks** area of the Toolbar, or focus with the keyboard shortcut `⌘+/`. The blocks menu will appear, showing you all available blocks. Selecting a block prompts you for secondary information. Once you’re satisfied, confirm the information to insert the block into your entry.

* \[</> Code\] ・・・ 初心者はなくても良きです。要勉強ですね。
* \[Crowdfund\] ・・・ 資産を集めるクラウドファンディングです。リンクが貼れるようになります。この辺りはやりたいですよね。まだまだ先ですが、、、以下、引用と翻訳です。

> On Mirror, anyone can raise funds for an idea or project using the Crowdfund block. Under the hood, a Crowdfund is a smart contract on Ethereum. Backers deposit ETH to fund your idea in exchange for a token. The token represents a proof of patronage and a stake in the potential success of your project. Crowdfunds can be embedded into any entry on Mirror, alongside text and other media blocks that tell your project's story.
>
> ミラーでは、誰でもクラウドファンディングブロックを使用してアイデアやプロジェクトの資金を調達できます。内部的には、クラウドファンディングはイーサリアムのスマートコントラクトです。支援者は、トークンと引き換えにあなたのアイデアに資金を提供するためにETHをデポジットします。トークンは、プロジェクトの潜在的な成功へのご愛顧と利害関係の証拠を表しています。Crowdfundsは、プロジェクトのストーリーを伝えるテキストやその他のメディアブロックとともに、Mirrorの任意のエントリーに埋め込むことができます。

* \[Edition\] ・・・ NFTを固定の金額で個数を指定して販売出来るようです。日本でいう、elu(エル)のNFT版ですかね？！今後は、調べて活用したいですね。以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Editions are a way for creators to mint a limited supply of identical NFTs at a fixed price. If a 1/1 NFT is a Picasso at Sotheby's, Editions are like the thousands of first-edition holographic Charizards released.
>
> エディションは、クリエイターが固定価格で同一のNFTの限られた供給をミントするための方法です。1/1 NFTがサザビーズのピカソである場合、エディションは、リリースされた何千もの初版ホログラフィックリザードンのようなものです。

* \[Auction\] ・・・ NFTオークションです。独自のオークションを開催出来るので、多くの人に認知されれば期待大ですね。コツコツ頑張りましょう。

> Mirror supports auctioning off NFTs using reserve auctions. Reserve auctions are configured with two main parameters: the reserve price and the auction duration. Like other economic blocks on Mirror, your auction is deployed as a smart contract and can be embedded inside any Mirror entry.
>
> ミラーは、リザーブオークションを使用したNFTのオークションをサポートしています。リザーブオークションは、リザーブ価格とオークション期間という2つの主要なパラメータで構成されます。ミラーの他の経済ブロックと同様に、オークションはスマートコントラクトとして展開され、ミラーエントリ内に埋め込むことができます。

* \[Split\] ・・・ こちらは共同でプロジェクトを立ち上げたりした場合に、資産を分配出来るみたいです。以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Splits on Mirror are a way to automatically share the value you produce with multiple entities. A split is a payable smart contract that routes value to multiple addresses on Ethereum.
>
> Splits can be used as a way to reward your collaborators, the people that have inspired you, or to donate proceeds from your work.
>
> Create a split by going to the Splits tab in your dashboard. A split needs to be made between at least two addresses and the percentages must add up to 100%.
>
> ミラーでの分割は、生成した値を複数のエンティティと自動的に共有する方法です。分割は、イーサリアムの複数のアドレスに値をルーティングする支払い可能なスマートコントラクトです。
>
> スプリットは、あなたの協力者、あなたにインスピレーションを与えた人々に報酬を与える方法、またはあなたの仕事からの収益を寄付する方法として使用できます。
>
> ダッシュボードの\[分割\]タブに移動して、分割を作成します。少なくとも2つのアドレス間で分割を行う必要があり、パーセンテージの合計は100％になる必要があります。

* \[NFT Preview\] ・・・ こちらはMirrorの醍醐味と言ってもイイのではないでしょうか。ブログコンテンツをNFT化出来るサービスですね。最後にNFTについて話していきます。

以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Entries on Mirror can be minted as NFTs. In order to mint your entry as an NFT, check off the NFT checkbox in the top right corner of the entry editor. Upload a cover image for your entry so it can be rendered across different NFT platforms. Once your NFT is minted on-chain, you'll see confirmation in the byline of your entry.
>
> You can retroactively mint a previous entry by editing it, checking the NFT checkbox, and saving the entry. To see which of your entries have been minted as NFTs under the Entries tab in the dashboard.
>
> ミラー上のエントリは、NFTとして作成できます。エントリをNFTとして作成するには、エントリエディタの右上隅にある\[NFT\]チェックボックスをオフにします。エントリのカバー画像をアップロードして、さまざまなNFTプラットフォームでレンダリングできるようにします。NFTがチェーン上で作成されると、エントリの署名記事に確認が表示されます。以前のエントリを編集し、\[NFT\]チェックボックスをオンにして、エントリを保存することで、過去にさかのぼって作成できます。ダッシュボードの\[エントリ\]タブで、どのエントリがNFTとして作成されているかを確認します。

### ■ 4. Mirror のNFTコンテンツ化

Mirrorの醍醐味、ブログコンテンツをNFT化するについてです。

これは何かというと、イーサリアム上にブログを作成し、iFrame、動画、NFT、ツイート、クラウドファンド、オークションなどのソーシャルメディアの投稿に至るまで、メディアブロックをブログに埋め込むことができます。

SubstackやMediumなどの他のプラットフォームからブログをインポートすることもできます。

最も重要なことは、ブロガーがブログを「エントリーエディション」として作成できることであり、これは、コンテンツのNFT化であり、それらを収益化することができます。

すばらしい！！パチ、パチ、パチ、パチ（拍手）

* Mirrorは業界のリーダーやDAOによって使用されてきました。

イーサリアムの共同創設者のVitalikButerinのような業界リーダーや、Aave Grants DAOのようないくつかの分散型自律組織（DAO）は、Mirrorを使用してコンテンツを公開してきました。

2021年のイーサリアムの開発に関するドキュメンタリーは、Mirrorのクラウドファンディング使用してを通じて1,036ETH（約4000万）を調達しました。

### ■ 5. 未来予想

ワクワクするようなプロジェクトですよね。

ユーザーが書いたブログ記事は、NFTに紐づけることでその記事を世の中に唯一無二のものとして公開することができるようになりました。

Mirrorで書かれた記事に価値を見出す人が存在すれば、その記事に価値が付き、所有権をNFTで売買できるようになります。

所詮、テキストなので、コピペすれば元も子もないが、どの記事が本当の原本になっているのかを証明することが可能になりました。

ツイッターの創業者、ジャック・ドーシーの初ツイートNFTが高額で取引されたこと覚えてますか？

MirrorのようなNFTを使ったサービスは、デジタル化によってコンテンツの複製が容易になった時代における、新しい価値を見出してくれると思うんですよね。

Mirrorの今後は不明ですが、おっちゃんは注目しています。

title: My upcoming crowdfunding
body:
## Hello everyone!

I am planning to launch the following crowdfunding campaign to give contributors NFTs but also ship real physical artworks (I created).

I would like to know if there is enough interest in this project, before I pay high gas fees to launch it :) Please share your feedback or any suggestions for improvements. Please share link to this page or give me your feedback or suggestions on my twitter: **[@ArtCoal2](https://twitter.com/ArtCoal2)**

## Basics

Project Title: **Collect Real Art + NFT**
Token: $ARTCOLLECT
My Share: 10%
Funding Goals: 7 ETH
Stretch Goal: 20 ETH
Contribution Limit: 20 ETH

## NFT Tiers

1 ETH, Supply: 10, NFT: Chaos Under Water (image)
0\.5 ETH, Supply: 15, NFT: Rainy Night (image)
0\.25 ETH, Supply: 20, NFT: Simple Life (image)

## Patron Podium

First Place: Short Video Clip with sound (“Things to do in NYC”)
Second Place: Short Video Clip with no sound (“Tell pharma to donate covid vaccines”)
Third Place: Photography image (“Busy Life”)

Countdown: 24 hours

## Who

I am a visual artist in New York City who creates drawings, paintings, sculptures, prints, photographs and digital artworks.

## What

This is my “Art Coal” project to bring you not just NFTs, but also real physical artworks. You get naming rights for the physical artworks! If you don’t pick a name, we will pick one for you. Project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** Upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>**

## Why

As you may be aware, curators, agents, dealers etc. all want a cut and decide what kind of art you should see. When you support my project, you are supporting an emerging artist directly.

## Perks

These are the perks for all contributors. These are independent of NFT Tiers and Podium rewards.

**For all contributors**:

* Your name and info will be displayed along with pictures of artworks sent to you both on project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** as well as on upcoming online museum at **<https://www.America.CC>**. You will be shown as an **Art Collector** along with your website or contact info, so people can contact you if they want to rent or buy the artwork from you. **You can opt out of this if you wish to remain anonymous.** Please see an example entry below:

![Here, title of the artwork is "The Smith Family Treasure" as chosen by the contributor. If the contributor opts to remain anonymous, lines below the line "In Private Collection" will be suppressed](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/usI_dlOnKaaWMi8kHmSHd.png?height=320&width=651)

* Naming rights. You can pick a generic name for the physical artworks. For example: “John’s summer purchase,” “To Lisa,” “My birthday present” etc. A “generic name” means a title that can be assigned to any artwork, regardless of its style, medium or subject matter. Because we choose artworks randomly, you have no way of knowing in advance which specific artwork you would receive. Therefore, please do not choose a restrictive name such as “A dreaming girl” because the artwork you receive may be about a tree instead of a girl. However, you can change the name after you receive your artwork.
* Change your chosen name (i.e. title of the artwork) any time after you receive the artwork. Your chosen name will be printed as the title of the artwork on a white paper. (If you do not choose a name, the artist will choose one). We suggest that you tape the paper with an artist tape or hang it with a string. This way, you or the next owner of the artwork (who bought or received it as a gift from you) can change the title of the artwork (i.e. chosen name) easily. Please contact us with any name changes so we can update it on our websites. Artist’s signature or name (Example: “Art Coal”), size info (Example: 8”x16”), edition info (if any) (Example: Edition 2/5) and year (Example: 2019) will be hand written (with pen, pencil, ink, oil paint or acrylic) on the front or the back of all physical artworks and must not be changed by anyone.
* All physical artworks are unique with no duplicates and we will choose them randomly when we assemble your order. So you won’t know which specific artworks you will receive.
* Physical artworks will be shipped to you (free worldwide shipping within 45 days). We will insure the shipment and make sure that you receive it on time.
* Digital images of physical artworks can be emailed to you or, if you have Opensea account (polygon network), we can transfer them as NFTs to your Opensea address. If you choose NFTs, instead of digital images of the physical artworks, the NFTs may be either exact digital images or a derivative of their digital images.
* All physical artworks come with paperwork for your insurance purposes (invoice, bill of labor, certificate of authenticity and artist’s self-appraisal). Because this is artwork by an emerging artist, without any previous sale history, appraisers and insurance companies may value the artworks based on the invoice, bill of labor or they can even value them all at zero. However, you should protect, preserve and take good care of your artworks and their NFTs and not tamper with them.
* You are welcome to proudly show your artworks to others or display them anyway you want. You can talk about the artworks, what you like and not like about them and even criticize the artworks. You can also criticize the artist! You paid for them. So enjoy them or save them safely, it is really upto you! Please do not show the artworks in any way that brings bad name to the project, artist or shows the artist in a bad light. Example of prohibited conduct: John Doe contributed 1 ETH and received the artworks. He then paid “The Great Art Appraisers, Inc.” a fee of $1500 to appraise the artworks he received. The Appraisers then value all the artworks together at $1. So, John Doe posts the artworks online and calls them worthless at such a low value. (In this scenario, John Doe should not have requested an appraisal in the first place, because these are original artworks. Secondly, the Appraisers are not qualified to appraise artworks backed by NFTs. Thirdly, John Doe should not have publicly implied that I defrauded him with worthless items as artworks)

**For 0.25 ETH**: Everything in the above list plus 4 Glossy prints of digital photography or pencil works on paper (at least 8.5”x11”)

**For 0.5 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.25 ETH plus 1 color artwork (oil paint, acrylic, watercolor or mixed; at least 18”x24”) on canvas pad (can be rolled or framed) plus 2 sketches (pencil on letter size paper).

**For 1 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.5 ETH plus 2 artworks (oil paint, acrylic, color pencil, ink or mixed) on canvas (at least 18”x24”) each stretched on a wooden frame. These 2 artworks come with one page printed write-up by the artist. The wooden frame of these 2 artworks is fixed, non-bendable and non-detachable. Everything is enclosed in a rugged re-usable plastic storage box. Please see a picture of the storage box below:

![If you contribute 1 ETH or more, your order is shipped in a plastic storage box](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ApoQT_41C-ar3N8e6_T7H.jpg?height=279&width=400)

## For Patrons Only

If you are one of the top three contributors, based on the total amount you contributed to this project, then you are considered a patron. If you’re a patron, with your permission, your name, info and/or picture will be displayed on the front page of the upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>** as well as on the first page of the PDF catalogue (The catalogue will be available on the online museum website).

## Example Artworks

These are some examples of physical artworks. We pick artworks randomly. So, you do not know which specific artworks you will receive. All artworks are appropriate for all audiences. There is no adult content. Sometimes, an oil, acrylic or watercolor painting can also include black/white or color pencil, color pen, pastel or other media. Artwork can be abstract, semi-abstract, figurative, landscape, conceptual, or any other style or mix of styles. You may or may not be able to understand, make sense of or recognize the subject matter portrayed in the artwork.

**Photography**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yR26a1Pmf68felNlB9xr2.JPG?height=737&width=983)

**Pencil Drawing**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZF1jMNlsR1Bi-DUrYW9T1.jpg?height=993&width=752)

**Sketch**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qCM_pZoHo9yYWEMR7C2UU.jpg?height=982&width=715)

**Watercolor**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wqNWtGp9Q7xhXX3rusjej.png?height=2354&width=2386)

**Acrylic**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VPHt6nPqJE6lvbbawN19e.jpg?height=996&width=995)

**Oil Paint**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4CnA4qlOFSbAc-TaCVn1v.jpg?height=680&width=983)

**Mixed Media**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6CMRrXgzo8J_57CPEhtSR.jpg?height=563&width=745)

## Risks / Challenges

An emerging artist is an up and coming artist but not established or popular yet. As a emerging artist, I create fresh arts for you. However, because this is original artwork, there is no established primary or secondary market, no price history and no guarantee of any particular price. You may or may not be able to sell it in the future due to lack of liquidity, demand or name for the artist. These are not securities, just artworks. The tokens you receive are digital receipts only. Not an offer to buy or sell securities of any kind. Coronavirus is still active and it may present unforeseen challenges such as shortage of art supplies, shipping supplies or shipping delays. You may receive your shipment damaged or delayed. Please refuse shipment if it is visibly damaged. If you notice damage after opening the shipment, please send pictures. This will help us file a claim with insurance company. You may or may not be able to understand, make sense of or recognize the subject matter portrayed in the artwork. There is no guarantee that you will make a profit or loss by selling the artworks or NFTs you purchased. Because these are original artworks, there is no history of past sales transactions. Therefore, insurance companies and appraisers may value these artworks at zero. However, if you insurance your artwork with proper coverage, and your artworks are accidentally lost or damaged, please show the invoice as proof of the amount you paid and ask your insurance company to compensate you. We can give you an estimate on replacement value if you contact us when you incur a loss. Our replacement value (i.e. the amount we will charge you to recreate the artwork or a similar artwork) is 2.5 times the you amount paid towards the artwork.

## What if you cannot afford to contribute?

If you cannot afford to contribute to this project, you can still admire and appreciate the artwork. Please share this crowdfunding project with your friends and relatives. Also, please contact me and let me know which artworks you love the most and why :) Remember, art is for everyone!

title: 波卡上的以太坊生态圈-Moonriver、Moonbeam项目分析
body:
> 《花田的区块链学习笔记》017期 Moonriver、Moonbeam学习笔记系列Ⅰ：

 

**波卡的问题**

 

**1、Moonriver、Moonbeam存在原因**

Ǿ 波卡中继链**不支持**智能合约

Ǿ 以太坊上大部分Dapp不能加载，需要一个公链（以太坊、solana、mina或者平行链）

♀ 比如Uniswap不能部署在中继链上

♀ 中继链不能发布Token

♀ 不能进行Defi

**2、Dapp进入波卡生态的方法**

Ǿ 方法一：自己拍卖插槽→建立平行链（二级公链）→建立自己Dapp（成本很高）

Ǿ 买平行链的平行线程，直接长在上面（成本很低）

了解平行线程请参考：

**Moonriver、Moonbeam愿景**

 

Ǿ 以太坊主链项目进入波卡生态最便捷的通道

Ǿ 打造波卡上的以太坊生态圈

 

 

**Moonriver、Moonbeam的关系**

 

Ǿ 波卡主网是 Moonbeam

Ǿ 波卡金丝雀网络Kusama是 Moonriver

Ǿ 两者共享大部分代码，但独立运行

Ǿ 开发者可以在 DApp 部署至 Moonbeam 之前先部署至 Moonriver 进行测试运行，以保证 DApp 的代码质量和运行的稳定性

 

**Moonriver、Moonbeam特点**

 

**1、简化跨链Dapp开发的难度**

Ǿ 以太坊开发工具都能用

Ǿ 使用Substrate架构

Ǿ 完全兼容以太坊Solidity

Ǿ 以太坊开发工具Solidity工具链（Truffle、Remix、Hardhat、Waffle）全都能用

Ǿ Web3 JavaScript 库可以直接调用

Ǿ 以太坊上的开发者不需要再学习新的语言

Ǿ 用最少的代码修改将以太坊项目转移到波卡生态

Ǿ Chainlink 和 The Graph 等基础设施服务可以直接调用

Ǿ 最轻松的以太坊跨链部署方案

Ǿ 大大降低项目方转入波卡门槛

Ǿ 为波卡生态引入大量以太坊Dapp

**2、和以太坊钱包公用私钥**

Ǿ 采用以太坊H160格式钱包格式

Ǿ 和以太坊通用一个私钥

Ǿ 用户导入以太坊私钥即可进入波卡生态

Ǿ 大大降低以太坊用户转入波卡门槛

Ǿ 为波卡生态带来大量用户

Ǿ 小狐狸可以直接使用

**3、最强兼容性的EVM虚拟机**

Ǿ 在波卡生态里重建以太坊生态

Ǿ 最好的兼容性，最便捷的虚拟机

Ǿ 最兼容的波卡生态二级公链

Ǿ 承载Sushi、DoDo等以太坊上常见的DAPP

Ǿ 质押、、借贷等Defi同样可以转移至波卡

Ǿ 无需跨链操作（用户看不到）门槛很低

Ǿ 将Defi引入波卡

**4、自成生态**

Ǿ 平行链可以引入更多平行线程

Ǿ 众多以太坊项目进入平行线程

Ǿ 形成小生态（钱包、借贷、质押。。。。）

**5、连接以太坊项目方和波卡的桥梁**

Ǿ 兼容所有其它波卡平行链

Ǿ 兼容以太坊

Ǿ 跨链以太坊和波卡

Ǿ 通过波卡中继链与其它平行链进行交互

Ǿ 共享生态系统和链上资产

**6、共享资产**

Ǿ 自由访问波卡生态的资产，如DOT、KSM、GLMR、USD）

Ǿ 自由桥接比特币、以太坊和ERC-20 Token

**7、先发优势**

Ǿ 第一批波卡卡槽拍卖得主

**8、Web3的API**

Ǿ 轻松接入Web3生态

**9、共享波卡安全**

**10、反补波卡生态**

Ǿ 移植以太坊网络资源是最好、最快的方法

**11、初见成效**

Ǿ 目前已经有150多个项目在Moonbeam测试网上线测试

Ǿ 包括Sushiswap、Balancer、Dodo、Polkastarter等

Ǿ 项目涵盖了Defi、资产、基础建设、NFT等多个赛道

Ǿ 涵盖去中心化交易所、预言机、借贷、衍生品、聚合器、资管、保险、算法稳定币等应用

**Moonriver、Moonbeam团队**

 

**1、创始人**

title: Does NFT need an ecosystem?
body:
Many people think that NFT does not need ecology. After all, a simple hot potato game, as long as you don’t pick up the drums and spread the flowers. But in fact, NFT is just a technology. Only by building an NFT ecosystem through technology can NFT's asset types be richer and the application prospects are broader.

If NFT simply relies on art transactions, it is difficult to have a big future. After all, as art works in the low-frequency trading market, it is impossible to realize the future value of NFT. Now most of the projects are for casting NFT and buying and selling NFT. , It is very likely that after the industry calms down, it will disappear. After all, the NFT asset type is too single and it is difficult to resist the industry's reshuffle.

title: Exponential Media Networks
body:
Last year's "DeFi-summer" left a mark and advanced the web3/crypto movement by introducing many people to exciting *use-cases* for blockchain and crypto technology. Currently, there's more than $92B locked in DeFi-protocols. That's huge.

Still, it's a far cry from mass adoption. Liquidity pools, collateralized crypto lending, and yield farming aren't familiar everyday terms that promote mass adoption.

Unlike DeFi, which is still pretty advanced stuff to get into, NFTs are (often) visual and are a far easier concept to "get." There's a close resemblance to the idea of digital asset ownership that's become familiar to many via Fortnite and other online games.

Like everything else blockchain that gains traction, the NFT space is chaotic and moving fast. From generative art via tons of animal avatar series to *cryptodickbutts* (yeah – I know, but I still bought and sold several. Which is either very amusing, very sad or just a sign of peak hype…).

Continuing, I'll assume you have some general idea of what NFT's are, and if not, I invite you to pause reading and simply Google "What is an NFT?".

![cryptodickbutt wearing a Jester hat](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jDfFyLY-VQ0aCRDgCLnWK.png?height=600&width=600)

Among all the craziness, there’s one specific type of NFT-project that I find fascinating: those building towards a long-term vision of building the next generation of entertainment networks.

A few weeks back, I tweeted this:

> The next Disney will be a Metaverse-connected entity that's built bottoms-up via a strong community, where fans can become fractional owners of content, characters, and revenue.

I have worked in the entertainment industry for years, and I’m convinced that what we see now is the beginning of a new way to create IP and generate value from it.

## The Old Way

Disney’s run with Marvel for the past 10+ years is a prime example of the current state of IP value creation; Movies, games, merchandise, theme park rides, and more. Top off with heavy marketing efforts.

It’s a top-down approach: the studio owns, creates, and pushes the content to the consumer, who pays the mula. The mula then moves through different value chain links, but the value *flows to the top*.

The model works well when you have an established intellectual property like the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

It gets riskier when you’re starting from scratch. You have to make big investments up-front and build fan engagement after. It may work, or it may not. The problem is that you won’t know until you have spent a lot of cash.

At some point, even Disney will have to retire (or at least scale back) the MCU initiative in favor of something fresh. 

## The New Way

Surely there must be a better way? Oh yes, The New Way: Building Exponential Entertainment Networks.

The current prime example is Pixel Vault, but other exciting projects like the Bored Ape Yacht Club, Cyber Kongz, and more follow the same path.

Pixel Vault is an entertainment group with a vision to create entertainment IP and build properties for it, much like Marvel/Disney has.

Pixel Vault has several projects in the works that all tie together. Their tentpole is the MetaHeroes: a superhero-infused universe, not so different from Marvel. There will be a game in the future, and there might be other properties (movies, comics, series, etc.).

![My badass MetaHero from Mars](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/i3PGHNa5yeXDtdFFzZmLj.png?height=1004&width=998)

The big difference between Disney and Pixel Vault is their starting point: they’re starting with *fan engagement first.*

The ultimate success metric is whether the content engages fans or not. Pixel Vault started solving the most important thing first and built “backward” from there.

Now, how can they do that? By leveraging some of the fundamental components of web3 oriented products and services. Specifically, two important ones that's pretty tough to replicate for a legacy entertainment company:

**Fan engagement through ownership**

There’s no MetaHero game or movie ready to play or watch yet. There are a bunch of characters that will play a vital role in the future MetaHero Universe. These characters are NFT’s that fans of the project have bought and own.

Fans can become investors in the Pixel Vault project via ownership of these characters and by owning a share of the Pixel Vault project itself or even by holding a share of one of the planets inside the universe.

It sounds crazy when compared to Disney, and it is. It’s also pretty fxcking awesome.

Owning a piece of the game you play, the movie you watch, or one of the characters *in the movie* is next-level fan engagement.

It also unlocks another exciting component: revenue share. The different pieces of the universe (group ownership, character ownership, planet ownership) are entitled to share the revenue generated inside the ecosystem.

It also enables value to be distributed among fans, stakeholders, and the community, rather than solely flowing to the top and into the deep pockets of a select few owners.

Pixel Vault has raised several ten-million bags of dollars in funding by selling to the community investors. Funds they can now use to create the next phase of the entertainment network: properties (first: a game experience where the characters come to life).

**Community-driven**

Since community members are also owners, the project itself is community-directed to a certain degree.

How do we build the game? Partnering with a game studio? Acquiring a game studio? Building it in “in-house”? The community stakeholders take part in the process by voting.

This mechanic keeps the community continuously engaged with the long-term vision of the project.

Now, this is all new terrain, and Pixel Vault still has a lot to prove. It’s an experiment in progress with a lot of room to fail. Still, if nobody tries, nobody succeeds.

A few days ago, the project announced it had signed a deal with WME, one of the biggest talent agencies in Hollywood. That’s a pretty strong signal. Hollywood has already taken notice.

I’m excited about the future of Pixel Vault and the playbook they’re writing on how to create future Exponential Entertainment Networks.

*Disclaimer: I have invested in the Pixel Vault / Metahero project.*

title: JOJO Metaverse 科普系列 (三)
body:
这一节中将介绍如何使用[奖励系统](https://jojo.fun/bounty)来获取免费的 NFT。

## 1. NFT 分类及作用

按照等级来说分为：铁(5) < 铜(10) < 银(50) < 金(100) < N(50) < S(100)< SR(150) < SSR(300)。括号里的数字代表它们的算力，也即在奖励矿池 (Bounty Pool) 挖取 JOJO 的能力。

上面四个一般是完成较简单的任务获得，而下面一排一般是较困难的任务以及特殊的现实任务获得。也就是说你完成简单任务即使可以得到很多 NFT 但它们的价值都是有限的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cfsfhDqhFJXAS3nRHldBp.bmp?height=637&width=1088)

## 2. 如何使用奖励系统

对于新人来说，最简单的是以下几种任务。

**注意：完成任务之前一定要点击领取任务！！！**

### (1) 社区任务

社区任务是最简单的一类，每个地址只能完成一个，一般是获得最廉价的铁 JOJO。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yA_T6Gl-GLmMJnZmfNDrG.bmp?height=744&width=1410)

例如这个任务，首先**点击领取任务**你需要关注推特和迪斯科频道等，并提交你的推特 ID 供项目方审核，一般在一天内审核完成并领取 NFT。(有很多人反应在完成社区型任务会出现 “Not in the whitelist” 的错误 (小概率事件)。我的建议是直接放弃，因为价值本省很低又是免费的；如果不嫌麻烦的可以去官方电报找管理员)

### (2) 购买型任务

对于想要屯币的人来说，这类任务非常划算，可以免费获得一个高价值的奖励 JOJO。

以 18 BNB (系统里还有有0.1，1.5，6 BNB 的任务)为例，你在 Pancake **一次性** 购买超过 18 BNB 就可以获得一个 SSR JOJO。注意，需要一次性购买，并且**一定要在购买前点击领取任务**。如果你的钱不多或者你不想投入太多，也可以选取 6 BNB 任务 (获得的金 JOJO 价值 50 美元左右）。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1TGbXC6HJN0vDUinPzOdf.bmp?height=820&width=1498)

### (3) JOJO Metaverse 体验类任务

完成拍卖任务、洗炼任务 (要求洗炼出特定的基因) 或是铸造 Gamer NFT 任务可以获得。

例如拍卖，进行达到额定金额的一定数量的拍卖，注意任务的时间周期一般为 7 天，即 7 天内没完成自动取消，所以领取拍卖任务的话一定要及时完成。

以 18 BNB (系统里还有有0.1，1.5，6 BNB 的任务)为例，你在 Pancake **一次性** 购买超过 18 BNB 就可以获得一个 SSR JOJO。注意，需要一次性购买，并且**一定要在购买前点击领取任务**。如果你的钱不多或者你不想投入太多，也可以选取 6 BNB 任务 (获得的金 JOJO 价值 50 美元左右）。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1TGbXC6HJN0vDUinPzOdf.bmp?height=820&width=1498)

### (3) JOJO Metaverse 体验类任务

完成拍卖任务、洗炼任务 (要求洗炼出特定的基因) 或是铸造 Gamer NFT 任务可以获得。

例如拍卖，进行达到额定金额的一定数量的拍卖，注意任务的时间周期一般为 7 天，即 7 天内没完成自动取消，所以领取拍卖任务的话一定要及时完成。

title: Mirror ブロックチェーンブログプラットフォーム【初心者】
body:
お疲れ様です、[ソマウタ](twitter.com/somauta79)です。

今回は、@ManabuさんがVoicyで話しに触れていた「Mirror」について調べました。

この話が気になる方は、こちらからどうぞ。

[https://voicy.jp/channel/1623/219047](https://voicy.jp/channel/1623/219047)

こちらもツイートされてました。

[https://twitter.com/manabubannai/status/1445950718771228673?s=20](https://twitter.com/manabubannai/status/1445950718771228673?s=20)

あっ、ちなみにですが、本編は、ダッシュボードのガイドをなるべく分かりやすく（らーめん屋のおっちゃんでも分かるように）解説していますので、翻訳するのが面倒だったり、ざっくりと何となく理解したい方は、読み進めてください。

## ✔目次

* Mirror とは
* Mirror の始め方
* Mirror の使い方
* Mirror のNFTコンテンツ化
* 未来予想

### ■ 1. Mirror とは

* イーサリアムベースの分散方ブログプラットフォーム
* イーサリアムウォレット所持者が投稿できるブログ
* 記事をNFTにできる
* クラウドファンディング、オークションなどができる

仮想通貨投資をしている人なら簡単に使えるブログで、WordPressがブロックチェーン上にあるみたいなものです。後半2つは、ナゾですよね、、それでは、説明にはいります。

### ■ 2. Mirror の始め方

まずは、公式のページにいきます。

[https://mirror.xyz/](https://mirror.xyz/)

画面の右上の \[Connect Wallet\] をクリックします。

自分のウォレットと同期させます。（自分はメタマスクで同期しました）

そして、アカウントを設定しましょう！

こちらは、名前、プロフィール画像設定します。

以上です！！（簡単）

### ■ 3. Mirror の使い方

ではでは、ブログの書き方になります。

ダッシュボードの、\[Entries\] をクリックします。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GHFdrL3lkjRkiueak6Xzl.png?height=619&width=1366)

これで、ブログを書くページになります。

でか目のタイトルが書けるスペースがあり、あとは、すらすらと本文を書くだけです。

冒頭に、ツイッターやVoicyのリンクが貼ってありますが、リンクをコピペするだけで、ブログっぽくイイ感じになりました。

続いて、ページの下には、 \[**Blocks** ⌘+/\] という機能があります。

クリックすると、こんな画面が出てきます。

![Creating blocks](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dnRW2fnfrRrPE9ZIB3l5.png?height=318&width=370)

上から順番に解説していきますね。

* \[Heading 2\] ・・・ 中サイズの見出しです。文中のこれです。

## (例) ✔目次

* \[Heading 3\] ・・・ 小サイズの見出しです。文中のこれです。

### (例) ■ 3. Mirror の使い方

* \[Image\] ・・・ 画像の挿入です。ファイルを選択するか、画像をドラック＆ペーストするか、リンクをペーストするだけです。（超絶かんたん）
* \[Bulleted List\] ・・・ 小見出しの前にある灰色のポッチです。 \[・\] こんなやつです。
* \[Blockquote\] ・・・ 左側にある青色の線です。引用とかに使えそうですね。

> ### Creating blocks
>
> To easily create a media or economic block, first click inside your entry to place the curser where you’d like the block to appear. Next, click the **Blocks** area of the Toolbar, or focus with the keyboard shortcut `⌘+/`. The blocks menu will appear, showing you all available blocks. Selecting a block prompts you for secondary information. Once you’re satisfied, confirm the information to insert the block into your entry.

* \[</> Code\] ・・・ 初心者はなくても良きです。要勉強ですね。
* \[Crowdfund\] ・・・ 資産を集めるクラウドファンディングです。リンクが貼れるようになります。この辺りはやりたいですよね。まだまだ先ですが、、、以下、引用と翻訳です。

> On Mirror, anyone can raise funds for an idea or project using the Crowdfund block. Under the hood, a Crowdfund is a smart contract on Ethereum. Backers deposit ETH to fund your idea in exchange for a token. The token represents a proof of patronage and a stake in the potential success of your project. Crowdfunds can be embedded into any entry on Mirror, alongside text and other media blocks that tell your project's story.
>
> ミラーでは、誰でもクラウドファンディングブロックを使用してアイデアやプロジェクトの資金を調達できます。内部的には、クラウドファンディングはイーサリアムのスマートコントラクトです。支援者は、トークンと引き換えにあなたのアイデアに資金を提供するためにETHをデポジットします。トークンは、プロジェクトの潜在的な成功へのご愛顧と利害関係の証拠を表しています。Crowdfundsは、プロジェクトのストーリーを伝えるテキストやその他のメディアブロックとともに、Mirrorの任意のエントリーに埋め込むことができます。

* \[Edition\] ・・・ NFTを固定の金額で個数を指定して販売出来るようです。日本でいう、elu(エル)のNFT版ですかね？！今後は、調べて活用したいですね。以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Editions are a way for creators to mint a limited supply of identical NFTs at a fixed price. If a 1/1 NFT is a Picasso at Sotheby's, Editions are like the thousands of first-edition holographic Charizards released.
>
> エディションは、クリエイターが固定価格で同一のNFTの限られた供給をミントするための方法です。1/1 NFTがサザビーズのピカソである場合、エディションは、リリースされた何千もの初版ホログラフィックリザードンのようなものです。

* \[Auction\] ・・・ NFTオークションです。独自のオークションを開催出来るので、多くの人に認知されれば期待大ですね。コツコツ頑張りましょう。

> Mirror supports auctioning off NFTs using reserve auctions. Reserve auctions are configured with two main parameters: the reserve price and the auction duration. Like other economic blocks on Mirror, your auction is deployed as a smart contract and can be embedded inside any Mirror entry.
>
> ミラーは、リザーブオークションを使用したNFTのオークションをサポートしています。リザーブオークションは、リザーブ価格とオークション期間という2つの主要なパラメータで構成されます。ミラーの他の経済ブロックと同様に、オークションはスマートコントラクトとして展開され、ミラーエントリ内に埋め込むことができます。

* \[Split\] ・・・ こちらは共同でプロジェクトを立ち上げたりした場合に、資産を分配出来るみたいです。以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Splits on Mirror are a way to automatically share the value you produce with multiple entities. A split is a payable smart contract that routes value to multiple addresses on Ethereum.
>
> Splits can be used as a way to reward your collaborators, the people that have inspired you, or to donate proceeds from your work.
>
> Create a split by going to the Splits tab in your dashboard. A split needs to be made between at least two addresses and the percentages must add up to 100%.
>
> ミラーでの分割は、生成した値を複数のエンティティと自動的に共有する方法です。分割は、イーサリアムの複数のアドレスに値をルーティングする支払い可能なスマートコントラクトです。
>
> スプリットは、あなたの協力者、あなたにインスピレーションを与えた人々に報酬を与える方法、またはあなたの仕事からの収益を寄付する方法として使用できます。
>
> ダッシュボードの\[分割\]タブに移動して、分割を作成します。少なくとも2つのアドレス間で分割を行う必要があり、パーセンテージの合計は100％になる必要があります。

* \[NFT Preview\] ・・・ こちらはMirrorの醍醐味と言ってもイイのではないでしょうか。ブログコンテンツをNFT化出来るサービスですね。この先は、NFTについて話していきます。

以下、引用と翻訳です。

> Entries on Mirror can be minted as NFTs. In order to mint your entry as an NFT, check off the NFT checkbox in the top right corner of the entry editor. Upload a cover image for your entry so it can be rendered across different NFT platforms. Once your NFT is minted on-chain, you'll see confirmation in the byline of your entry.
>
> You can retroactively mint a previous entry by editing it, checking the NFT checkbox, and saving the entry. To see which of your entries have been minted as NFTs under the Entries tab in the dashboard.
>
> ミラー上のエントリは、NFTとして作成できます。エントリをNFTとして作成するには、エントリエディタの右上隅にある\[NFT\]チェックボックスをオフにします。エントリのカバー画像をアップロードして、さまざまなNFTプラットフォームでレンダリングできるようにします。NFTがチェーン上で作成されると、エントリの署名記事に確認が表示されます。以前のエントリを編集し、\[NFT\]チェックボックスをオンにして、エントリを保存することで、過去にさかのぼって作成できます。ダッシュボードの\[エントリ\]タブで、どのエントリがNFTとして作成されているかを確認します。

### ■ 4. Mirror のNFTコンテンツ化

Mirrorの醍醐味、ブログコンテンツをNFT化するについてです。

これは何かというと、イーサリアム上にブログを作成し、iFrame、動画、NFT、ツイート、クラウドファンド、オークションなどのソーシャルメディアの投稿に至るまで、メディアブロックをブログに埋め込むことができます。

SubstackやMediumなどの他のプラットフォームからブログをインポートすることもできます。

最も重要なことは、ブロガーがブログを「エントリーエディション」として作成できることであり、これは、コンテンツのNFT化であり、それらを収益化することができます。

すばらしい！！パチ、パチ、パチ、パチ（拍手）

* Mirrorは業界のリーダーやDAOによって使用されてきました。

イーサリアムの共同創設者のVitalikButerinのような業界リーダーや、Aave Grants DAOのようないくつかの分散型自律組織（DAO）は、Mirrorを使用してコンテンツを公開してきました。

2021年のイーサリアムの開発に関するドキュメンタリーは、Mirrorのクラウドファンディング使用してを通じて1,036ETH（約4000万）を調達しました。

> ## Mirror has been used by industry leaders and DAOs
>
> イーサリアムの共同創設者であるVitalikButerinのような業界リーダーや、Aave Grants DAOのようないくつかの分散型自律組織（DAO）は、ミラーを使用してコンテンツを公開しています。
>
> 今年の7月、イーサリアムの開発に関するドキュメンタリーは、ミラーを使用してクラウドファンディングを通じて1,036ETHを調達しました。

(引用:bitcoinethereumnews.com)

### ■ 5. 未来予想

ワクワクするようなプロジェクトですよね。

ユーザーが書いたブログ記事は、NFTに紐づけることで、その記事を世の中に唯一無二のものとして、公開することができるようになりました。

Mirrorで書かれた記事に価値を見出す人が存在すれば、その記事に価値が付き、所有権をNFTで売買できるようになります。

所詮、テキストなので、コピペすれば元も子もないですが、どの記事が本当の原本になっているのかを証明することが可能になりました。

ツイッターの創業者、ジャック・ドーシーの初ツイートNFTが高額で取引されたこと覚えてますか？

MirrorのようなNFTを使ったサービスは、デジタル化によってコンテンツの複製が容易になった時代に、新しい価値を見出してくれると思うんですよね。

Mirrorの今後は不明ですが、おっちゃんは注目しています。

※余談ですが、集中して書いていたのでPCの電源落ちるまで気付かなかったです、、、8割まで書いて消えました。涙

対処法は、小まめに保存すること。歯車マークをクリックして、パブリックかドラフトか選択して、Saveしてください。下書きはドラフトです。

セーブして思ったのですが、パーマリンクで投稿を見ると、改行して、スペース開けたのに元に戻っていたり、 \[Bulleted List\]の・と数字がうまく表示されず、断念しました。（技術不足）

2回も書いたのでより理解が深まったので良きです。

何事も手を動かさないとですね。とりあえずやってみる。

※2. このあと、NFT化して投稿しようとしました。が、ガス代高くて諦めました。

１投稿$100したら、稼ぐまで道のりが、かなり無理ゲー感ありますよね。

ですが！！、土日はガス代が少し安いので、土日に投稿しましょう！

ただ、投稿する分には大丈夫です。（無料でできます）

そうそう、投稿する画面で、ブログのトップ画像もアップ出来ます。サイズは１：２です。

最後に、イーサリアムのアドレスをコピペして投稿完了です。

それでは、ネガティブ要素も克服しつつ、コツコツやっていきましょう！

おわり

title: My upcoming crowdfunding
body:
## Hello everyone!

I am planning to launch the following crowdfunding campaign to give contributors NFTs but also ship real physical artworks (I created).

I would like to know if there is enough interest in this project, before I pay high gas fees to launch it :) Please share your feedback or any suggestions for improvements. Please share link to this page or give me your feedback or suggestions on my twitter: **[@ArtCoal2  ](https://twitter.com/ArtCoal2)**

Please join my Discord Server here: **<https://discord.gg/MtHz7mpwFd>**

## Basics

Project Title: **Collect Real Art + NFT**
Token: $ARTCOLLECT
My Share: 10%
Funding Goals: 7 ETH
Stretch Goal: 20 ETH
Contribution Limit: 20 ETH

## NFT Tiers

1 ETH, Supply: 10, NFT: Chaos Under Water (image)
0\.5 ETH, Supply: 15, NFT: Rainy Night (image)
0\.25 ETH, Supply: 20, NFT: Simple Life (image)

## Patron Podium

First Place: Short Video Clip with sound (“Things to do in NYC”)
Second Place: Short Video Clip with no sound (“Tell pharma to donate covid vaccines”)
Third Place: Photography image (“Busy Life”)

Countdown: 24 hours

## Who

I am a visual artist in New York City who creates drawings, paintings, sculptures, prints, photographs and digital artworks.

## What

This is my “Art Coal” project to bring you not just NFTs, but also real physical artworks. You get naming rights for the physical artworks! If you don’t pick a name, we will pick one for you. Project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** Upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>**

## Why

As you may be aware, curators, agents, dealers etc. all want a cut and decide what kind of art you should see. When you support my project, you are supporting an emerging artist directly.

## Perks

These are the perks for all contributors. These are independent of NFT Tiers and Podium rewards.

**For all contributors**:

* Your name and info will be displayed along with pictures of artworks sent to you both on project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** as well as on upcoming online museum at **<https://www.America.CC>**. You will be shown as an **Art Collector** along with your website or contact info, so people can contact you if they want to rent or buy the artwork from you. **You can opt out of this if you wish to remain anonymous.** Please see an example entry below:

![Here, title of the artwork is "The Smith Family Treasure" as chosen by the contributor. If the contributor opts to remain anonymous, lines below the line "In Private Collection" will be suppressed](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/usI_dlOnKaaWMi8kHmSHd.png?height=320&width=651)

* Naming rights. You can pick a generic name for the physical artworks. For example: “John’s summer purchase,” “To Lisa,” “My birthday present” etc. A “generic name” means a title that can be assigned to any artwork, regardless of its style, medium or subject matter. Because we choose artworks randomly, you have no way of knowing in advance which specific artwork you would receive. Therefore, please do not choose a restrictive name such as “A dreaming girl” because the artwork you receive may be about a tree instead of a girl. However, you can change the name after you receive your artwork.
* Change your chosen name (i.e. title of the artwork) any time after you receive the artwork. Your chosen name will be printed as the title of the artwork on a white paper. (If you do not choose a name, the artist will choose one). We suggest that you tape the paper with an artist tape or hang it with a string. This way, you or the next owner of the artwork (who bought or received it as a gift from you) can change the title of the artwork (i.e. chosen name) easily. Please contact us with any name changes so we can update it on our websites. Artist’s signature or name (Example: “Art Coal”), size info (Example: 8”x16”), edition info (if any) (Example: Edition 2/5) and year (Example: 2019) will be hand written (with pen, pencil, ink, oil paint or acrylic) on the front or the back of all physical artworks and must not be changed by anyone.
* All physical artworks are unique with no duplicates and we will choose them randomly when we assemble your order. So you won’t know which specific artworks you will receive.
* Physical artworks will be shipped to you (free worldwide shipping within 45 days). We will insure the shipment and make sure that you receive it on time.
* Digital images of physical artworks can be emailed to you or, if you have Opensea account (polygon network), we can transfer them as NFTs to your Opensea address. If you choose NFTs, instead of digital images of the physical artworks, the NFTs may be either exact digital images or a derivative of their digital images.
* All physical artworks come with paperwork for your insurance purposes (invoice, bill of labor, certificate of authenticity and artist’s self-appraisal). Because this is artwork by an emerging artist, without any previous sale history, appraisers and insurance companies may value the artworks based on the invoice, bill of labor or they can even value them all at zero. However, you should protect, preserve and take good care of your artworks and their NFTs and not tamper with them.
* You are welcome to proudly show your artworks to others or display them anyway you want. You can talk about the artworks, what you like and not like about them and even criticize the artworks. You can also criticize the artist! You paid for them. So enjoy them or save them safely, it is really upto you! Please do not show the artworks in any way that brings bad name to the project, artist or shows the artist in a bad light. Example of prohibited conduct: John Doe contributed 1 ETH and received the artworks. He then paid “The Great Art Appraisers, Inc.” a fee of $1500 to appraise the artworks he received. The Appraisers then value all the artworks together at $1. So, John Doe posts the artworks online and calls them worthless at such a low value. (In this scenario, John Doe should not have requested an appraisal in the first place, because these are original artworks. Secondly, the Appraisers are not qualified to appraise artworks backed by NFTs. Thirdly, John Doe should not have publicly implied that I defrauded him with worthless items as artworks)

**For 0.25 ETH**: Everything in the above list plus 4 Glossy prints of digital photography or pencil works on paper (at least 8.5”x11”)

**For 0.5 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.25 ETH plus 1 color artwork (oil paint, acrylic, watercolor or mixed; at least 18”x24”) on canvas pad (can be rolled or framed) plus 2 sketches (pencil on letter size paper).

**For 1 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.5 ETH plus 2 artworks (oil paint, acrylic, color pencil, ink or mixed) on canvas (at least 18”x24”) each stretched on a wooden frame. These 2 artworks come with one page printed write-up by the artist. The wooden frame of these 2 artworks is fixed, non-bendable and non-detachable. Everything is enclosed in a rugged re-usable plastic storage box. Please see a picture of the storage box below:

![If you contribute 1 ETH or more, your order is shipped in a plastic storage box](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ApoQT_41C-ar3N8e6_T7H.jpg?height=279&width=400)

## For Patrons Only

If you are one of the top three contributors, based on the total amount you contributed to this project, then you are considered a patron. If you’re a patron, with your permission, your name, info and/or picture will be displayed on the front page of the upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>** as well as on the first page of the PDF catalogue (The catalogue will be available on the online museum website).

## Example Artworks

These are some examples of physical artworks. We pick artworks randomly. So, you do not know which specific artworks you will receive. All artworks are appropriate for all audiences. There is no adult content. Sometimes, an oil, acrylic or watercolor painting can also include black/white or color pencil, color pen, pastel or other media. Artwork can be abstract, semi-abstract, figurative, landscape, conceptual, or any other style or mix of styles. You may or may not be able to understand, make sense of or recognize the subject matter portrayed in the artwork.

**Photography**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yR26a1Pmf68felNlB9xr2.JPG?height=737&width=983)

**Pencil Drawing**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZF1jMNlsR1Bi-DUrYW9T1.jpg?height=993&width=752)

**Sketch**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qCM_pZoHo9yYWEMR7C2UU.jpg?height=982&width=715)

**Watercolor**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wqNWtGp9Q7xhXX3rusjej.png?height=2354&width=2386)

**Acrylic**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VPHt6nPqJE6lvbbawN19e.jpg?height=996&width=995)

**Oil Paint**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4CnA4qlOFSbAc-TaCVn1v.jpg?height=680&width=983)

**Mixed Media**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6CMRrXgzo8J_57CPEhtSR.jpg?height=563&width=745)

## Risks / Challenges

An emerging artist is an up and coming artist but not established or popular yet. As a emerging artist, I create fresh arts for you. However, because this is original artwork, there is no established primary or secondary market, no price history and no guarantee of any particular price. You may or may not be able to sell it in the future due to lack of liquidity, demand or name for the artist. These are not securities, just artworks. The tokens you receive are digital receipts only. Not an offer to buy or sell securities of any kind. Coronavirus is still active and it may present unforeseen challenges such as shortage of art supplies, shipping supplies or shipping delays. You may receive your shipment damaged or delayed. Please refuse shipment if it is visibly damaged. If you notice damage after opening the shipment, please send pictures. title: 去中心化内容发布平台 Mirror 开放写作功能
body:
## Mirror 去中心化内容发布平台，由前 Andreessen Horowitz 加密合伙人 Denis Nazarov 创立，类似于 Medium，通过为创作者提供代币发行工具来帮助创作者众筹，现已有创作者在该平台完成创作众筹。

其将使用 Arweave 数据存储协议来存储用户内容，使用 ENS 域名向作者提供域所有权，所有条目均由用户签名密钥。另外，由于使用 Arweave 协议，Mirror 每个博客帖子的费用仅约为 0.00005 AR，当前价值约合 0.00015 美元。

该协议目前仍处于早期阶段，正在使用以太坊测试网基础设施来探索其想法。为提升读写体验，Mirror 决定构建一个后端 API，该 API 可以充当客户端和协议之间的网关，这将使用户能够在发布到 Arweave 之前进行签名验证，或者自己为 Arweave 内容付费，并以极快的响应时间缓存条目内容。

title: 国庆假期操作复盘
body:
## 交易

一句话形容：shit一样的操作。实盘收益由盈利最高268.2%降到46.1%，曲线一路下滑。

亏损全部由做空产生，而巧的是，国庆这几天我从4万8一路空到了5万6.我不亏谁亏……

最开始我只是想吃个回调，可是没想到每次都打止损。这激发了我的逆反心理，后面好多次空都是带着：我就不信这还不跌的心理再做，而我的损失也越来越大。

看着别人账户不断新高，我就更加的焦虑，越焦虑就越出错，就越想频繁交易，然后就是看到一点浮亏就接受不了，就赶快平仓，将浮亏变实亏，而行情有时候又会继续朝着我开的方向走。

这次的亏损教训还是蛮大：

* **Trade what you see, not what you think**.就像雷公说的这句话一样，眼见为实，不能按照自己的想法去交易。我做空的亏损就是因为总是想着要回调，而没有看到盘面越来越强，按自己的想法交易而不是按照市场交易。所以后面的交易要按图操作，图表告诉我什么，就怎么做。可以有自己的预期，但是当自己的预期错了后，要及时止损，回头是岸，而不是执迷不悟。
* **不做逆趋势交易。**不在上升趋势中开空吃回调，这也是我学到的重要一课。我没有那么高的技术，做不来多空双吃，就老老实实按照顺趋势的方向做。如果觉得有大回调，可以套保或低倍净空，绝不高倍做空，控制亏损。
* **趋势行情中，一定要保留底仓。**其实这次我抄底的时机真的很好，确实买在了底部，因为刻舟求剑，参考了去年9.4的行情，但是也误在了刻舟求剑，认为一定会有一个大笔回调，所以早早的清掉了抄底仓位，开空等回调。延迟满足，做时间的朋友，不要急于变现，现金是沙，越想握住流失的越快。
* **冷静的心态最重要，焦虑的时候切忌开单。**学会心态管理也是重要的部分。当不冷静的时候就看看书吧，《以交易为生》值得再看。

> ***这次合约账户还有1000U，慢慢交易，看什么时候我能达到我的100倍。***

## 挖矿

投入了5000U买入了FTM去挖了geist。挖矿领域我还是小白一个，多多学习摸索吧。脚本在这里很重要，我也要学习起来。毕竟我还是个程序媛，功底不深但是还有一点，好好学习应该可以的。

## 最伤心的事情

今早5点高达nft开奖，迷迷糊糊的我点进去一个高仿号，给他打了0.4个以太。然后我清醒了。我真是tm的傻逼了。怎么说呢，花钱买了个教训，迷迷糊糊，不要轻易转账。不要相信任何私信（我甚至没看出来这个是私信…）。sad。

国庆假期已经过去，这简直噩梦般的一周。生活和交易还要继续，crypto的世界还有更多的东西需要我去探索。将这些经验及教训牢记，不愉快忘记，继续拼杀吧。

## 写在最后：

> 今天正好是我进圈一年。还记得最开始啥也不懂，就是高杠杆瞎jb做合约，爆仓了好几次，庆幸的是到现在没有亏损，小赚了一点点。感谢进圈后遇到托马斯，让我知道了什么是交易，原来我需要学的还有这么多。交易之路漫长，我愿意在此求索。我也相信，币圈是我人生中难能可贵的机遇，少有的能跨越阶级的机会，就看我如何把握住了。
>
> 加油吧，小源源。既然决定全职做，那么就放手一搏！

body:
## Hello everyone!

I am planning to launch the following crowdfunding campaign to give contributors NFTs but also ship real physical artworks (I created).

I would like to know if there is enough interest in this project, before I pay high gas fees to launch it :) Please share your feedback or any suggestions for improvements. Please share link to this page or give me your feedback or suggestions on my twitter: **[@ArtCoal2](https://twitter.com/ArtCoal2)**  

Please join my Discord Server here: **<https://discord.gg/MtHz7mpwFd>**

## Basics

Project Title: **Collect Real Art + NFT**
Token: $ARTCOLLECT
My Share: 10%
Funding Goals: 7 ETH
Stretch Goal: 20 ETH
Contribution Limit: 20 ETH

## NFT Tiers

1 ETH, Supply: 10, NFT: Chaos Under Water (image)
0\.5 ETH, Supply: 15, NFT: Rainy Night (image)
0\.25 ETH, Supply: 20, NFT: Simple Life (image)

## Patron Podium

First Place: Short Video Clip with sound (“Things to do in NYC”)
Second Place: Short Video Clip with no sound (“Tell pharma to donate covid vaccines”)
Third Place: Photography image (“Busy Life”)

Countdown: 24 hours

## Who

I am a visual artist in New York City who creates drawings, paintings, sculptures, prints, photographs and digital artworks.

## What

This is my “Art Coal” project to bring you not just NFTs, but also real physical artworks. You get naming rights for the physical artworks! If you don’t pick a name, we will pick one for you. Project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** Upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>**

## Why

As you may be aware, curators, agents, dealers etc. all want a cut and decide what kind of art you should see. When you support my project, you are supporting an emerging artist directly.

## Perks

These are the perks for all contributors. These are independent of NFT Tiers and Podium rewards.

**For all contributors**:

* Your name and info will be displayed along with pictures of artworks sent to you both on project website: **<https://www.artcoal.com>** as well as on upcoming online museum at **<https://www.America.CC>**. You will be shown as an **Art Collector** along with your website or contact info, so people can contact you if they want to rent or buy the artwork from you. **You can opt out of this if you wish to remain anonymous.** Please see an example entry below:

![Here, title of the artwork is "The Smith Family Treasure" as chosen by the contributor. If the contributor opts to remain anonymous, lines below the line "In Private Collection" will be suppressed](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/usI_dlOnKaaWMi8kHmSHd.png?height=320&width=651)

* Naming rights. You can pick a generic name for the physical artworks. For example: “John’s summer purchase,” “To Lisa,” “My birthday present” etc. A “generic name” means a title that can be assigned to any artwork, regardless of its style, medium or subject matter. Because we choose artworks randomly, you have no way of knowing in advance which specific artwork you would receive. Therefore, please do not choose a restrictive name such as “A dreaming girl” because the artwork you receive may be about a tree instead of a girl. However, you can change the name after you receive your artwork.
* Change your chosen name (i.e. title of the artwork) any time after you receive the artwork. Your chosen name will be printed as the title of the artwork on a white paper. (If you do not choose a name, the artist will choose one). We suggest that you tape the paper with an artist tape or hang it with a string. This way, you or the next owner of the artwork (who bought or received it as a gift from you) can change the title of the artwork (i.e. chosen name) easily. Please contact us with any name changes so we can update it on our websites. Artist’s signature or name (Example: “Art Coal”), size info (Example: 8”x16”), edition info (if any) (Example: Edition 2/5) and year (Example: 2019) will be hand written (with pen, pencil, ink, oil paint or acrylic) on the front or the back of all physical artworks and must not be changed by anyone.
* All physical artworks are unique with no duplicates and we will choose them randomly when we assemble your order. So you won’t know which specific artworks you will receive.
* Physical artworks will be shipped to you (free worldwide shipping within 45 days). We will insure the shipment and make sure that you receive it on time.
* Digital images of physical artworks can be emailed to you or, if you have Opensea account (polygon network), we can transfer them as NFTs to your Opensea address. If you choose NFTs, instead of digital images of the physical artworks, the NFTs may be either exact digital images or a derivative of their digital images.
* All physical artworks come with paperwork for your insurance purposes (invoice, bill of labor, certificate of authenticity and artist’s self-appraisal). Because this is artwork by an emerging artist, without any previous sale history, appraisers and insurance companies may value the artworks based on the invoice, bill of labor or they can even value them all at zero. However, you should protect, preserve and take good care of your artworks and their NFTs and not tamper with them.
* You are welcome to proudly show your artworks to others or display them anyway you want. You can talk about the artworks, what you like and not like about them and even criticize the artworks. You can also criticize the artist! You paid for them. So enjoy them or save them safely, it is really upto you! Please do not show the artworks in any way that brings bad name to the project, artist or shows the artist in a bad light. Example of prohibited conduct: John Doe contributed 1 ETH and received the artworks. He then paid “The Great Art Appraisers, Inc.” a fee of $1500 to appraise the artworks he received. The Appraisers then value all the artworks together at $1. So, John Doe posts the artworks online and calls them worthless at such a low value. (In this scenario, John Doe should not have requested an appraisal in the first place, because these are original artworks. Secondly, the Appraisers are not qualified to appraise artworks backed by NFTs. Thirdly, John Doe should not have publicly implied that I defrauded him with worthless items as artworks)

**For 0.25 ETH**: Everything in the above list plus 4 Glossy prints of digital photography or pencil works on paper (at least 8.5”x11”)

**For 0.5 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.25 ETH plus 1 color artwork (oil paint, acrylic, watercolor or mixed; at least 18”x24”) on canvas pad (can be rolled or framed) plus 2 sketches (pencil on letter size paper).

**For 1 ETH**: Everything you get for 0.5 ETH plus 2 artworks (oil paint, acrylic, color pencil, ink or mixed) on canvas (at least 18”x24”) each stretched on a wooden frame. These 2 artworks come with one page printed write-up by the artist. The wooden frame of these 2 artworks is fixed, non-bendable and non-detachable. Everything is enclosed in a rugged re-usable plastic storage box. Please see a picture of the storage box below:

![If you contribute 1 ETH or more, your order is shipped in a plastic storage box](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ApoQT_41C-ar3N8e6_T7H.jpg?height=279&width=400)

## For Patrons Only

If you are one of the top three contributors, based on the total amount you contributed to this project, then you are considered a patron. If you’re a patron, with your permission, your name, info and/or picture will be displayed on the front page of the upcoming online museum: **<https://www.America.CC>** as well as on the first page of the PDF catalogue (The catalogue will be available on the online museum website).

These are some examples of physical artworks. We pick artworks randomly. So, you do not know which specific artworks you will receive. All artworks are appropriate for all audiences. There is no adult content. Sometimes, an oil, acrylic or watercolor painting can also include black/white or color pencil, color pen, pastel or other media.  假我最初1110 ETH和15000 USDC USDC没有Uniswap里做资产，扣押ETH到2000 USDC。然后我的数量不变，资产价值却变了10 \* 2000 + 15000 = 35000 USDC，净增加了5000 USDC，比现在Uniswap做LP多赚了360 USDC。 
  
 ，经计算清楚，做LP是不划算的，可以不太高拥有长大 
  
 的性格，如果找到了，也算算，LP会得到最完美的因为。 
  
 LP真的是傻瓜吗？AMM里面的钱真的是傻钱吗？刘教链公众号在6 / 29 写过一篇文章[“LP是傻瓜吗？”，在](http://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5MjMwNjgzMA==&mid=2247486108&idx=1&sn=ae003a382fd5d5d603a1fef033ab6d50&chksm=a6a9097d91de806bc4c70fb9b37f3c461041393f14c09b4a4bbbadafb8f4f8513d6c84bfd4de&scene=21#wechat_redirect)此进行了一些探讨。

 
 做LP相对于持币说所损失的收益，有一个世俗的无常损失，直译的“永远的失去”，一个流行的译法“无常的损失。”了英文原版的英文。 
  
 我们会看到，只要ETH/USDC的例子为什么，重回到ETH1500 USDC的起点，那么就没有损失了。持有持有的产品回归常价格状态。 
  
 但我们都知道，有两种资产的比总是会围绕一个固定的值流动的呢？更常见的情况是，两种资产各有不同的发展轨迹。性的比价分离。这种比价的实质而永久的变动，就会把LP的无常损失变成永恒损失。 
  
 长期来比如 
  
 ETH，随着价值的提高，会发生的，喷射式的变化，那么当它的水平一个新的台阶，ETH / USDC的价格就永远的。不去，价格比方过早被动低价卖掉而导致的无常损失就被固定下来，获得了永恒的损失。 
  
 随着项目的走向失败，会爆发式的，持续的消失，当它的价格变成了一个新的台阶，XXX/USDC的也永远不回。常损失造成了这个严重的损失。

body: Decentralized finance, or DeFi, is a system by which financial products become available on a public decentralized blockchain network. That makes them open to anyone to use, rather than going through middlemen like banks or brokerages. Unlike a bank or brokerage account, a government-issued ID, Social Security number, or proof of address are not necessary to use DeFi. More specifically, DeFi refers to a system by which software written on blockchains makes it possible for buyers, sellers, lenders, and borrowers to interact peer to peer or with a strictly software-based middleman rather than a company or institution facilitating a transaction.

title: 掘金指南
body:
作为一个野生的数字货币从业者，经常会发一些投资感想和心得，以长文的形式。原来一直在微博里写，可能有的朋友是在公众号里写，可是由于你懂的原因，很多文字没法写出来，以至于各种谐音代替，很不畅快。除了政策受限原因，微博还是一个纯粹的Web2.0中心化社交平台，你写出来的文字，你却不拥有掌控权，也几乎不享有著作收益，而却为平台提供了流量。

那么区块链时代的来临，将这一行为方式彻底地改变。我认为，从短文字（推特），长文字（Medium），短视频（tiktok），长视频（youtube）等创作/社交平台，都可以逐一地映射到区块链上，也就是说在Web3.0上，将这些应用再做一遍，逐渐形成一个元宇宙的底层基础设施。

「元宇宙初阶原住民掘金指南」——为什么起这个名字，为什么写这个文章，也是一时兴起，由近日所有币民追逐的NFT高达作品-Mekaverse受到启发，来简单讲一讲，如何成为一个合格的元宇宙原住民，并做好哪些准备。

近日高达NFT的热抢，改变了之前大多数NFT项目首发mint引发以太坊gas飙升的方式。项目方设置了很多苛刻条件防止黄牛/科学家抢号。其中一个就是需要关联你的推特，或者discord（的士高）。

**掘金指南**

第一步，科学上网（本来想把第一步写成熟练的电脑操作技巧，会用chrome浏览器或者熟练使用MacOS系统等😓）众所周知，科学上网后可以满足你几乎全部的对世界的探索（无论是正向的还是黑暗的），但是我觉得应该90%的朋友都是利用其达到正向的学习目的。比如谷歌，比如维基百科，比如区块链世界。shadowsocks的付费服务+ClashX客户端（MacOS）+shadowrocket（iOS客户端，俗称小火箭）是我目前的配置。

第二步，App Store美区账号或港区账号。方便你下载各种交易所，钱包，行情软件，VPN，谷歌全家桶等各种必需App。

第三步，境外电话卡（可选，有更好）如+82的香港电话卡等，可方便注册海外社交平台，可接收验证码

第四步，推特ID（必需）-推特作为区块链世界的大本营，全世界最高热度的社交平台，拥有全部顶级大v，全部项目方的一手消息，比如musk，jack，wood等等等。如果你没有账号，或者说没有长期看懂推特大V的meme语言习惯，感受每个项目每个NFT的热度，那你还不是一个及格的原住民。随后，推特也成为了很多项目方空投糖果，或是注册项目的必备门槛，所以有一个养护优良的推特是必需的。

第五步，discord（必需）-的士高目前已经是区块链世界的第一大社区，所有项目方都会在的士高上建立一个大本营，比如这次火爆的高达NFT的的士高社区人数已经超过20万人。所以注册且学会如何使用的士高也是一个必备技能。

展开两个类似的产品，一是电报，即telegram，我个人感觉属于即时通讯的天花板，秒杀微信100倍？早前也算是各个项目方的大本营，不过也许因为功能性差异，仿佛现在用的人越来越少了。二是美国版本百度贴吧Reddit，比如今年年初爆火华尔街的GME散户爆空事件的大本营，就是在Reddit里爆发。不过，我个人是几乎没用过这个平台。

Reddit x GME

不过，无论是Discord还是Reddit，也都还是Web2.0的社交平台，从本质上讲，是不是web3的平台，直观地就看是不是要链接你的小狐狸钱包，仅仅用邮箱手机号注册的都是2.0平台。那么从现在到未来，会有类似MaskNetwork这种链接2.0和3.0的中间件的诞生，使推特可以变成一个伪3.0平台。然后，就是我上述所说的，从短文字到长视频，都分别会有正统的Web3.0平台诞生。

第六步：小狐狸钱包（必备）这个我不想多讲了，好像在讲1+1=2，无论是存储，交易，链上交互和空投，都是必备的。且推荐多账户，至少5个，多则十几到几十个。

小狐狸是以太坊主网钱包，也支持BSC，ETH layer2等其他网络。其他的类似Solana平台推荐幻影钱包（Phantom），因为Solana链快速且费用低廉，推荐注册10个以上。Solana的NFT生态有不错的赚钱效应；其相关的借贷等项目，也可以适当交互，等空投的机会。

第七步：讲完小狐狸钱包（链上软件钱包），可以再加一个硬件钱包，如onekey，保证你的链上资产更加安全。

第八步：链上资产。链上资产是一个非常有意思的东西，我管它叫生钱罐。什么意思呢，就是把某个币，或者某个NFT放在链上，就有被该项目方，或者其他项目方空投的可能性，说人话就是白送你钱。从最早的代币开始说，例如你在Uniswap交互过，就会收到UNI代币。你持有sushi，就会收到有些项目的airdrop奖励等。现在各大著名NFT项目，只要你的钱包里有这个项目的NFT，人家项目方就来给你送钱了，这些钱少则几千，多则百万，也印证了那句话，区块链世界的钱不是赚来的，是大风刮来的。

所以现在很多玩家，把一个钱包里的同一个项目的NFT作品，换到另一个钱包中去，等待未来项目方也许空投的机会。比如Punks，Ape，企鹅等著名NFT项目，都有空投（暴富）的案例。

第九步：CEX账户，这个也不想多说了。做二级交易，还是CEX中心化交易所顺手一些，火币人家都不带中国人玩了，那你币安账户，FTX账户是不是都要有，都起码完成个二级KYC认证。

第十步：境外银行账户，方便你把USDT换成USD后出金。大多数币民用不到。

第十一步：opensea NFT平台。世界最大的NFT交易平台。

第十二步：以太坊各二层网络，俗称layer2，L2.

也都要和你的小狐狸进行交互，等未来的空投。

第十三步：链闻

链闻是中国最好的区块链资讯获取平台，有几乎全部项目、各个生态的最及时的快讯，和一些独家深度。能做到每天看，常看常新，如果你真的对这些有兴趣，那你一定会喜欢看。我们到不要求你真的看懂底层技术，我也不是学编程的。计算机语言，区块链底层技术我也一窍不通。但是通过看这些资讯，你能知道有什么赛道，每个赛道的龙头是什么，这个项目技术牛，那个项目市场公关强，那个项目能拉盘，NFT是咋回事，现在市场热钱在哪，链上数据是不是很好看，什么是PlanB，等等，就非常厉害了。起码你回到村里，和你的初中同学喝酒的时候，能把他们讲到桌子底下。

想到哪里，写到哪里，犹如泉涌，写作也是一种快乐。今天先写到这里，诸多疏漏，抛砖引玉，请各位大神指教。

同时，也欢迎更多的圈中朋友，来到3.0世界进行写作创作。

这个国庆节，北京下了六天雨，我没有出去旅行，却在朋友圈看尽了祖国山川，每天在家花时间看项目，撸币，玩NFT，买SHIB，看项目使我内心充愉，赚钱使我快乐富足，还不够吗？

\-END-

title: NFTeach 1.0 - DAOs and How Society Will Change
body:
You may have seen the term used casually in a Tweet.

Or, maybe you heard your weird friend who does nothing but talk about pixelated JPEGS utter the phrase at that party a week ago.

You may have come across the acronym in a Discord server while you were right-click saving millions worth of art right into that “portfolio” folder on your desktop.

**But, what the hell is a DAO? Why does it matter? And, most importantly, why should you care?**

I have provided several resources for you below so you can explore the wonderful world of DAOs. These resources are organized in order of depth on the topic. Several examples of DAOs are included at the bottom of the list. I will leave much of the explanation to those who are more sophisticated and eloquent than I, but here’s a brief appetizer to put you in the proper emotional and digestive state so you can dive in.

## DAOs Will Change the World

A **Distributed Autonomous Organization**, or DAO, is a paradigm shift in how we define ownership, organizational design, and community governance. There are a number of applications already in the market today and many more are waiting to be dreamt of and implemented in the future.

> From art, to business, to social capital, DAOs have cemented themselves as a cornerstone of the emerging ownership economy that favors **partnership** and **cooperation** rather than transactional relationships and value extraction.

Very simply put, DAOs enable ownership. Think about owning a share of Apple stock. As the holder of that digital stock certificate, you *own* a piece of Apple. You have the right to vote on company initiatives, and you may benefit from increases in the company’s value or dividends that may be issued.

A DAO creates **tokens** that are analogous to those Apple stock certificates. Those tokens can be either fungible tokens (interchangeable assets that may be used to transact like paper currency or Bitcoin) or non-fungible tokens (one-of-a-kind artworks or assets).

Alright, so now your primed and ready to go. The bread and butter is nothing but crumbs. Time for the main course.

## Resources - Read, Learn, Think

## DAO Basics

### A beginner’s guide to DAOs - Linda Xie

The industry standard for learning the basics.

[https://linda.mirror.xyz/Vh8K4leCGEO06_qSGx-vS5lvgUqhqkCz9ut81WwCP2o](https://linda.mirror.xyz/Vh8K4leCGEO06_qSGx-vS5lvgUqhqkCz9ut81WwCP2o)

### A DAO Defined: The Big Picture

An important philosophical step on your DAO journey, provided by the team at [Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject).

[https://blog.aragon.org/a-dao-defined-the-big-picture/](https://blog.aragon.org/a-dao-defined-the-big-picture/)

### How to DAO: Answers for Beginners

A simple FAQ from the team at [Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject). Consider this your quick reference guide.

[https://blog.aragon.org/how-to-dao-answers-for-beginners/](https://blog.aragon.org/how-to-dao-answers-for-beginners/)

## DAO Deeper

### The Defiant

A comprehensive article from [The Defiant](https://twitter.com/DefiantNews)’s Kevin Nielsen on the current DAO landscape.

[https://thedefiant.io/what-is-a-dao-mapping-out-the-ecosystem/](https://thedefiant.io/what-is-a-dao-mapping-out-the-ecosystem/)

### The Dao of DAOs - Packy McCormick

[Packy](https://twitter.com/packyM), a legend in the NFT space, discusses technology, decentralization, and evaluates the competitive advantages of DAOs.

[https://www.notboring.co/p/the-dao-of-daos](https://www.notboring.co/p/the-dao-of-daos)

### DAO Landscape - Coopahtroopah

If you want to learn more about DAOs, you will be hard-pressed to find a thought-leader more knowledgeable than [Coopahtroopah](https://twitter.com/Cooopahtroopa).

[https://coopahtroopa.mirror.xyz/_EDyn4cs9tDoOxNGZLfKL7JjLo5rGkkEfRa_a-6VEWw](https://coopahtroopa.mirror.xyz/_EDyn4cs9tDoOxNGZLfKL7JjLo5rGkkEfRa_a-6VEWw)

### 

## DAO Deeper Still

### A Taxonomy of Voting Methods - Aragon

[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject) presents this is a primer on several methods of voting that may exist within a DAO. This is not an exhaustive list, but is a good start.

[https://blog.aragon.org/a-taxonomy-of-voting-methods/](https://blog.aragon.org/a-taxonomy-of-voting-methods/)

### Maker DAO Whitepaper

A detailed manifesto from [Maker DAO](https://twitter.com/MakerDAO), the ambitious project founded in 2014 creating digital-native currency.

[https://makerdao.com/en/whitepaper/#abstract](https://makerdao.com/en/whitepaper/#abstract)

## DAO Examples

### Fingerprints DAO

[https://www.fingerprintsdao.xyz/](https://www.fingerprintsdao.xyz/)

### Bankless DAO

[https://www.bankless.community/mission](https://www.bankless.community/mission)

### Planetary DAO

[https://punkscomic.com/planetdao.html](https://punkscomic.com/planetdao.html)

### Friends with Benefits

[https://www.fwb.help/](https://www.fwb.help/)

### Surf Finance

[https://blog.aragon.org/how-to-start-a-hedge-fund-from-your-bedroom/](https://blog.aragon.org/how-to-start-a-hedge-fund-from-your-bedroom/)

### NFTeach 1.0 - Epilogue

Thanks for reading, I hope you have a better understanding of how powerful DAOs can be and the ways in which they will change our economy, culture, and governance.

Please reach out to me [@thepeffrey](https://twitter.com/thepeffrey), I’d love to hear from you and start a conversation.

*This is the first edition of **NFTeach**, a series in which we’ll explore various topics that will help you become a more educated member of the NFT community. I don’t have all (or most) of the answers and I am nowhere close to an expert. I’m just curious and passionate about the space and want to share what I’ve learned. Let’s change the world, together. WGMI.*

A DAO creates **tokens** that are analogous to those Apple stock certificates. Those tokens can be either fungible tokens (interchangeable assets that may be used to transact like paper currency or Bitcoin) or non-fungible tokens (one-of-a-kind artworks or assets).

Alright, so now your primed and ready to go. The bread and butter is nothing but crumbs. Time for the main course.

title: mirror | rorrim：通过写作认识你自己
body:
> “自己”这个东西是看不见的，撞上一些别的什么，反弹回来，才会了解“自己”。 所以，跟很强的东西、可怕的东西、水准很高的东西相碰撞，然后才知道“自己”是什么。 ——山本耀司

mirror的中文是镜子，一个写作平台为何以镜子命名，外人或许觉得这可能就是创始人随手想的，但一个写作者第一次看到这个名字的时候，会有一种「我懂你」的会心一笑，写作是一个人的镜子，得以在一片黑暗中借着事件闪光让你看到你自己。

一个人是无法真正了解自己，他的眼睛被偏见充斥，他的耳朵被傲慢填满，他的脑子里贪嗔痴疑慢横行，唯独没有位置留给「自己」，人就是这样一个的高等的智慧生物，似乎每一个智慧都有着独立的智慧，运行着楞次定律，和已有的智慧抱团，却拒绝新来的智慧，故所以人的成长必须得靠事件来推动，楞次定律像一道门，像一道壁垒，而事件负责带来改变，改变发生在何处？成长的外在表现千奇百怪，但内在表现就一个，那就是打开了那道门，破掉了那个壁垒。

事件突破壁垒的方式可以不同，水滴石穿型，恍然大悟型，亦或水滴石穿到恍然大悟，而大多数的时候，事件闪光不能破掉壁垒帮助你认识自己的原因，不是因为事件闪得不够亮不够光，而是你自己视而不见，而此时写作便如回忆中的镜子，让你想起来，让你在回忆中找到细节，进而理解自己为何物，当初为什么要那样做，一切都有迹可循。

有点意识流了，举一个例子说明，我曾经是非常害怕踏空的一个人，现在还会，害怕踏空让我在交易里做出了很多错误的选择和决定，并在实际中蒙受了很多的亏损，害怕踏空在上涨中买入，害怕利润回测在下跌中卖出，在同一个坑了反复横跳，每一次亏钱后我都会痛定思痛，但思痛后并不改痛，下次遇到那个坑，仿佛着了魔似的，明知是坑却飞蛾扑火。

在心理学里，有一个斯德哥摩尔综合症，又称为人质情结，是一种心理学现象，是指被害者对于加害者产生情感，在投资领域「韭菜」之所以反复追涨杀跌，本质原因就是中了斯德哥摩尔病，人是有自我防卫机制的，当人处于极端痛苦的时候，身体会做很多外人不明的动作来保护自己，因为2017年的时候，我踏空了一轮牛市，当时极端痛苦，所以身体为了防止我再次进入这么痛苦的情景（害怕我自杀吧），所以每一次当我认为牛市又要来的时候，简化成当我每一次认为要涨的时候，身体就会自动启动买入的执行机制，身体不会管你的判断是否正确，它只懂得要保护你，如果不买入又触发了踏空的痛苦，你和身体又要煎熬了。

所以为什么「老韭菜」明知不可追涨却仍要追涨的原因就在这里，每个人都有过踏空的心理创伤，如果不和自己的这个心理创伤和解，我们一辈子都没办法跳过踏空陷阱。你是没办法和自己真正为敌的，尤其是你的身体本质上来说是你的至亲队友，它所作所为都在保护你生命周全，只不过为了这个保护需要牺牲很多，例如你的钱，看起来你身体里确实有个你，在视金钱为粪土。

如果你没办法和自己和解，「韭菜行为」就一定没办法解决，不信你完全可以试试其他办法，反正一生很长，试试就试试呗，我对自己说过不要追涨，我写过对自己不要追追涨，我把字写下来贴在电脑桌前，这些都是有用的对「主我」来说，但这些对「副我」是无效的，**「副我」只要认为踏空会带来痛苦，就他妈地一定会给你发出“买入啊！”“杀啊！”“等什么！”的信号。**

我是什么时候真正开始做到不追涨不杀跌的呢？就是在写下《③：投资的目标是赚钱，但让你来投资的是认识你自己》，我和自己进行了反复地对话，最后认识到了没有敌人在害我，是我自己在保护自己，于是我选择了原谅了自己，原谅了父母，最后能安抚「副我」，对，哪怕是成长到如此，我也是只能做到安抚「副我」，不过够用了，安抚之后起码我能做到不追涨了。

就像戒烟会有戒断反应，哪怕是戒烟很久的老烟民也会在某一个深夜想起某人的睡不着时候，又恰好在抽屉里翻出一根烟的时候，忍不住想抽，刚戒烟的人可能会抽了再说，但老烟民同样想抽，但只是一想而过。戒撸是如此，当你看到辣椒酱上的陶碧华，视频里跳骚舞的小姐姐，进而顶起裤裆的时候，年轻气盛的小伙子可能就忍不住掏裤裆了，

第0天戒撸

第1天戒撸

第0天戒撸

二进制戒撸

老韭菜也是如此

第0天不追涨，踏空10%

第1天不追涨，踏空20%

第0天不追涨，昨天忍不住追了

二进制戒追涨

每一次看着那些错过的大绿柱，心里忍不住算了一下少赚多少钱的时候，「副我」就会出来

他说：“（主我）哥，要不要追进去，我怕你又很痛苦”

主我：“没问题的老弟，赚不到的说明不是我们的机会，下次做就好”

副我：“好的哥”

这样的对话多了，你会发现「副我」出来的次数会逐渐减少，为什么，是习惯了吗？确实是习惯了，打破二进制循环的，不是你习惯了踏空，而是「副我」知道了踏空你也不会怎么痛苦了，你不会自杀了，他信任你了，你们彼此之间建立了信任，他就不会出来在同一个问题提醒你了。

我不敢去相信另外一个平行宇宙，如果我没有写作，如果我没有和自己对话，我没有通过镜子看到那个赌性红眼的自己，我会落得一个什么下场，照亮自己的镜子，不一定得是文字，可以是想，可以是和他人对话，但一定得有“自己与自己对话”的环节，这样才是mirror | rorrim，在这之中，写作是最好的主动的方式。

追涨只是一个例子，交易的世界里，我们每个人都会因为过去的一些自己认为的“失败”，导致「副我」做出很多自我保护的动作，有些人是杀跌，有些人买山寨，最典型的赌徒循环是踏空一波主升浪后，很多人会去借钱加仓，会去加杠杆加仓，会去合约波段，却因为实力不够，最后一双赌眼看市场获得赌命的结局。在这过程中，「副我」始终是以保护你不要痛苦的目的在让你去加仓，你可以好好想想，每次加完仓后或者是合约开了一单后，你的逻辑其实不是我觉得要涨，所以我要这样做，而是**我觉得如果继续涨了我会痛苦，所以我要加仓，我要开合约，我不能错过。**

加仓和开合约的动作一完成，你会安心，你会松一口气，你的焦虑会得到缓解，为什么，是因为有利润吗，不是的，那是表象，很多时候哪怕是小亏，你也会觉得没问题，本质是「副我」执行了保护你的动作，他不在与主我对抗了，进而让你安心，但最后的结果往往不是赚钱。

这里要去思辩的另一个点是，很多人会反驳，不对，我有时候加完仓看到亏钱也会痛苦，这是为什么，这是亏损到一个临界值，「副我」又触发了杀跌痛苦的保护情绪，比如过去你因为某一次没有卖出导致大亏了，又异常痛苦，于是为了追求那个安心，「副我」又会让你执行卖出的操作，完成追涨杀跌的宿命，**「副我」从始至终都在保护你**，不过是买入还是卖出的操作，只不过它不管是不是高买低卖，它只知道涨的时候让你买入，跌的时候让你卖出都能让你安心。当然这个过程中「主我」有时候会执行强干预，例如某一次追涨了你抗单了，虽然你看到钱一直亏很痛苦，但是你一直说不动不动不动，你就会痛苦地持仓（因为主我和副我在对抗），这个痛苦什么时候会消失呢？

1. 你抗到对了，杀跌的情绪消失了，副我就会消失
2. 你扛到爆了，不存在杀跌了，副我也会消失

交易到最后每次都要问自己的问题就是，你在做正确的事情吗？你在做正确的事情还是让副我安心的事情，很多时候这两个问题一问就知道自己在做什么了。

很多人看完此文又会把结论总结为，以后我都不要追涨杀跌了，这又是走向另外一个极端的做法了，追涨之所以是错误的是因为他的让你赚钱的概率只有1/3，杀跌同理，正确的做法应该是有方法地追涨，你得让自己追的那个涨是可以让你赚钱的1/3的那个涨，至于如何做，看个人本事了。

另外文中使用的主我和副我，只是为了区分意识和潜意识，或者说你和你的本能，或者你和你的身体，或者系统1和系统2，不管怎么称呼都行，你能意识到是有那么两个东西在你自己里，就像照镜子的你，一个是你，一个是镜子中的自己，他们都是你。

如果要把交易分为三个境界，看山是山，看山不是山，看山还是山，第三个境界就是学会认识自己，学会与镜中人和平相处，交易的市场是嗜血的原始森林，如果一个人猎人在内心里就把力量消耗在对抗镜中人，那么他一定没有过多的力量在市场里捕猎，进而猎人变猎物。

title: How To Live In The Metaverse
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dFymFaCU2Fhyd-Wio5mIU.jpeg?height=2048&width=2048)

The first tools intended for wide-scale metaverse exploration came from Second Life developer Linden Lab. They were called "Viewer" clients which allowed users to interact with Second Life avatars and their digital content.

These "Viewer" clients were the first point of entrance for real-time social VR, but there was another piece missing: A world that made practical sense.

Last month, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg presented his vision of the future – one in which everyone will have their own virtual reality experience, from which they'll no longer "need" a real-life identity. However, some academics and journalists see it differently.

The idea that our 'real' body might become irrelevant isn't a new one. In fact, it's been a particularly prevalent subject of sci-fi stories for decades, ever since Philip K. Dick first posed the question: "What is human?" It's an interesting question, but to answer it requires a lot of context about who we are and what we've been doing for the last 50,000 years.

The most interesting of these stories acknowledge that we can never fully separate corporeal and virtual identities. The ones where people upload their consciousness to a computer and discard their bodies entirely are more like wishful fantasies than anything else. After all, the simple fact of being physical has been intrinsic to our identities from a time too distant for us ever to remember.

In other words: "The metaverse isn't a virtual world, it's an augmented one," as wrote Mike Elgan in a recent blog post .

Even as we become increasingly mobile and less 'tethered' to one place or another, our identities will remain firmly embedded in the world around us. We'll still rely on those human relationships for validation, friendship, inspiration – perhaps even more so than today.

Many of us spend all day plugged into an online world – but we're still unavoidably attached to our bodies. The promise of the metaverse is something far more simple; it gives users ownership of their identity and their digital assets, and shifts our paradigm of understanding around what holds value in shared universes. It weakens the chokehold that Facebook as a monopoly has over the internet, where the promise of digital freedom has been entirely replaced by walled gardens and centralization, eschewing the rights of individuals and embracing the power of corporations.

# The real question is: how might a virtual world augment that?

The metaverse isn't inherently a virtual world where all human thought and experience are contained. It's not an exclusively visual space that perfectly simulates our current reality or a new, better reality of our own design. The metaverse is the entire sum of data ever produced by humanity – every photo, video, file, book, message, conversation. It's the Library of Congress multiplied by every library in existence. It's a catalog of everything that is, was, and could be expressed by our species.

We can see ourselves as a species in two very broad strokes: We're tool builders, and we're social animals. At any given time throughout history, the vast majority of us have been farmers or hunters. We've built tools to make our jobs easier, and we've banded together into communities for protection against other groups of humans (and the natural world). The metaverse doesn't change that paradigm; it simply extends it into non-physical spaces.

In fact, as writers like David Brin have pointed out , the metaverse will make those communities more diverse and expansive. Those who don't want to participate in a virtual reality at all can still benefit from all its other benefits – from online banking to video conferencing. They'll be able to interact with their fellow humans without ever logging into the metaverse themselves. We will live in it, even if we don't live in it.

The metaverse promises something else. It offers us total freedom on a personal level, but what this means for society is something far more complicated. Although individuals will be able to make their own choices about how they interact with each other, it might require some kind of social contract (akin to Net Neutrality) in order to prevent an oligopoly where a few companies come to own large portions of the metaverse.

I'm not talking about an actual transformation in the nature of reality here. In Zuckerberg's dream of things to come (which he outlined at last week's Oculus Connect 3 conference), we'll be able to 'wear' our fake identities in the form of wearable headsets, which will give us the ability to inhabit virtual spaces away from our real-life ones.

And when I refer to these imaginary identities as 'fake', I'm not being pejorative. It's a flashy, commercial pipe dream with little appeal for the average user - most folks have zero interest in plugging into Zuckerberg's data harvesting, twisted, ad-driven Matrix.

# The metaverse as our homeworld

It's not that the metaverse doesn't currently exist, it's just that until now, it only existed in the form of sci-fi novels, computer games, and chatrooms until William Gibson came along and gave it a name. The word alone isn't what conjured its existence into being. It was our behavior and our willingness to reimagine ourselves in the virtual space.

This means that what you're doing right now could be considered to exist within this expanded definition of the metaverse. Web3 simply shifts the value proposition. In a world where we can't trust the companies who store our information, and where our personal data is collected by shadowy social media companies, living in the new metaverse won't be about taking an observer's seat for another Facebook controlled experience, it will be about taking full ownership and responsibility for who we are, what we make, what we say and what we consume.

The thing that it gives us control over is ourselves. We're not giving up anything when we participate in Web3, but rather gaining the world. The danger lies in our willingness to give up that control again after Web3 has become mainstream.

We can imagine a future where companies like Facebook could be forced to adopt the same standards as Blockchain technology, following an open-source ethos where people are free to use their systems but equally free to change them. This might look like a decentralized Internet with user-owned and controlled data that can't be harvested by corporations for their own ends.

The metaverse has been held in place by a slowly-fraying umbilical cord of networking and technological progress. At its heart is Moore's Law and Metcalfe's Law: One predicts that the number of transistors in a dense integrated circuit will double roughly every two years and the other states that the value of a network is proportional to the square of the number of connected users.

These two laws define the evolution of both digital content and our global telecommunications infrastructure. They underpin today's Information Economy, which is the foundation for twenty-first-century society as we know it, day in and day out. And they will unlock a complete rewrite of our digital identities.

The key is to understand that the metaverse is a vision of a community-directed and operated cyberspace – and it's one that we can already see beginning to take shape – not its own universe. The main reason why this point is important, and why it sometimes gets ignored, is because cyberspace and existing concepts like the Cloud are frequently conflated.

You'll need to chart your own path through this brave new world and follow the example of those who have been doing so from day one. The rules are still being written for how we're going to live in this environment, but there are people out there who have already mapped the possibilities.

It's worth stressing that this is still in its infancy and that it will take time for any kind of convincing metaverse experience to be made widely available to consumers. But when it does become possible, how will you engage with it? And what would your life be like without limits?
